loans.name: Nusrat's Group

texts.en:
Nusrat lives in Lahore, the second largest city in Pakistan and known for its history and culture. She lives in the area named Shalimar with her family in a two-room brick house. She came here after her marriage.

Her husband’s name is M. W. and he is a motor mechanic who runs a motor workshop. He has 12 years of experience in his work and has a good technical knowledge of his business. He can repair every kind of vehicle and people approach him and trust him for his good and quality work.

Nusrat is a very supportive lady and supports her family financially by making artificial jewelry. She receives orders from different jewelry shops and makes jewelry on order to earn an income for the family. She also has a part-time business selling clothes to her neighboring clients. She has four daughters and a son. All of her children are very young and getting their education, except for the youngest who is four years old.

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to help her husband in his business. He will invest the loan in purchasing the latest repair tools for his motor workshop to provide better quality services to his clients and finish repairing orders on time. Nusrat is hopeful that a loan investment will make her husband’s business more profitable and help her family achieve a better standard of living.

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her fifth loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained good credit behavior and attended every meeting.

Note: In the photo, the lady who is raising her hand is Nusrat.

loans.use: To buy the latest repair tools for a motor workshop business.

loans.name: Otgonsuren

texts.en:
Otgonsuren L. is 46 years old and a single mother and lives with her three sons in Huvsgul province, Mongolia. Her oldest son is a university student, and her twin sons attend a local high school. Otgonsuren supports her family by operating a grocery trading business in her town. She sells a variety of food products and fruits. She started her business in 1994, selling only flour. 

After years of successful operation, she was able to expand her product line by selling a variety of foodstuffs and fruits since 2004 and has built up a stable operation. Her earnings have enabled her not only to pay her son's tuition fees but also to provide her family. 

Otgonsuren is a modest and hardworking woman and is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan to purchase more varieties of grocery products in order to expand her product line.

loans.use: To purchase more varieties of grocery products

loans.name: Maria De Las Nieves

texts.es:
Maria de la Nieves es socia del Banco comunal Gotitas de amor, es casada, tiene 46 años y  7 hijos.
Maria de la Nieves es feriante, aprendió de este negocio de una amiga,  viaja a la feria de Tambo, ahí vende ropa para damas caballeros y niños y le va bien.
El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de ropas para surtir.
Le gusta las reuniones de su Banco Comunal porque puede acceder a los créditos y puede ahorrar.
Su sueño es que su negocio crezca y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Maria de la Nieves is a member of the 'Gotitas de Amor' community bank.  She is married, 46 years old, and has 7 children.

Maria de la Nieves is a market trader and learned the business from a friend.  She travels to Tambo market and there she sells women's, men's and children's clothes.  Her business is doing well.

Maria de las Nieves will invest the loan she is requesting in buying clothes to stock her business.  She likes her community bank meetings because they allow her to access loans and to save.  Her dream is for her business to grow and for her children to become professionals.

loans.use: To buy a variety of clothes

loans.name: Bonavanture

texts.en:
Bonavanture is 31 years old and is married with five children between the ages 1 and 14 years old.  Bonavanture is a self-employed businessman who sells cassava flour.  His shop is open from 7 a.m. until 7 p.m. every day and he has been working in the business for five years. He is an ambitious man.

Bonavanture will use this loan to purchase a large quantity of cassava flour.  With this large quantity, he will also start wholesaling. He hopes to earn more profit to help provide for his family and to save in the future.

loans.use: To buy more cassava flour to sell

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama N. W. is married and has five dependents. Her husband is a farmer. 

For 20 years, Ama has been smoking fish for sale at Elmina. She uses her income to assist her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. 

She is asking for the loan to buy an extra quantity of fresh fish to smoke for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, she plans to buy land.

loans.use: To buy fresh fish to smoke for sale

loans.name: Mamadou

texts.fr: Mamadou N. est âgé  de 39 ans .Il est marié et s'active dans la vente de matériaux de quincaillerie (boulon ,vice)il bénéficie de plusieurs années d'expériences dans ce secteur. Il collabore avec un magasin à Mbour qui lui fournis de la marchandise et lui disposant de sa propre voiture livre la marchandise directement à ses clients ce qui élimine d'office la concurrence car souvent le client achète et supporte les frais de transport. C'est une activité très rentable et qui lui permet de payer sans difficultés aucune
texts.en: Mamadou N. is 39 years old. He is married and works selling hardware items . He has (bolts, nuts). He has many years of experience in this sector. He collaborates with a store in Mbour where he gets his merchandise. Having his own car, he delivers the merchandise directly to clients, which gives him a competitive edge, since   clients often pay for  goods and delivery. This is a very profitable activity, which allows him to repay his loans without any difficulty.

loans.use: Retail

loans.name: Hakim Mubarik Ali's Group

texts.en:
Hakim lives in the small Pakistani city of Kot Radha Kishan, which is famous for its dairy industry. She has lived in the area of Rawal Jhangerh in a three-roomed brick house with her family for the past 30 years. She doesn’t have any children and spends her time carrying out her household responsibilities. Her husband’s name is M. A. and he takes lands on contract to grow different seasonal crops and vegetables. Basically, he is a farmer by profession. He has been engaged in this business for 25 years and has vast experience.
Hakim has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband who wants to invest in his business. With the loan, he will buy seeds and fertilizers to grow seasonal crops and to earn more profits from his work. Hakim is a very religious person and has a firm belief in her God that after investing the loan, if her husband works hard, he will definitely gain more profits from his business.
Hakim is a regular loan user of Asasah. She never gives any cause for complaint and always pays her loan installments on time. This is her sixth loan application.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds for growing seasonal crops

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
Marie is 28 years old and she is married with three children aged between 2 and 9 years old. Marie’s husband is a businessman, and they do the same business. Marie owns a business selling mobile phones.

Marie has now requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company for the purpose of increasing her business by purchasing various styles of mobile phones to attract more customers. The increased business will help her to earn more profits, which will allow her to resolve the problems she has.

loans.use: To buy more mobile phones to sell.

loans.name: Juana Maria

texts.es: La señora Juana Maria A. F.  , tiene la edad de 37 años , habitante del municipio de Ticuantepe , junto a su esposo que le apoya con los gastos del hogar , doña Juana desde hace cuatro años labora como auxiliar de farmacia en el hospital de Ticuantepe  , con mucho esfuerzo y el de su esposo han logrado mejora de la vivienda , se siente contenta por el apoyo que le brinda Kiva atrávez de Afodenic , ya que los intereses son bajos y eso le permite adquirir un crédito para tener una mejor condición de vida  ya que con su salario cada mes no le ajusta para comprar de una sola vez todos los materiales de construcción que le pide el maestro de obra para iniciar la obra . Con el crédito quiere comprar bloques, cemento, arena,  hierro, estribos, clavos, entre otros.
texts.en:
Mrs. Juana María A. F., 37, lives in the town of Ticuantepe with her husband who helps with household expenses.

Juana has been employed as a Pharmacy Aide at the Ticuantepe Hospital for the last four years.  With much effort of her own and of her husband they have managed to do some home improvements.  

She feels happy for the help Kiva provides her through Afodenic because interest rates are low and that allows her to get a loan to have better living conditions because her monthly salary isn’t sufficient to buy all the building materials and supplies that the master builder asks for to start the project all at once.  

She will use the loan to buy concrete blocks, cement, sand, iron rods, struts and nails, among others.

loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies

loans.name: Hajidmaa

texts.en:
Hajidmaa P. is a 41-year-old widow who lives with her son, Batzaya, in their own house in the Arhangai province of Mongolia. Her husband died in 2007. 

She manages a goods-trading business in her town. She started her business in 2000 with working capital of 350,000 MNT. With 11 years of stable business operation she gained much experience and expanded her business. She travels to China once or twice a month in order to import her goods. 

Recently she opened a hair salon in her town. She built a strong customer base and customers are happy with her polite and quick service. Now her working capital has reached 2,800,000 MNT. 

She is a polite woman who says."Being polite is number one importance for business success." 

She is requesting a 2,100,000 MNT loan to purchase a collection of goods from China.

loans.use: to purchase a collection of goods from China

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mrs. Mercy E. is 41 years of age, married, and a resident of Migpangi, Bonifacio, Mis. Occ. She and her husband have six children, of whom four are already married and the rest are still single and at their adolescent stage. 

The couple has been engaged in fishing as owners and operators of a fishing boat locally known as “Sakayan.” For over 30 years, they’ve been in this kind of business to support the family. At this time they are earning an average net income of not less than PHP 4,000. 

She joined PAGLAUM MPC 1 year ago because she is very much interested in our products and services. As a second cycle loaner with a good credit record, she has requested PHP 7,000 to purchase additional fishing nets and other fishing supplies. 

The future income from this loan will be used to meet their daily needs, to repay the loan and to save for the future. She is hoping that this project will yield a good catch with God’s help.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and fishing supplies.

loans.name: Laurita

texts.en:
Laurita is 69 years old and married with two children. Laurita works very hard to provide for them. She  buys and sells "Nipa" (palm leaves) in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more palm leaves to sell.

Laurita has been in this business for 16 years.

In the future Laurita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more palm leaves to sell.

loans.name: Solitario Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama “Solitario”, se encuentra en el estado D. México en México. El grupo esta conformado por 9 integrantes. 

Natalia es la presidenta del grupo. Tiene 46 años, estudio hasta el sexto año D. primaria, es comerciante. Ella se dedica a la venta D. verdura que inicio hace 10 años y solicita el prestamo para invertir en su negocio ya que tiene muchos clientes y diariamente necesitan verduras para su comida. 

Al solicitar este prestamo las señoras se sienten muy contentas ya que estaban muy necesitaban el apoyo para poder solventar sus gastos para la temporada. Sus clientes nos cuentan que les gusta comprarle por que siempre tiene limpia y fresca sus verduras y es muy amable al atenderlos. 

La señora Natalia desea este prestamo para poder invertir en materias primas. Con esto esperan poder incrementar sus ventas y en consecuencias sus ganacias porque sus perspectivas son buenas y productivas al querer ampliar su negocio y tambien tener dentro D. sus posibilidades el poder pagar el prestamo que se le dará. También desea con las gananciasd ahorrar para apoyar a su familia en los gastos economicos y en lo que necesite su familia.
texts.en:
This group is called “Solitario” (Solitaire) and is located in the Mexican state of México.  The group has 9 members.  

Natalia is the group's President.  She’s 46 years old and completed 6th graD.; she’s a merchant.  She started selling vegetables 10 years ago and is asking for the loan to invest in her business since she has many customers who need vegetables daily for their meals.

While requesting this loan the women feel very happy because they were quite needy of support to meet their expenses for the season.  Their customers tell us that they like to buy from her because her vegetables are always clean and fresh and she is very kind to them.

Natalia wants the loan to invest in raw materials.  They hope with it to increase sales and consequently profits because their prospects are good and productive in wanting to expand their business as well as having repaying the loan within their possibilities.  She also hopes to use profits to save in order to help her family with expenses and whatever else they may need.

loans.use: to buy vegetables.

loans.name: Wokulira Development Group

texts.en:
Sarah is 45 years old and has been running a grocery store in Mukono for the past seven years. She mostly sells watermelon, pineapples, soft drinks, and other items. The mother of six says that she has learned a great deal about many business fundamentals during this time. Her business goal is to find ways to improve and expand her business. Sarah has used her good relationship skills and work ethic to make significant strides. She believes that her business prospects will continue to expand as long as she maintains her unwavering attitude. Sarah says that she was prevailed upon by her husband to start her business. Prior to that, she made ends meet through teaching. She has not dispensed with teaching, although the remuneration for teachers in Uganda is not something one can talk of in the highest of terms. Sarah’s weekly profits are approximately 60,000 UGX.

Sarah will use her portion of her Kiva loan to purchase more pineapples, jakefruit, watermelon and soft drinks to sell at her grocery store.

loans.use: to purchase fruit and soft drinks to sell

loans.name: Nhorn

texts.en:
Nhorn, 42 years old, resides with her husband and children at Siem Reap province. She has been a farmer since 2008, earning US $2 per day. Her husband has been a policeman since 2000, earning US $10 per day. She has two children. One is a student and one is a construction worker, earning US $3 per day. 

Each month, she has to spend US $75 on food, US $15 on school fees and US $20 on transportation. 

Nhorn would like to ask for a loan of US $800 to purchase a motorbike for her husband to go to work and to the field. This loan will help her to reduce the costs of motor taxis and be convenient for her husband's career. 

In the future, she hopes to have a toilet for her house and she wants her children study at university.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her husband's work.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.fr:
Toujours en activité dans son atelier de réparation de machines à coudre, l’emprunteur est devenu, depuis la mort de son pére , le responsable de sa  famille composée de 10 personnes. Il est marié  et a trois enfants. Toutes les dépenses de la famille (location,  nourriture, éducation, santé,  factures d’eau et d’électricité) sont à sa charge pour un montant de  225 000 par mois. La famille vit dans la promiscuité si bien que 4 personnes dorment dans une seule pièce . 
Sa journée démarre très tôt à 6h 30  et il lui arrive de travailler toute la nuit lors des grandes fêtes. Il répare des machines à coudre en panne. Il achète aussi des machines neuves ou d’occasion chez des grossistes qu’il revend en détails aux tailleurs. Il a réussi à ouvrir une petite mercerie dont il a confié la gestion à sa petite soeur.Son activité a de relles opportunités pour reussir car le marché de la couture est tres large et la demande est forte aussi bien dans sa localité qu' à l'étranger.
. C'est pourquoi, il demande un crédit de 350 000f pour augmenter ses marchandises en achetant notamment 4 machines à coudre, du fils et des garnitures.Il n' a jamais sollicite de prêts à l'IMCEC bien que sociétaire de cette institution depuis 2008.
Les bénéfices tirés de ce financement pourront lui permettre  d’augmenter  et de diversifier les produits de sa mercerie, de se lancer dans la vente de pièces détachées de machine à coudre. Il pourra également mieux supporter les charges sociales de la famille qui pèsent lourd sur lui (location, alimentation, éducation …).
Son ambition est de générer assez de revenus pour se lancer dans l’importation de matériels et de fournitures pour la couture.Il reve de construire une maison pour y loger sa famille.
texts.en:
Always busy in his sewing machine repair workshop, the borrower became the head of his family of 10 people after the death of his father. He is married and has three children. All family expenses (rent, food, education, health, utilities) fall on his shoulders and amount to 225,000 francs a month. The family is living from hand to mouth, such that four people sleep in a single room. 

His day begins very early, at 6:30 am, and sometimes he works through the night when it is a big holiday. He repairs broken sewing machines and also buys new or used machines from wholesalers and then resells them retail to tailors. He has also managed to open a little sewing notions shop which he has  his little sister manage. His business has real opportunities to succeed since the market for tailored goods is very big and there is plenty of demand, in his own locality and elsewhere. 

This is why he is asking for a loan of 350,000 francs to grow his stock of merchandise by buying in particular four sewing machines, some thread, and accessories. He has never asked for a loan from IMCEC even though he has been a member since 2008. 

The profit from this loan will allow him to add to his stock and diversify the products in his sewing notions business and get into selling spare parts for sewing machines. He will also be able to deal better with family expenses, which are quite a burden for him (rent, food, education, etc.)

His ambition is  to generate enough income to get into importing sewing materials and supplies. He dreams of building a house for his family to live in.

loans.use: tp buy sewing machines, thread, and accessories.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a widow selling clothes and underwear at Kokoado, a village near Elmina in Cape Coat. She has 7 dependents. The income she makes from her sales is used to take care of her home. The loan will serve to buy more clothing and underwear. Mary plans to save towards acquiring a shop.

loans.use: to buy more clothes and underwear to sell.

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora is married and has four children. She is 38 years old and lives in Triunfo, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. To earn a living, Flora has a restaurant. Each month, she earns approximately 16,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP). 

Flora has requested a loan of 25,000 PHP to pay her children's tuition. Flora has been a member of PMPC for over two years. In the future, Flora would like her family to have a better standard of living.

loans.use: to pay her children's tuition

loans.name: Sheila

texts.en:
Sheila is 44 years old and married. She is from Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She is taking care of her 5 children. She owns and operates a retail store at home to earn a living. For 5 years of running the store, Sheila typically gets PHP 8,700 a month.

In 2007, Sheila joined GDMPC. The cooperative had approved her 9th loan application, of PHP 20,000, which will be used to buy additional products to sell such as grocery items, school and office supplies, etc. With the loan taken, Sheila hopes for further improvement of the business operations to gain more income.

loans.use: to buy additional products to sell such as grocery items, school and office supplies, etc.

loans.name: Umazi

texts.en:
Umazi is a married woman with nine children. Seven of her children attend school and two are adults. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past 10 years, she has operated a vegetable stall business, selling at the market to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality. During the summer hot season the availability of vegetables for resale is lower. She dreams of expanding her business in the future. 

With the KSHS 10,000, she wants to purchase sacks of vegetables for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Nchoke

texts.en:
Nchoke is 26 years old, married to Kateto, and they are blessed with three children aged between eight years old and nine months old. He has been selling milk for the past seven years. He has been loaned KES 30,000 which he plans to use to add more cattle for rearing and selling.

With the anticipated profit made he plans to open a ranch in Athi River, in the near future. He hopes to become a  KENYA CREAMERIES COMPANY  supplier in two years.

loans.use: to add more cattle for rearing and selling.

loans.name: Noubignon Group

texts.fr: Le groupe NOUBIGNON est formé de trois personnes qui habitent toutes dans le même quartier au Bénin. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Roseline Nadia, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. Roseline Nadia est âgée de 27 ans et est mariée à Sylvain, un tailleur. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. La famille vit ensemble dans la même maison. Roseline Nadia et son mari subviennent ensemble aux besoins du ménage. Pour y arriver, Roseline Nadia vend des chaussures et divers articles (conserves, sucre, lait, etc.) dans un marché du Bénin. Roseline Nadia s'approvisionne dans une ville du Bénin. Dans le but de rehausser leur activité et de mieux répondre à la demande de leur clientèle, Roseline Nadia et les autres membres du groupe NOUBIGNON sollicitent pour une deuxième fois, l'appui financier de ALIDé. Ce crédit leur servira à renforcer leur activité afin de mieux répondre à la demande de leur clientèle.
texts.en:
The group NOUBIGNON is comprised of three persons who all live in the same district in Benin. The group's representative is Roseline Nadia. In the photo, she is the one with her hand raised. She is 27 years old and married to Sylvain, a tailor. They have three children, who are all in school. The family lives together in the same house. 

Roseline Nadia and her husband jointly provide for the need of their home. To do so, Roseline Nadia sells footwear and a variety of items (canned foods, sugar, milk, etc.) at a market in Benin. She gets her supplies from a city in Benin. 

With the goal of boosting their business and responding better to the demands of their customers, Roseline Nadia and the other members of the group NOUBIGNON are requesting financial support from ALIDé for a second time. This loan will serve to bolster their business in order to respond better to customer demand.

loans.use: to buy shoes, boxes of sugar and milk, and some canned foods

loans.name: Clementina

texts.es:
La Señora. Clementina es socia del banco comunal San Vicente, vive por una comunidad que pertenece a la parroquia de la Victoria del Portete, este lugar es de clima frió y propicio por sus pampas para la cría de ganado, su población se dedica a la cría de animales, a la agricultura y muchos laboran en la ciudad de Cuenca en diferentes actividades, mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

La Señora Clementina tiene 66 años, es viuda pero en su unión conyugal ha concebido 7 hijos quienes son mayores de edad, casados e independientes. La casa en la que habita es de su propiedad siendo el sacrificio del trabajo en su juventud.

Doña Clementina se dedica a laborar en los quehaceres de su hogar y como pasa en casa se dedica a la agricultura que es solo para su consumo, también cría cuyes, gallinas y ganado los que los vende cuando tiene alguna necesidad económica. 

En el banco comunal es socia hace 2 años y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos.
 
Su meta es tener más animales.
texts.en:
Clementina is a member of the "San Vicente" communal bank.  She lives in a community that is part of the Victoria del Portete parish. This is a place with a cold climate, and because of its grasslands, it is suitable for raising livestock. The people who live there raise animals and farm. Many work in the city of Cuenca in various activities. They maintain the culture and traditions of their people.

Clementina is 66 and a widow, but she has seven children who are adults, married, and on their own.  She owns the house where she lives, and it represents the sacrifice and hard work of her youth.

Clementina works doing her household chores, and as she spends her time at home, she farms to supply her own needs.  She also raises guinea pigs, chickens, and livestock, that she sells when she has any financial need. She has been with the communal bank for two years, and she will use her new loan to buy chickens. Her goal is to have more animals.

loans.use: To buy chickens.

loans.name: Eliza

texts.en:
Eliza is a 45-year-old divorced woman with one child. She owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. 

She has been in the produce business for ten years. Her hardship is high transport charges and her vision is to own a big food store plus a good residential house.

Eliza needs the loan to buy maize and beans for resale.

loans.use: to buy maize and beans for resale.

loans.name: Marceline

texts.fr:
Marceline habite au Sénégal dans la région sud ,elle fait le commerce de poissons fumés mariée depuis 19795, elle a 4 enfants.Avant de se marier ,elle pratiquait se commerce car elle habite dans une zone producteuse de poissons.
Marceline avec son commerce,elle soutien son mari pour les frais de scolarisation des enfants et la nouriture de la famille.Avec son commerce elle pense contruire en dur leur maison qui est un ancien batimen en banco.
texts.en: Marceline lives in the south of Senegal and sells smoked fish.  She has been married since 1979 and has four children.  She carried out this business before she got married because she lives in a fishing area.  Through her business, Marceline supports her husband in covering their children's education expenses and in feeding the family.  Through her business she plans to re-build their home from durable construction materials as it is an old house made from mud.

loans.use: to buy smoked fish to increase her stock

loans.name: Srey Orn

texts.en:
Srey Orn is 32 years old and married with 3 children who attend school. 

For the last 8 years, she has been farming on her land to earn a living.  Srey Orn also plants cassava and works at other plantations to gain additional income. 

Srey Orn has been with VisionFund for 3 years and is now requesting a loan to cultivate rice on her farmland and to plant cassava trees.  With this loan, she hopes to earn more income to feed her family, to buy necessary household goods and to keep her children in school.

loans.use: to cultivate rice paddy and plant cassava.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Cheryl

texts.en: Cheryl is 34 years old and lives in the Philippines with her two children. She is a widow who supports her family by selling canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has been in this business for the last two years and is applying for a loan for PHP 14,000 to buy more items to sell to her customers. She joined HSPFI last year as a way to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy corn at wholesale.

loans.name: Hassan's Group

texts.en:
Pictured above are a group of teachers from one of the institutions in Waterloo, a town near Freetown where “Shine on Sierra Leone” partnered with SMT to start a branch. School staff and other salaried workers do come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org base in Makeni to seek loans. With the help of these loans, they are able to solve problems that their salaries alone cannot solve. Then at the end of each month their bursar or finance officer repays SMT/Kiva lenders on their behalf.

Hassan is the leader of this group of teachers. The twenty-three year old is a native of Mile Ninety village. He is married and has three children. Hassan has requested this loan in order to buy a television set for his household.

loans.use: to buy a television set for his household.

loans.name: Muia

texts.en:
Muia is a married woman with three children. She is 32 years old.

Muia owns and operates a business venture selling general handicrafts to tourists and local community members. She has three years of experience in this business.   

Muia needs a loan of WST 1800 to purchase raw materials to make additional handicrafts. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be  $167 per week) to improve the general living conditions of her family.

In 2008, Muia joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Muia's third loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials to make additional handicrafts.

loans.name: Luz

texts.es:
Luz, de 24 años de edad, es una mujer alegre y trabajadora, además de ser muy amable y trato jovial. Convive con Elías quien es cocinero. Viven juntos a lado de su hermana y su hijo de 2 años de edad, instalados en su propia casa. El negocio que tiene Luz es la venta de abarrotes en general, para eso abrió un bodega en su propia casa. Negocio que aprendió de su padre, quien tenía su bodega en su casa, y contando con un apoyo financiero de MFP comenzó con éste negocio comprando productos en pequeñas cantidades , logrando crecer así su tienda durante estos 04 años que viene funcionando, y que hasta el momento lo hace sola.
Le gusta su negocio pues le permite estar en casa para poder atender a su pequeño hijo, así como los ingresos económicos que le sirven para comprar lo que le falte para su hogar, sin embargo no le gusta es que algunos de sus clientes le piden crédito y cuando llega el momento del pago se retrasan, pero aun así continua con su trabajo. Pero su fin es crecer como comerciante y ampliar su bodega hasta convertirla en un tienda donde pueda vender toda clase de productos. Este será el préstamo número 4 con la institución MFP. Por ello espera de su colaboración para que pueda concretar sus planes. Además comenta sentirse bien con su banco comunal, pues conoce a la mayoría, aun existe el ingreso de algunos nuevos, espera que sean responsables como el resto del grupo. Con el monto solicitado de 1500 nuevos soles, lo invertirá en la compra de productos al por mayor para su bodega, como azúcar, arroz, aceites y otros.
texts.en:
Luz, 24, is a happy and hard-working woman, besides having a very kind and jovial manner.  She lives with Elías, who is a cook.  They live together next to her sister and her two-year-old son, in her own home.  

The business Luz has is selling general groceries, so she opened a grocery store in her own house.  She learned the business from her father, who had his grocery store in his house, and with financial help from MFP.  She began her business buying small quantities of products, in this way managing to grow during these four years she has been operating, which up to the present she does alone.

She likes her business because it allows her to be at home to be able to take care of her young child, as well as the economic income that serves her to buy what she needs for her home.  Nevertheless, she does not like that some of her customers ask her for credit and then get behind when it comes time to pay.  Even so she continues with her job.  But her goal is to grow as a merchant and expand her grocery store until she converts it into a store where she can sell all types of products.

This will be her fourth loan with the MFP institution, and she hopes for your collaboration so she can realize her plans.  She also comments that she feels good about her communal bank because she knows the majority of the members, although there are still some new ones joining.  She hopes they are responsible like the rest of the group.

With the requested loan of 1500 PEN she will invest in buying wholesale products for her store, such as sugar, rice, oil, and others.

loans.use: to buy household necessities to stock her store.

loans.name: Miriam Judith

texts.es:
Mirian Judith tiene 28 años de edad es casada tiene un hijo, vive con el esposo y el hijo de  1 año en Ventanas provincia de los Ríos.

Es integrante de la VRC NUEVO HORIZONTE, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Cachely grande, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta Ventanilla se dedica a labores Agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz, frejol gandul.

Mirian Judith se dedica a la Agricultura a la siembra de maíz, además cría animales como los cerdos y pollos de campo. Las compras y las ventas de los productos agrícolas lo hace en ventanas.

 Solicita el crédito para comprar, insumos, semillas, abonos, fertilizantes, líquido para plagas. Con el apoyo del crédito le facilitara para mejorar y hacer más desmontes a los terrenos.

Enfrenta desafíos como las plagas esto ocurre cuando hay mucha lluvia. El sueño es comprarse tierras y trabajar en algo propio.

En el tiempo libre le gusta cuidar al hijo y jugar con él.
texts.en:
Mirian Judith, 28, is married and has a son; she lives with her husband and one-year-old son in Ventanas, Los Ríos Province.

She’s a member of the “Nuevo Horizonte” (New Horizon) communal bank located in Recinto Cachely Grande that belongs to Ventanas Canton.  This communal bank is dedicated to short cycle corn, rice and pigeon pea farming.

Mirian Judith farms corn and also raises animals like pigs and free-range chickens.  Her purchases and sales of farm products take place in Ventanas.

She’s asking for the loan to buy supplies, seeds, manure, fertilizer and liquids for the infestations.  Support from the loan will help her improve and remove weeds from the fields.

She faces challenges like infestations which occur when there is an excess of rain.  Her dream is to buy land and to work for herself.  In her free time she enjoys caring for her son and playing with him.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Sary's Group

texts.en: Sary, a villager from Ponhea Krek district of Kampong Cham province, is 39 years old and a married mother blessed with three kids. For her family, cassava farming is the main source of income that she can earn up to 28,000 KHR per day. Now, she is in need of working capital, therefore, she forms a group of two to get a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer for her cassava. She really hopeful with this loan that can make her farm well than before.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her cassava

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Milagro De Dios Group

texts.en:
The 7 women of “Milagro de Dios”, or “Miracle of God” trust bank, live in the Nuevo Amanecer community, Suchitepéquez, Guatemala, a region in the west coast where there are many industrial farms and factories, the hot climate and flat land of the area perfect for mass production of fruit, coffee, and much more. 

Evelyn is an exceptional woman, forging a beautiful reality for herself and her 2 daughters of 7 and 5 years old who are studying in local schools, despite the death of her young husband, 5 years ago. With 25 years of age, and her 4th grade education, this working mother has much responsibility, providing a good life for her daughters. Evelyn runs a business buying and selling dairy products such as cheese and cream, travelling to the factory where she buys her products and delivering them to her clients locally, an in two different towns, neighboring municipality, and far from her home, in Guatemala City each week. She also works with her sister procuring and selling firewood when she isn’t selling cheese. Evelyn plans to use her first loan to buy her products, cheese, cream, and firewood for resale. 


The ages of these ladies range between 21 and 45 years old, and the majority of them earned a 4th grade education before they began working with their family in and outside of their homes. They live in united homes, working together with their spouses to provide education and quality of life to their children and running their various busness, selling tortillas, firewood, snacks, dairy products, vegetables, and animals they raise themselves. 

The members of “Milagro de Dios” continue forward day-to-day, carving paths for themselves and their families that are full of hope.

loans.use: To buy her products, cheese, cream, and firewood for resale.

loans.name: Fouadi

texts.en: Fouadi is a 23-year-old, Lebanese married woman. She lives with her husband who represents the main source income. As for her, she is still attending university and doesn’t work. She is very tender and cares a lot about all of her family. Today, she is eager to borrow a loan from Kiva partner, Vitas. s.a.l., to pay her university educational fees. She said that she is very happy with the loan that will allowed her to continue her education suitably.

loans.use: to pay her university educational fees.

loans.name: Edith

texts.en:
Edith N. is a lively and active member of Life in Africa. She is currently working in the Invisible Children Bracelet Project. She is educated and holds a Bachelor's Degree in Development studies but, since finishing her University studies, she has been unable to find a job. She supported herself by doing odd jobs and managed to earn enough money to open a small retail shop.

This shop is in a very good location and is lucrative because there are few other shops in the village. The people would have to walk very long distances to find the products she plans on offering. By bringing these products closer to them she will be guaranteed a large and solid customer base. This will not only provide more income for her but will also serve her community. For this reason she wishes to grow and expand her shop.

She is seeking a loan in the amount of 800,000 to purchase the stock needed to expand her existing shop.

Below is her budget:

  • Sugar 2 bags @70,000/=
  • Rice 1 bag @70,000/=
  • Batteries 2 boxes @ 5,500/=
  • Cooking oil 1 jerry can @ 20,000/=
  • fridge 1 Unit @ 300,000/=
  • Soap 2 boxes @ 10,000/=
  • Maize flour 1 bag @ 12,000/=
  • Salt 2 cartons @ 10,000/=
  • Paraffin 1 jerry can @ 26,000/=
  • Match boxes 1 carton @ 7,500/=
  • Baking Powder 1 box @ 48,000/=
  • Geisha 1 box @ 8,000/=
  • Millet flour 1 Bag @10,000/=
  • contingencies 32,000/=

Total------------------ 800,000/=

She will be paying 102,890/= per month for 10 months in order to completely service the loan properly. Edith has designated 25% of the interest she pays on the loan to support the Internet4Change team at Life in Africa, where she is an Agent in training.

loans.use: Purchase of foodstuffs and household commodities

loans.name: Délali

texts.en:
Mrs. Délali Y. is a gentle and friendly woman. Married to a carpenter, she is the mother of four children. The income from her husband’s job varies according to his clients’ demands, and it usually falls well short of the household needs. In order to contribute towards the family expenses, Mrs. Y. has ventured into making a baby’s porridge in her neighborhood, using her modest savings from selling iced water. She hopes to take advantage of financial support to stock up on more corn in order to safeguard against a shortage of raw materials. To do this, she needs a loan of $700, which will provide the funds for stocking up on corn and preparing the porridge. The sale of the porridge will allow her to meet her household expenses.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, Kiva volunteer.

Madame Y. Délali est une douce femme très accueillante. Mariée à un menuisier, elle est mère de quatre (04) enfants. Les revenus du travail de son mari varient en fonction de la demande de ses clients, et sont la plupart du temps largement en dessous des besoins du foyer. Pour contribuer aux dépenses familiales, Madame Y. Délali s’est lancée dans la préparation de la bouillie dans son quartier à partir d’une petite économie tirée de la vente de l’eau glacée. Elle compte bénéficier d’un appui financier pour stocker plus de maïs afin d’être à l’abri de toute pénurie en matières premières. Pour ce faire, elle a besoin d’un crédit d’un montant de $700 qui va lui servir de fonds de commerce pour le stockage du maïs et la préparation de bouillie. La vente de cette bouillie lui permettra de couvrir les charges du ménage.

loans.use: To stock up on corn in order to prepare and sell baby porridge

loans.name: Abla

texts.en: Abla has been a client of Kraban Support Foundation for years now. She has had several training sessions on simple record keeping and loan management from the organization. She cooks palm kennel oil and sells it in gallons to her clients. She is seeking a loan of US$700.00 from Kiva to help her expand her production.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Saúl

texts.es:
Business Description: Mr. Saúl began his business 4 ago with his bricklayer salary. He sells everything related to locksmiths: doors, windows, gates, etc. Mr. Saúl started out with very few clients. Now, a few months later, he has clients constantly working with him.

Use of Loan: Mr. Saúl has the tools he needs to work with but not the funds to purchase material and merchandise to meet his clients’ demands nor an adequate workshop to work in.

Personal Information: He is single, his house is made of concrete and his goal is to have a bigger workshop to provide others in need a job opportunity.

Translated to English by Patricia Yáñez, Kiva Volunteer.

Descripción del Negocio: El Señor Saúl empezó su negocio hace 4 años producto de un dinero que ganaba como albañil, el vende todo lo concerniente en cerrajería tales como puertas, ventanas, rejas, etc. El Señor Saúl empezó con muy pocos clientes de los cuales con el pasar de los meses esto ha cambiado y hoy tiene clientes que siempre están trabajando con el.

Uso del Préstamo: EL Señor Saúl tiene hoy en día todas las herramientas necesarias para trabajar pero su capital no es suficiente, pues el cuenta con este crédito para poder comprar mas material y mercadería para poder atender todas las demandas de sus clientes y de esta manera poder tener sus taller mas adecuado para trabajar.

Información Personal: EL es soltero, su vivienda es de cemento y su meta es poder tener un día su taller mas grande y de esta manera dar oportunidades de trabajo a mas personas que necesitan.

loans.use: Invest in prime materials

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Mrs. Esther O. is 42 years old, and married with six children.  She sells provisions and foodstuffs.  She is in need of the funds above to buy more foodstuffs and provisions to sell.  She has been in this business since 2001.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs and provisions to sell

loans.name: Ni Ketut Sunadi

texts.id:
In Bali, wife's role in the family is very important. Besides raising children, also manage household needs, awife is also required to have enough income to support husband's income, so that all needs could be fulfilled. Thi role is fulfilled by Ni Ketut Sunadi since she married I Wayan Suda, a man who works as a tenant farmer. Mature age is not stopping Sunadi to do business. For Sunadi raising pigs does not require a lot of energy. Important is capital and persistant for her to expand the business. Her last sales was Rp1,950,000 (about US$220) from sales of 2 pigs, that she raised for 5 months with a capital of Rp750,000 (about $82.50) for feed expense, and Rp400,000 (about $44) for feedstock. Sunadi's profit was Rp800,000 (about $88). Sunadi plans to expand her business by obtaining a loan from Dinari for Rp1,500,000 (about $165), which will be used to buy 4 piglets, since 2 parts of her stall are now empty, because the pigs were sold to pay for Final exams expenses of her child I Putu Pande Kartika Yasa, who finished Mechanical Middle School. Sunadi hopes the results to be obtained would better than previously, so that it could pay for her child's higher education, which up to now is still postponed.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Di Bali peranan Istri dalam suatu rumah tangga sangatlah penting. Disamping sebagai pengasuh anak-anak dan juga mengurus segala keperluan rumah tangga seorang istri juga dituntut untuk dapat memiliki penghasilan yang mampu menunjang pendapatan suami sehingga semua kebutuhan bisa terpenuhi. Peranan ini telah di lakukan oleh Ni Ketut sunadi sejak menikah dengan I Wayan Suda, laki-laki yang kesehariannya bekerja sebagai petani . Usia yang kini semakin lanjut tak menghalangi Sunadi untuk terus berusaha , bagi Sunadi memelihara ternak babi tidak memerlukan tenaga terlalu banyak , yang penting ada modal dan ketekunan itu sudah cukup baginya untuk mengembangkan usaha ini. Hasil penjualan terakhir yang di peroleh Sunadi sebesar Rp 1.950.000,- dari 2 Ekor ternak yang di pelihara selama 5 bulan .dengan menghabiskan modal sebesar Rp 750.000,- untuk biaya pakan dan Rp 400.000,- Untuk Bibitnya, Sunadi mendapat keuntungan sebesar Rp 800.000 ,- Sunadi bermaksud mengembangkan usahanya ini dengan meminjam modal dari Dinari, sebesar Rp 1.500.000 ,- yang di pergunakan untuk membeli 4 ekor bibit lagi, karena dua bagian kandang miliknya kini kosong karena babinya di jual untuk biaya Ujian Akhir anaknya, I Putu Pande Kartika Yasa,yang telah menyelesaikan sekolah mekanik (STM). Dan Sunadi pun Berharap hasil yang di dapatnya lebih baik dari sebelumnya. Sehingga bisa membiayai kelanjutan pendidikan anaknya ke Perguruan Tinggi yang sampai sat ini masih tertunda.

loans.use:
To buy pig feedstock

Membeli bibit babi

loans.name: Boin

texts.en: Mrs. Boin H., age 38, works on her plot of land raising pigs, earning less than US$1 a day. Her husband sells firewood and charcoal, earning $7 a day. They have two children, one of whom also works selling wood, earning about US$100 a month, while the other one is a student. Mrs. H. would like to borrow US$1,200 in order to purchase more wood to invest in her family’s business. By purchasing large amounts of wood, she can take advantage of bulk discounts which will increase their profit margins. The additional inventory will also meet growing customer demand, thereby increasing the family's income revenue.

loans.use: Purchase wood for sale

loans.name: Maria Lissette

texts.es:
Señora R. used to just attend to her house because of the difficult situation she was going through since she was unemployed. For this reason, she saw the need to help her husband with the education of their four kids and started selling miscellaneous products.

She started her business with $100 that her sister provided her as a loan. Her business is located in her home, which is favorable for her because she doesn't have to pay rent or taxes, and she also has a good influx of clients since her house is one block from La Estación market.

For a year and a half, señora R. has worked with the credits provided to her by Ceprodel, and she has managed to achieve favorable conditions for the sale of her products and to buy display cases, shelves, and a refrigerator. She has also been able to help better her family's quality of life and to help educate her children.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

La Sra. R. anteriormente solamente se dedicaba a atender su hogar por la situación difícil que atravesaba ya que estaba sin empleo. Por esta razón se ve en la necesidad de apoyar a su compañero en la educación de sus cuatros hijos e inicia a vender productos misceláneos.

Inicia su negocio con U$ 100 que le es facilitado por su hermana en concepto de préstamo, el mismo es establecido en su casa lo cual le favorece su posición puesto que no tiene que alquilar ni pagar impuesto además de tener buena afluencia de cliente por encontrarse ubicado a una cuadra del mercado La Estación .

Durante año y medio la señora R. ha trabajado con los créditos otorgados por Ceprodel habiendo logrado alcanzar condiciones favorables para la venta de sus productos y compra de vitrinas, estantes y refrigerador sin olvidar la ayuda al mejoramiento de sus condiciones familiares y el apoyo a la educación de sus hijos.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Ola

texts.en:
Ola A. is 29 years old, married and has 2 children. She comes from Alaba in Lagos State, Nigeria.

She sells clothes and has been in business since 2000. She's requesting a loan of $450 to buy more clothes for sale. She thanks you for the loan.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for sale

loans.name: Carlos

texts.en:
Carlos R. is a blacksmith who has been working in this area for over 13 years.  He currently works out of his house and works very hard to support his family--he is married with five children.  With the loan of $375, Carlos will buy a semi-industrial cutting machine for his business.  

With access to better machinery Carlos will be able to make and fix items faster and with more efficiency. This will increase his earnings and help put his children through school.

loans.use: To buy machinery for his blacksmithing business

loans.name: Chea

texts.en:
Mrs. Chea H. and her husband, Ra Seng, have been married since 1988. They have one daughter who is weaving silk at home. The family lives along the Mekong River, about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Chea has been a silk weaver for twenty eight years. It’s a skill she learned from her mother. Her husband has been a silk weaver for two years. It’s a skill he learned from Chea. They sell their finished products to the middle man inside the village.

Mrs. Chea is requesting a loan for the third time in the amount of $100 to purchase silk materials for weaving.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for weaving.

loans.name: Syoni

texts.en:
Mambo (Hello!) from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 50-year-old Syoni M.. She is married and has four children between the ages of 13 and 22.

In 2004, Syoni established her clothing business. Syoni requires a loan in order to purchase traditional African cloth, dresses, and sarongs. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a leading role as a pioneer of microcredit in Tanzania through micro-leasing. Because customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, the women lack tangible collateral assets, and financial institutions do not consider them to be credit-worthy. This leads to poor financial support and, as a result, limited access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. When a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys the equipment from the client, extends a loan to her, and then leases back the same equipment – a process called a "sale and leaseback" arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase and make traditional African cloth, dresses, and sarongs.

loans.name: Agustina

texts.es:
Agustina has always been a very responsible woman in her household. In her noble profession as an artisan she makes beautiful and elegant ponchos for women and bedspreads for babies. Thanks to her agile and talented hands she is managing to fulfill the weekly requests from her customers. In addition to this work, on Sundays and Mondays he works selling American-style clothing though which she earns extra income that allows her to live peacefully with her dear youngest son Enrique, who is 9 years old. Agustina's wish is to buy more raw material (wool) in order to increase the volume of production of her beautiful, intricate hand-woven garments.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Agustina, siempre demostró ser una mujer muy responsable en su hogar, con sus hijos y en su noble oficio como artesana, elabora manualmente hermosos y elegantes ponchos para damas y colchas para bebés, gracias a sus ágiles y talentosas manos está logrando cumplir satisfactoriamente con las solicitudes que semanalmente le hacen sus clientes, Adicionalmente a esta labor los días domingos y lunes se dedica a la venta de ropa americana, negocio mediante el cual también obtiene ingresos extras que le permite vivir en tranquilidad a lado de su querido y menor hijo Enrique de 9 añitos de edad.El deseo de Agustina es contar con mayor materia prima ( lana) para aumentar el volumen de producción de sus hermosas prendas tejidas manualmente con finísimos detalles.

loans.use: Increasing capital in order to buy more raw material

loans.name: Kodjo

texts.fr:
Kodjo A. is 30 years old, married, and the father or two. He has been a motorbike taxi driver for more than five years in Avetonou, a small village located about 100 km from Lomé, the Togolese capital. To earn more money and to improve his living conditions, Kodjo would like to use this loan, the first with FECECAV, to buy a new motorbike.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Kodjo A. est âgé de 30 ans, marié et père de 2 enfants. Il est conducteur de taxi moto depuis plus de 5 ans à Avetonou, un petit village situé à environ 100 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Pour gagner plus d’argent et améliorer ses conditions de vie, Kodjo désire utiliser ce crédit, le premier à FECECAV, pour acheter une nouvelle moto

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.en:
Gregoria is a fifty-nine year old married mother with nine children. Gregoria works in the central street in the city of Ayacucho, where she sells “cancha” (corn snacks) from 2:00 PM in the afternoon to 10:00 PM at night from a cart. She buys the ingredients for the cancha and makes them herself. Additionally, Gregoria sells sweets and canchas at different city events.

Gregoria is a member of the Violeta Village Bank

Gregoria needs a loan of 1000 Peruvian Nuevos Soles ($375 US Dollars) to invest in more corn and oil to expand her business.

Gregoria´s dream is to have a stable grocery store and supply her business, while having a home of her own.

loans.use: to invest in more corn and oil to expand her business.

loans.name: Iris Diana

texts.es:
Iris belongs to the Communal Bank “El Arenal”, she lives at Jr. Arenal # 1063, Calleria district, Ucayali state. She is 24 years old and is single. With the first loan from Manuela Ramos for S/.300 she decided to invest in selling candy.

Today she continues selling a variety of candy and soda pop.

With the current loan for S/1.100 which will be repaid in 6 months, she will buy 3 boxes of small soda pop, 3 packages of large soda pop, and a variety of candy

Everyday is a challenge for Iris. So she is happy for the opportunity that Manuela Ramos provides her to receive a loan and invest in her business. This way she can bring income to her family. She has always liked being independent and this is why she likes her business as she can converse with her customers and make many friends.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

La señorita Iris, pertenece al Banco Comunal El Arenal, ubicado en el Jr. Arenal # 1063, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 24 años es soltera. Iris con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertir en venta de golosinas.

Actualmente continua con la venta de variedad de golosinas y gaseosas.

Con este préstamo de S/ 1,100 el cual será pagado en 6 meses, invertirá en la compra de 3 cajas de gaseosa chica, 3 paquetes de gaseosa grande, y variedad de golosinas.

Para Iris cada día es un reto. Es por ello que Se siente muy feliz por la oportunidad que le brinda Manuela Ramos de recibir un préstamo e invertir. Y de tal forma ella pueda llevar un ingreso a su familia. A ella Siempre le ha gustado ser independiente de tal manera le gusta mucho su negocio ya que de esa manera puede conversar con sus clientes y hacer muchos amigos.

loans.use: Buy soda pop and candy

loans.name: Hout

texts.en:
Hout H., 49, is a true entrepreneur and has a business selling groceries for her local people. On average, she makes US$3 of profit per day. Her husband, Hean Rith, 48, is a fisherman from the river. He always sells his catch to the market to earn approximately US$3 per day. This couple together has seven children; two of whom are students, three others are employed in different work. Mrs. Hout needs a loan from Kiva of US$800 to purchase a motorbike for transportation.

CREDIT MFI is an independent Cambodian faith-based organization. It aims to empower the economically active poor and small entrepreneurs by providing inclusive financial services.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for transportation.

loans.name: Clelia

texts.es: Clelia tiene 48 años, vive con sus ancianos padres y sus 2 hijos.   Trabaja  cada día con su propia herramienta de trabajo, que es su máquina fotocopiadora, en un pequeño espacio que alquiló en el centro de la ciudad, todas las mañanas se dirige a su puesto para dedicarse a sacar copias de los pedidos que le hacen, de esta manera, consigue lo que necesita día a día, para conseguir el sustento diario, ya lleva 2 años con esta labor, antes se dedicaba a la venta de cosméticos, pero las constantes caminatas hicieron que prefiriera cambiar de rubro, a pesar de que este mes la entrada ha sido baja, ella no desespera, porque el resto del año tiene mejores temporadas.  Clelia trabaja de esta forma para poder educar a sus hijos.   Solicita un préstamo que invertirá en la compra de papales al por mayor para sus fotocopiados, en un futuro, desea alquilar un stand en un local más céntrico y visible al público.
texts.en:
Clelia is 48-years-old and lives with her elderly parents and 2 children. She works every day with her own tool for work, her photocopier. She goes to a small space that she rented in center of the city every morning where she makes copies that people order from her. In this way, she makes what she needs every day to cover her daily living expenses. She has done this work for 2 years. She used to sell cosmetics, but the constant long walks made her want to change jobs. Even though her income this month has been low, she isn't giving up hope because the rest of the year will be a busier season. Clelia works to be able to educate her children. She is requesting a loan that she will invest in the purchase of wholesale paper for her photocopies. In the future, she hopes to rent a stand in a more central location that is more visible to the public.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a larger quantity of paper for her photocopies

loans.name: Blanca Nubia

texts.es:
Su Nombre es Blanca Nubia Olivia López su estado civil es casada, ella tiene 53 años de edad, Doña Blanca tiene una hija de 33 años de edad, que trabaja por cuenta propia y no depende de su mama, su compañero de vida labora como albañil, los propósitos que ella tiene es de establecer un local donde obtenga mas ingresos y proporcionar mejoras para ella como lo es la compra de un electrodoméstico como seria una refrigeradora pues la que posee no es de su pertenecía sino de las diferentes casas que le distribuyen el producto como la coca -cola  y pepsi y entre sus propósitos esta obtener sus artículos para su hogar ahorrando lo poco que obtiene en sus ingresos.

La actividad económica a la que se dedica es la venta de pollo y venta de jugos, gaseosa y  cerveza el tiempo que lleva en este negocio es de 4 años, ella inicia este negocio por motivación propia ya que siempre le ha gustado actuar de forma independiente y buscar el medio para sobrevivir e inicia con la venta de pollo del cual recibe ingresos y decide colocar otro negocio con la venta de gaseosas, jugos y cerveza ya que esta representa una fuerte demanda en su casa de habitación que esta ubicada en león en la siguiente dirección barrio de subtiava de la Texaco guido 3 ½ cuadra al norte, la solicitud de su financiamiento es para capital de trabajo para estar de esta manea activa en su negocio necesita incrementar mas en los productos de coca- cola, pepsi y cerveza por lo que tiene que tiene que satisfacer los diferentes gustos de sus clientes y recurre a este financiamiento por medio de la empresa Fundación León 2000 que le ha brindado su ayuda en los créditos.
texts.en:
Her name is Blanca Nubia Olivia López, she is married, 53 years old, and has a 33 year old daughter who works for herself and does not depend on her mother. Her lifetime partner works in construction. Her goal is to establish a locale where she can earn a greater income, and make improvements such as buying a refrigerator because the one she uses now does not belong to her but to the different houses that distribute such products as Coca-Cola and Pepsi to her. Her intentions include obtaining household products for her home by saving the little she earns.

The business she dedicates herself to is the sale of poultry, as well as juices, sodas, and beer. She has been in business for four years, having started by her own motivation as she has always liked to work independently and find her own way to survie. She started with poultry sales which generates income, and then decided to start another venture with the sale of sodas, juices and beer as these are in high demand in her hometown of León. Her reason for requesting a loan is for working capital to stay active in her business, as she needs to increase the quantity of Coca-Cola and Pepsi products she stocks to satisfy the different tastes of her customer base. She turns to this financing by way of the Fundación León 2000 which has provided her with loan assistance.


Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Adjovi Apéafa

texts.fr:
Madame D. Adjovi Apéafa est née le 15 juin 1987 à Lomé, la capitale du Togo.  Cette jeune fille qui a vingt-et-un ans est très motivée et elle a sa propre entreprise à ce jeune âge.  Elle est célibataire, et elle n’a pas d’enfant.  Elle a pour l’activité le vente des produits d’alimentation et n’a jamais bénéficié d’un prêt au près de WAGES.  

Ce premier crédit qu’elle sollicite va lui permettre d’achète 10 sacs de riz, 10 bidons d’huile, 10 cartons de macaroni, et 6 cartons de tomates.  Avec ce nouveau stock, elle peut bien vendre et servir ses clients pendant les périodes de fête à la fin d’année.
texts.en:
Miss Adjovi Apéafa D. was born on June 15, 1987 in Lomé, the capital of Togo. This young woman, 21, is very motivated and she has her own business at this young age. She is single and she has no children. Her business is selling foodstuffs and she has never had a loan from WAGES.

This first loan that she is requesting will permit her to buy 10 sacks of rice, 10 jerry cans of oil, 10 cases of macaroni, and 6 cases of tomato paste. With this new stock, she will be able to make a lot of sales and serve her customers during the end-of-year festivities.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of foodstuffs for re-sale

loans.name: Samnang

texts.en:
Mrs. Samnang S. and her husband, Mr. Si Nob, both 38, who live along National Road Number One about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 2000 and have three children: one son who attends school and two young daughters.

Samnang has been selling vegetables for three years, buying them from Kean Svay for resale at Chbar Ampov market in Phnom Penh. Her husband is a military policeman. Samnang is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase vegetables for resale.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana M. sells tailoring materials like thread, needles and landings. She has been in this business for a long time. Now, Juliana needs a loan of N100,000 to purchase more tailoring materials to sell. She would like to grow her bsuiness.

Juliana is 44 years old. She is married with 5 children. She says thank you to all kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more tailoring materials to sell

loans.name: Merit

texts.en:
Merit A. recently joined the K-MET volunteer Community Health Worker (CHW) group in Kisumu, Kenya.

As a CHW she will be trained by K-MET and will begin visiting members of her community who are sick with a variety of illnesses. Her work will include distributing Nutriflour (a vitamin-enriched flour produced by K-MET) to malnourished patients, providing reproductive health education, referring patients to local clinics and hospitals, and providing basic health care.

Merit was diagnosed with HIV several years ago. For a time she was sick at home, but when she began to feel better she talked with her friends about how to live with HIV. Her friends recommended that she start a business so that she could keep busy and be active. In 2005 Merit began a business selling chips (french fries) in the Nyalenda neighborhood of Kisumu.

Merit chose chips because her parents used to have a similar business and she grew up knowing how to cook and sell chips profitably. Merit purchases about 10 kilograms of potatoes from the Kibuye Market in Kisumu weekly. On a busy day she can sell about half her stock.

Because she has this business, Merit is able to provide for herself and to eat what she wants. She says she doesn’t need to rely on anyone else.

Merit has applied for her first loan from K-MET, of approximately $275. She plans to use this money towards purchasing a machine to fry the chips. If she has a machine, the chips will cook faster and then Merit will not lose customers to long waiting times. Merit would also like to purchase a fridge so that she can sell cold soda with the chips.

loans.use: To purchase a fryer

loans.name: Fati

texts.en:
Fati M. is 45 years old. She is married and has given birth to six children: three sons and three daughters. Fati tells us her two youngest children are currently in school and the rest are married and live independently with their spouses. Fati lives with her husband and their two younger children in a rented apartment in a commercial town called Bekwai, close to Obuasi, a gold-mining town in the Ashanti Region of Ghana. The majority of the inhabitants of Bekwai engage in commercial activities.

Fati trades in fresh yam to earn some income to support her husband and cater for the family. She procures the fresh yam all the way from Ejura in the Brong Ahafo region, where prices are more economical. She then distributes the yam to retailers and food vendors in her community. She has been in business for eight years.

Fati wants a loan to increase her working capital so she can procure yam tubers in bulk. She hopes to support her husband so that they can improve upon their standard of living.

loans.use: To procure tubers of yam

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Parveen lives in a city named Riwind, Pakistan. She owes a two room brick house and has been living in it with her family for the past five years.

Riwind city is famous for its shrine places. Parveen husband runs a grocery shop. He has three years of experience in this business. Parveen is applying for a loan to diversify her husband’s grocery shop into a grocery store.

loans.use: Buy groceries for grocery shop.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Mrs. Julieta S., 62, is married with 2 children. She lives in Mobod, Oroquieta City, and started her snack vending business from capital of just PHP3,000. Her husband, who is a pensioner, is very supportive of her business.

The small business has been doing so well that she is confident to expand. She joined Paglaum MPC for the chance to receive loans. She is applying for PHP 8,000 to buy food for her snack vending. She envisions acquiring a stall in the public market. She also dreams of renovating the family's little house. Mrs S. in on the left in the photo.

loans.use: Buy additional food for snack vending

loans.name: Sofia

texts.es:
Sofia es socia del Banco Comunal Villa Huatatas.
Sofia es casada, tiene 35 años y 2 hijos, Sofia junto a su esposo tienen carros con los cuales realizan transporte publico a diferentes distritos de la provincia, su esposo conduce uno de los carros.
Sofia necesita un préstamo de 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de neumáticos para carros.
Los sueños de Sofia son comprar otro carro y sacar adelante a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Sofia is a partner of the Villa Hatatas community bank. She is 35 years old and married, with two children. Sofia and her husband own cars, which they use for their public transportation business. Her husband drives one of the cars. Sofia needs a loan of 900 soles which she'll invest in car tires. She dreams of buying another car and helping her children get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sofia needs a loan of 900 soles, which she'll invest in car tires.

loans.name: Martha Alejandra

texts.es: Martha Alejandra S. es un señora que esta al tanto de la educación que se le da a sus hijos, Ella cree que al ponerlos en una escuela particular aprenderán mas y a parte aprenderá una lengua extrajera. Su hijo esta en preescolar pero esta requiriendo el pago para la colegiatura de este mes. Ella trabaja en una guardería  de cocinera y su esposo a la venta de automóviles.
texts.en:
Martha Alejandra S. is a woman that is attentive of the education that she gives to her children. She thinks that by putting them in a particular school they will learn more, in addition to learning a foreign language. Her son is in pre-school, but she requires the payment for school fees this month. She works in a nursery kitchen, and her husband sells cars.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay school fees for her son

loans.name: Matluba

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 

 Исломкулова Матлуба  занимаетс откормом скота.Матлуба сама швея, дома шьет национальные платья.  Ее муж находиться в России на заработки. В данный момент она одна содержит семью.  Первый кредит получила в 2007 году. На кредит она приобрела 2 овцы и корм для них. В этом году за счет продажи коров она провела капитальный ремонт. За это она благодарна КИВА.
texts.en:
Matluba I. breeds cattle. Matluba is also a seamstress and makes national dresses at home. Her husband works in Russia. At this time she supports the family. She received her first loan in 2007 and used the loan to buy two sheep and fodder for them. This year she sold cows and it allowed her to make a complete renovation in her home. She is very thankful to Kiva for this.

MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand” “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase two cows

loans.name: Fealofani

texts.en:
M. Fealofani, 30, is married with two children. She has four years of experience in her taxi business. She provides transportation to the general public seven days per week and expects her weekly net cash flow to be 500 Tala. She has no previous loan with SPBD.

SPBD loans are M.’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: To purchase new tires and pay for taxi registration

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en: Georgina, a 38-year-old trader, is married and the mother of four children, all in school, the eldest attending university.  Georgina has been selling onions, rice, tinned tomatoes, pepper, etc. at the local market for 22 years, a business that has enabled her to support her children’s education.  For some time now, however, she has been facing challenges in her business due to inadequate funds and is therefore requesting a loan to enable her to buy increased stocks of tinned tomatoes, bags of rice, onions, and pepper in order to grow her business. She hopes to increase her savings to better support the children’s education to give them a future filled with hope. She would be grateful for your support.

loans.use: To buy increased stocks of rice, onions, tinned tomatoes, pepper and other spices, etc.

loans.name: Sithon

texts.en: Mrs Sithon S. lives in Smorn Pream village in Takeo province. She is 37 years old and the mother of four children, one of whom works at a garment factory while another is a construction worker and the others are attending the local school. Mrs Sithon S. is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate both rice and vegetables. Her husband, Mr Kol Saroeun, is a policeman in the local district. Since his workplace is far from the house, he has to pay for a motor taxi to get to and from work. Now Mrs Sithon S. has decided to ask for a loan to buy a motorbike for her husband to drive to work. Her husband is shown in the picture with her.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her husband to ride to work

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa D. D. H. resiD. en el departamento D. La Libertad. Rosa tiene 29 años D. edad, vive con su esposo quien trabaja para el servicio militar y también con sus hijos  Wilber D. 8 años edad y Stefany D. 3 años D. edad. Rosa se dedica  a su negocio desD. su casa, venD. variedad D. productos como ropa y  perfumes, Rosa solicita un crédito ya que desea aumentar su inventario en sus productos,  lo que ayudara a mantener un equilibrio con mercedaria que tiene 50% por cobrar y desequilibra su liquidez económica.
texts.en:
Rosa D. D. H. lives in the district of La Libertad. She is 29 years old and married. She and her husband have two children, Wilber (age 8) and Stefany (age 3). Her husband works for the military service. Rosa operates a business from home, selling a variety of products such as clothing and perfumes. She is requesting a loan so that she can increase her inventory of products. This will help her maintain a balance of 50% merchandise on hand that her customers have already paid for with the other half being items that her customers requested on credit.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase inventory for her business

loans.name: Remember #2 Group

texts.en:
Remember #2 is a group of 5 borrowers led by Sambah K.. They live in Kolahu, Lofa County, Liberia.  Sambah is 35 years old and married. She has 2 children, ages 2 and 7.  Her oldest child is in 1st grade. Sambah was unable to attend school because, although she enjoyed it, the cultural norm was for girls to rely on their husbands to provide and, therefore, school was considered unnecessary.  She lives in remote Kolahu City in rural Lofa County, the breadbasket of Liberia. 

Sambah’s runs a cookshop, a fast-food roadside café for workers in the fields and other general laborers. She has run her business for 2 years and is successful because her customers like her personality and work ethic – she stays open long hours for them – and the way she prepares the food. She’s taking a loan to increase her food stores of rice, oil, mapo, and soup to meet the demand of the growing economy. Her dream is to expand her business so she can one day have a real restaurant in town. With the profits from her business, Sambah dreams of sending her kids to college.

loans.use: Purchase rice, oil, mapo and soup

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret is 49 and married with six children.  Three of her children go to school.  She takes care of additional family members. Margaret resides and owns a five roomed house where she is staying with five people. There is electricity and piped water at home.  The family gets three meals a day. She resides and works in semi urban area which in the outskirts of Kampala. Margaret works seven days a week.  Margaret owns shop selling second hand clothes in Margaret. She buys her merchandise from Owino one of the busiest markets in Kampala city and uses public transport to and from shopping Margaret doesn’t pay rent for her business premises as she works from her home.  She sells to all people on both retail and whole sale and besides selling second hand clothes she does tailoring when need arises Margaret has been in this business for fifteen years and with MCDT for seven years servicing her third loan, working with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to buy more second hand clothing and materials for tailoring. Margaret  is aspiring of seeing her business grow bigger and owning whole sale shop

loans.use: To buy more used clothing and materials for tailoring

loans.name: Marites

texts.en: Marites A. is from the town of Northern Pob. Calamba Mis.Occ.. She is 40 years old. Marites is married and has 1 school-aged children. To make a living, Marites is starting a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale. Marites is just starting this business.In 2009, Marites joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.
