Marites is requesting a new loan of 3000 PHP which will be used to purchase breeding livestock. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Marites from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family.  Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.use: Capital for her  proposed  project

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine E. is from the village of Antipolo. She is 41 years old. Josephine is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Josephine owns & operates a business raising pigs for sale. Josephine has been engaged in her business for over five years with approximate average monthly earnings of 1,700 PHP for these activities.

In 2009, Josephine joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Josephine has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. Josephine is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Josephine from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Rin

texts.en: Mrs. Rin S. lives in Trapeang Pring village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice. Her husband, Mr. Heng Mao, is a construction worker. Since his workplace is far from home and he usually spends a lot of money on transportation, Mrs. Rin S. decided to ask for a loan to buy a motorbike for her husband to go to work. This couple does not have any children. Her husband is present in the picture with her.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her husband to go to work

loans.name: Julio César

texts.es: Julio césar M. A. de 41 años de edad, reside en Ilopango junto su esposa, su hijo y tres sobrinos todos menores de edad. El posee una tienda en su propia casa, así mismo realiza viajes para otras personas ya que posee un pick up y así mismo vende gas propano. Julio solicita un préstamo para poder surtir su tienda con productos como pollo, pan, lácteos, entre otros más. Julio césar es una persona con muy buenas referencias de sus vecinos, el cual se destaca por tratar de diferentes maneras de  brindarle lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
Julio César M. A. is 41 years old and lives in Ilopango with his wife, son, and three young nephews. He runs a small shop out of his house, works as a driver for other people because he owns a pick up, and sells propane gas. Julio applied for the loan to be able to offer more products for his store like chicken, bread, and dairy products among others. Julio César has good references from his neighbors who note the many different ways he tries to improve his family's life.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of perishable products

loans.name: Jesus Is Real Group

texts.en:
Here are members of the 'Jesus is Real' Group. They are small-scale entrepreneurs in the northern city of Makeni. They are seeking a loan of SLL 500,000 each to enable them to add more goods to their businesses. In this way, they will be able to make more sales and better profit. Consequently, they can better support their children in terms of feeding and clothing them,  and in their academic pursuits. 

Teresa K. on the left is the leader of this group. She is forty-four years of age, born in the southern city of Bo. She is currently residing in Makeni, together with her husband and children. Her husband is a soldier and two of her children are in college, two in secondary school, and two are already adults. Teresa is a businesswoman who sells fish and meat. She has been a businesswoman for almost ten years now. With her share of the loan, Teresa will buy more cartons of fish and meat to add to her business.

loans.use: Buy cartons of fish and cartons of meat to sell

loans.name: Akouavi Rita

texts.fr: A. Akouavi Rita est née en 1968 à Comè, dans le département du Mono au Bénin. Akouavi Rita s’est installée à Lokokoukoumè, dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji, il y a environs neuf ans. Mariée à ANATO Médard, un agent permanent de l’Etat, Akouavi Rita est mère de sept enfants, dont cinq sont à sa charge. Seulement certains enfants sont scolarisés. La famille vit ensemble à Lokokoukoumè. Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la famille. Akouavi Rita n’a pas été à l’école. Pour aider son mari dans les charges de la famille, Akouavi Rita vend des divers (farine de manioc, sucre, lait, conserves, savons, pâtes alimentaires, sardines, fil à coudre, etc.) à son domicile. C’est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, que Akouavi Rita s’approvisionne. Akouavi Rita a déjà bénéficié de deux crédits auprès de ALIDé, crédits qui ont été bien remboursés. Akouavi Rita sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé, afin de renforcer son capital et d’élever le niveau de son activité pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Akouavi Rita A. was born in 1968 in Comè, in the Mono department of Benin. About nine years ago, Akouavi Rita settled in the Lokokoukoumè area of Sèmè-Podji. She is married to Médard ANATO, a government agent, and mother of seven children, five of whom are still under her care. Only some of the children are educated. The family lives together in Lokokoukoumè, and the couple share household expenses. Akouavi Rita has not been to school. To help her husband meet household expenses, Akouavi Rita sells various goods from her home (manioc flour, sugar, milk, canned food, soap, pasta, sardines, sewing thread, etc.). She gets her supplies from the international market of Benin, Dantokpa. Akouavi Rita has already benefited from two loans from ALIDé, that were both repaid in full. She now requests a third loan from ALIDé, to strengthen her capital base and increase her level of activity to better satisfy her customers.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy boxes of sugar, milk, canned food and soap

loans.name: Fiaaveifo

texts.en:
Fiaaveifo L. is 39 and married with 7 children (ages 1 - 16 years).  She owns a business venture, planting & harvesting  a variety of vegetables for sale.  Fiaaveifo has many years of experience in this business.  Fiaaveifo needs a loan of WST $1450 to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 160 tala or US $67 per week) to make improvements to her house.

In 2008, Fiaaveifo joined SPBD.  This is her 2nd loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Fiaaveifo's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Fiaaveifo L. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                1.5 out of 3
Level of Education:                              1.9 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         2 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              2.1 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress. The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation. A higher number represents a higher score. For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise

loans.name: Marieta

texts.en:
Marieta is a 59 years old and lives in the 3rd class municipality of Morong, an attractive province of Rizal. She and her husband have three children, all of whom are legal age and college students. She is married to Jaime S., a 63-year-old electrician and a loving husband.

In 2000, she joined ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap Inc.) a microfinance institution and Kiva field partner in the Philippines. Marieta makes and sells peanut butter and coco jam (sweet delicacies). She has been in business for more than five years. She has learned this kind of business through business training and seminars she attended. Her products are display and available at INSOL (and NGO partner of ASHI that provides business development training to entrepreneurs) enterprise center. Sometimes her products are also available at INSOL trade fair booths in shopping malls.

Marieta believes this loan of 40,000 Philippine pesos will be a big help and will contribute to the growth of her business. She will use all of the loans funds to expand her business of peanut butter and coco jam making.

Marieta dreams of having a stall for her growing business. She wants her children to finish their studies and live in comfortable house.

loans.use: Additional working capital for a peanut butter and coco jam making business.

loans.name: Mabel

texts.en: Mabel O. is 40 years old and married with 4 children. Her eldest child is 14 years old. She is happy because her children are doing well in school. Her husband is a civil servant and he also supports the home. Mabel is a friendly and hard working woman. She sells electronics like microwave ovens  and electrical kettles in her shop. With over 19 years experience in sales, she has been able to attract and retain more customers to her business. She hopes for a loan amount of NGN 70,000 to purchase more electronics to sell.  Mabel says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more electronics to sell

loans.name: Mary Jean

texts.en:
Mary Jean, age 30, owns a one-hectare rice field. She also maintains another eight hectares from which she also earns extra income. Together with her husband, she spends the whole day tilling the farm and making sure it is free of weeds and pests to ensure that their rice crop grows healthily. She said that she works hard for her three children. She wants them to have a proper education and a bright future. She was also able to start a small store, which she hopes will grow soon.

Mary Jean is asking for a loan of 6000 PHP. She will use it to buy seeds, fertilizer, and other needed farm supplies. She is also hoping to add supplies to her store.

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizer, and other needed farm supplies

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian P., 51, is making sure that her family has enough for their daily needs. Married to Filomeno P., a driver, she is blessed with one child. She makes sure that she helps her husband earn so that their family can have a better life.  She has been managing her own variety store for quite some time now.

Vivian has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year now. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow several times in CCT’s Cooperative.  She is consistent in paying her dues because she uses the money she borrows to expand and improve her business.     

Now with your help, she would like to apply for a PHP 15,000 loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital for her expanding business, buying groceries needed to replenish stocks in her current product inventory.

She dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she can provide for her children’s education.


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: buying groceries needed to replenish stocks in her current product inventory.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es: La Sra. Teresa se dedica a la venta de joyas al crédito por la zona de Pampahasi lleva tres años con esta actividad, es muy conocida por la zona y los pedidos que tiene son joyas artesanales para señoras de pollera ya que ellas utilizan joyas grandes para su sombrero, el topo para la manta, los anillos y los aretes grandes, tiene unos juegos de joyas completas que son muy bonitos y caros todos bañados en oro, ellos compran hechos y despues los venden en su joyeria, también Es casada, su esposo tiene su movilidad y trabaja como taxi, tiene tres hijos que están en  el colegio. El crédito será invertido en la compra de anillos y aretes, ya que tienen estos pedidos para una fiesta que se lleva cada año por la zona de Pampahasi estas joyas las usan el generalmente para las danzas de la morenada La Morenada o Danza de los Morenos es una danza Folkclorica Boliviana donde los bailarines se disfrazan como negros enmascarados con rasgos prominentes y las cholitas usan estas joyas para adornar sus sonbreros y para sujetar sus mantas, La Sra Teresa esta muy agradecida con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Señora Teresa is dedicated to the sale of jewelry on credit in the zone of Pampahasi. She has performed this activity for three years. She is very well known in the area and the orders that she fills are for craft jewelry for ladies who wear the traditional clothing, since they use large jewels for their hats, the fastening on their cloaks, rings and large earrings. She has some complete sets of jewels that are very pretty and expensive, all bathed in gold. She buys the jewels and later sellsthem in her jewelry shop. She is also married. Her husband has a vehicle and works as a taxi driver. She has three children that attend school. The loan will be invested in the purchase of rings and earrings, since she has orders for a festival that is held each year in the zone of Pampahasi. The jewels are used traditionally for the dances of the Morenada or Dances of the Dark, which is a folkloric Bolivian dance where the dancers disguise themselves in black adorned with prominent characteristics and the celebrants use these jewels for adorning their hats and to fasten their cloaks. Señora Teresa this very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the confidence shown her in granting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy jewels, rings and earrings for resale

loans.name: Juan Antonio

texts.es:
El Señor Juan Antonio es oriundo de la ciudad de Ybycui, vive en el Bº Santa Rosa de la misma ciudad, empezó en el negocio de la zapatería desde el año 1999.
         Con el correr de los años la producción de su negocio no fue del nada bueno, por esa razón sus hijos tuvieron que emigrar a otro pais con el fin de enviar ayuda económica, después de un tiempo pudo acceder a comprar una vaca lechera con la cual empezó a vender leche a vecinos, después compró otra vaca hasta que llegó a 5, la cantidad de vacunos con los que cuenta ahora gracias a la ayuda de sus hijos y con eso ya le provee de leche a todo el barrio donde vive.
         Al mismo tiempo trabajaba con su zapatería y con el correr del tiempo empezó a producir más, solicitó un préstamo a nuestra institución, para compra de materiales para la confección de calzados para estudiantes ya que en estas fechas es la temporada en la que más salida tiene ésta mercadería.
         Agradece a La Fundación Paraguaya y KIVA por su apoyo y por seguir confiando en él.
texts.en:
Mr. Juan Antonio is from the city of Ybycui, where he lives in Bº Santa Rosa. He started his shoe business in 1999. Over the years, the productivity of his business was not going well, so his children had to emigrate to another country, with the goal of sending money back. After some time, he agreed to buy a dairy cow, and he began to sell milk to his neighbors. Later, he bought another cow; he now has five cows, thanks to the help of his children. With these cows, he is able to provide milk to his entire neighborhood. At the same time, he continued to work in his shoe store, and with time, he began to produce more. He is requesting a loan from our institution to buy materials to make footwear for students, since this type of merchandise sells well at this time of the year. He is thankful to Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva for their support and for their continued confidence in him.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy leather and accessories to make shoes

loans.name: Amadou

texts.fr: Monsieur Amadou S., né en 1966, est plombier de métier depuis 28 ans. Avec la rareté des marchés de plomberie, il s'est lancé dans le commerce avec l'aide de ses 2 femmes pour augmenter ses revenues.Il a commencé cette activité en 2005 et vend particulièrement de l'huile de palme, arachide, ...etc. Il va très souvent à la rencontre de ses clients pour les placer les marchandises tandis qu'une de ses femmes se charge de la vente à la maison. Cependant, il sollicite un prêt de 150 000 FCFA pour renforcer cette activité secondaire qu'il gére avec ses femmes.
texts.en:
Mr. Amadou S., born in 1966, has been a plumber by trade for 28 years.  With the low demand for plumbing, he got started in commerce with the help of his two wives in order to increase his income.  He started this business in 2005 and sells in particular palm oil, peanuts, etc.  He often goes to meet customers to deliver merchandise, while one of his wives is responsible for making sales at the house.  However, Amadou is requesting a loan of 150,000 francs CFA for bolstering this secondary business that he runs with his wives.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying merchandise for resale

loans.name: Gumercinda

texts.es:
Gumercinda pertenece al banco comunal “La Unión de Ollantaytambo” de la Asociación Arariwa, tiene 46 años, es natural de Ollantaytambo y tiene cinco hijos. Actualmente, su principal actividad económica es la crianza de animales menores como por ejemplo gallinas y cuyes. Ya son 17 años que se dedica al negocio y le va excelente. 

Gumercinda es una persona trabajadora y emprendedora que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario salir adelante, ella requiere el préstamo para construir su casa y va comprar materiales como por ejemplo bloquetas de construcción y cemento. El anhelo de la socia es abrir un hotel en la ciudad de Ollantaytambo. 

Gumercinda se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Gumercinda belongs to the communal bank “La Unión de Ollantaytambo” of the Arariwa Association. She is 46 years old, a native of Ollantaytambo and has five children. Currently her main economic activity is raising small animals such as hens and guinea pigs. She has been in the business for 17 years and it is going very well for her. Gumercinda is a very hard-working person and an entreprenuer who looks for opportunities at every moment to get ahead. And with her daily efforts she gets on in life. She needs the loan to build her house. She is going to buy materials like, for example, cinder blocks and cement. Her desire is to open a hotel in the city of Ollantaytambo. Gumercinda is grateful for the opportunity she’s been given through this group and at the same time she promises to make the corresponding payments on schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Haynes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Gumercinda needs the loan to build her house.

loans.name: Him

texts.en: Mrs. Him S. is a Cambodian laborer who has been working in the local garment industry, located in the middle of Phnom Penh, for more than eight years. Her husband helps her support their family by fishing in Tunle Sap Lake. She is 40 years old and has given birth to four children. Two of the children are now married and sell fish, for their occupation. The other two children attend school or go to work. This is the second cycle of loan that she has requested. Him S. will use this loan to add to her savings in order to purchase a motorcycle to provide transportation for the family.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle to provide transportation for the family.

loans.name: Jean Baptiste

texts.en:
Jean Baptiste is 33 years old, married with two children who are 2 and 5 years old.  Jean Baptiste is commonly known in the business of selling Irish potatoes and he has been in this business for about 2 years.  The hours of his business are from 6 am until 7 pm every day.

Jean Baptiste has realized that he is not presently able to satisfy the demand of his customers, so he wants to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company.  With this loan, Jean Baptiste will purchase a large quantity of Irish potatoes and he really hopes that the demand of his customers will totally be met.  Once this demand is totally met, Jean Baptiste will hopefully earn a lot of profit, more than previously, and this profit will be used for a further reinvestment in his business as well as saving for a better future.

loans.use: A large quantity of Irish potatoes

loans.name: Gloria Marlene

texts.es:
la sra. Gloria Marlene R. C. se dedica a la venta de mercaderia como ser ropa y zapatos, lociones.
tiene seis años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad.
Asi mismo los fines de semana elabora Nacatamales ya que tiene muchos clientes y se los encargan porque son muy ricos, esta casada y junto a su esposo han logrado sacar adelante a su familia, el credito lo utilzara para
comprar mercaderia varias y poder salir a vender a comunidades cercanas. Doña Gloria es una mujer 
muy activa y disfruta mucho lo que hace.
texts.en:
Gloria Marlene R. C. dedicates herself to selling merchandise such as clothing, shoes, and lotions. She has dedicated herself to this type of activity for six years. Likewise, on weekends, she makes nacatamales (steamed corncakes). She has a number of customers who demand her food because it is so delicious. She is married and, together with her husband, has managed to help her family get ahead. She will use the loan to buy a variety of merchandise, and then travel throughout the neighboring communities to sell her goods. Gloria is an active woman, who very much enjoys what she does.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase clothing and shoes.

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet is married with six children and all of them are at school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She owns a restaurant selling all types of food like traditional and western food.  

She wants to use this loan to buy more bunches of bananas, Irish potatoes, beef, sweet potatoes and cooking oil. She buys these foodstuffs from Ndeeba market and incurs some little transport costs to and from the market. Besides this food business, she also owns rental rooms, which gives her additional income. She has been in this business for the last five years. She sells to all categories of people, both on a retail and wholesale basis. She works six days a week. 

She depends on this job for a living. Her business challenges are defaulters and the rainy season. She resides in and owns a three-roomed house and the family has no access to electricity or piped water.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas, sweet and Irish potatoes, beef and cooking oil

loans.name: Carolina

texts.es: La señora Carolina tiene 46 años, es madre soltera y tiene 3 hijos, menores de edad. La señora se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general, ella vende calzado, perfumes, tratamientos y ropa. Ella ya tiene 2 años de tener este negocio, el cual empezó debido a los pocos ingresos que tenia decide dedicarse a este negocio. Ella desea este crédito con el objetivo de realizar compras variadas de sus productos, ya que quiere empezar a vender más para ganarles más. Además, aduce la señora, cada día los precios de los productos están cada día más caros. Este se ha convertido en un desafió para ella, debido a que la situación económica del país cada día está más difícil. Ella sueña con seguir adelante en su negocio, tratando siempre de que sus hijos estudien y se preparen.
texts.en:
Carolina is 46 years old and a single mother of 3 children, all minors. She sells merchandise in general, footwear, perfumes, beauty treatments and clothing. She has been in this business for 2 years and started because she had very low income. She would like this loan in order to purchase a variety of products and would like to sell more so she can earn more. Furthermore, the products are becoming more expensive every day and this has become a challenge for her because the country´s economic situation is becoming more difficult every day. She hopes to keep her business going and to always try to have her children study and prepare themselves.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Mrs. Keo Nop Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Twenty people, who live in Tuol Trea village in TaK. province, make up this village bank loan. Mrs. K. N., born in 1964, was selected by the group loan members to be the village bank president. Each group member will use their portion of the loan to support their businesses.

She and her husband, Mr. Saroeun Net, are farmers who own one-hectare plot of land to cultivate rice to sell to support their family's living, and he is a fisherman. Her problem is that her husband does not have enough fishing nets to use. So to improve this condition, Mrs. K. N. is seeking a loan to buy fishing nets and she will use the rest of the loan to buy fertilizer and hire farming laborers to grow rice. She is a mother of five children, two of whom are seamstresses in a garment factory, while the others are attending school and helping with their parents’ businesses.

loans.use: To buy fishing nets.

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en:
Valentina is a small market entrepreneur from Novaya Kahovka. She is a divorcee. Valentina raises two children– a 19-year-old son Dmitryi and a 7-year-old daughter Elvira. With two children to care for, she works really hard to make ends meet. Valentina launched her knitted wear sales business 17 years ago. To date, she has already invested about 50,000 Grivnyas in this trade. Her turnover capital amounts to 40,000 Grivnyas. Monthly net profit amounts to 8,000 Grivnyas. 

Valentina is seeking a 10,000 Grivnya loan. She is hoping to use it as an investment in her working capital. Valentina is planning to increase her supply of assorted knitted wear merchandise for women, thus attracting more potential customers to her kiosk this fall season.

loans.use: To increase supply of knitted wear merchandise for sale

loans.name: Tuy

texts.en:
Tuy S., 48, is married and resides with her husband and four children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. S. sells chicken porridge, earning an income of about USD 3 per day. Her husband is a construction foreman, earning an income of about USD 6 per day. 

The family has to spend USD 80 on food, UDS 20 on children education, and USD 15 on electricity supply every month. S. is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase construction supplies to improve her husband’s business. In the future, she would like to use any additional profits to repair her house. This is her fifth loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy construction supplements.

loans.name: Nery

texts.es: Nery, de 41 años, es una mujer trabajadora, esta casado con Eleazar, de 44 años, ambos tienen 7 hijos, ellos viven en una casa alquilada ubicada en la localidad de Unión Leticia. Todas las mañanas desde muy temprano se dedica a la venta de comida en un pequeño cuarto que acondicionó en su hogar, y por las noches vende hamburguesas; de esta manera este oficio le resulta muy rentable y puede apoyar en los gastos del hogar. Pero no solo a esa actividad se dedica Nery, desde muy pequeña aprendió a trabajar la tierra, ya cuando creció y consolidó su familia, pudo adquirir terrenos en donde cultiva habas, arveja y espinaca; con el tiempo y la experiencia que tiene, logro adecuarse bien al mercado y alquiló más terrenos de cultivo, con ello puede sembrar en grandes cantidades, por ende obtiene mejores ganancias. Ahora ella quiere comprar sus propios terrenos de cultivo; como también abrir su propio restaurante. Es el quinto crédito con MFP y está muy contenta de pertenecer a su banco comunal, donde reina la unión y solidaridad. Con el crédito que obtendrá, comprará fertilizantes para su cultivo de habas, ya que muy pronto cosechará.
texts.en: Nery, who is 41, is a hard-working woman. She is married to Eleazar who is 44 and they both have seven children. They live in a rented house located in Unión Leticia. Every morning, starting very early, she is dedicated to selling food in a small room in her house. And at night, she sells hamburgers. In this way, this job has become very profitable and she is able to pay the bills. But she is not only dedicated to this work. At a young age, Nery learned to farm and when she grew up and consolidated her family she was able to acquire land where she cultivates beans, peas and spinach. With time and the experience that she has, she was able to adapt to the market and rent more farmland. With this, she was able to plant in great quantities and obtain better earnings. Now, she wishes to buy her own farmland and open her own restaurant. This is her fifth loan with MFP and she is very happy to belong to her community bank where unity and solidarity reigns. With this loan, she will obtain fertilizers for her bean crops since she will harvest them very soon.

loans.use: Comprar fertilizantes para cuidar su cultivo de habas.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is 41 years old. He is married with two children ages, six and 12, who both attend school. He is a farmer from Murang'a town in central Kenya. He has been farming for 20 years and employs one farmhand. His mixed farm produces coffee, tea and milk, which he sells through cooperative societies. He depends mainly on the income from his farm to cater for the needs of his family.

Patrick has requested this loan of 53,000 KES through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The increased income from the sale of milk will help improve the living standards of his family. His major challenge has been the fluctuation in market prices for his products. He plans to increase the number of his dairy cows, which will increase his milk productivity in the future.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Biyabu

texts.en:
Biyabu is a single woman with one girl who attends school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food, clothing and school fees. 

She operates a  Leso (Kikoi's) selling business from home to her neighbours and passersby.  In additional she owns a rental house that contributes to her other source of income. Biyabu faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She hopes to expand and build more rental houses in the future. 

With the KES 40,000 she wants to purchase bags of cement and timber to expand her rental houses and pay for the installation of electricity in her rental houses. She decided to join Yehu to access loans and improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase bags of cement and timber to expand her rental houses and pay for the installation of electricity in her rental houses.

loans.name: Aziza

texts.en:
Aziza is a married woman with one child who has graduated from school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity, but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family.

For more than 14 years, she has operated a secondhand clothing sales business, selling at the market to town residents, neighbors and passersby. Aziza faces a major challenge of high cost of transporting clothes to the marketplace. She hopes to establish a boutique in the future. 

She decided to join Yehu to get loans to boost her business. With the loan of Kshs 20,000, she wants to purchase a bale of clothes.

loans.use: To  purchase clothing for resale

loans.name: Bev

texts.en:
Mr. Bev M. (in the photo), 58, is a widower with two sons. Both are garment factory workers.  

Bev is a motor taxi driver. His sons do not have transportation to get to work, so they very often spend a lot of money for traveling costs. Bev is asking for his first loan of $800 to purchase a motorcycle for his sons.  

The family lives in a village approximately fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for his sons to get to work.

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es: Maria Teresa tiene 69 años, su actividad es una pulpería. Hace más de 14 años que tiene este negocio inicio por la necesidad de una fuente de ingreso necesaria para mantener a sus 3 hijos que desde muy pequeños se ha hecho cargo de ellos. Ella tiene mucho tiempo de tener su negocio y atender a sus clientes que siempre llegan en busca de diferentes productos. El motivo de su crédito es para la compra de materia prima como golosinas, refrescos, pan, detergentes, granos básicos entre otras cosas que son necesarias.
texts.en:
María Teresa, 69, has a grocery store.  She’s had it for over 14 years.  She started it because she needed a source of income to support her three children whom she’s cared for since they were very little.  She has been in business taking care of her customers who always come by looking for various products for a long time.

The reason for the loan is to buy raw materials like: sweets, soft drinks, bread, detergents and basic grains among other necessary things.

loans.use: To buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is thirty years old, married to a businessman, and has two children living in her own house in Kamwenge Uganda. She aspires to educate her children through university level. She has been trading in produce for four years and the business is very profitable, even amidst the challenge of price fluctuation. Agnes needs the loan to buy maize and beans for sale.

loans.use: Purchasing beans and maize for sale

loans.name: Munawar's Group

texts.en:
Munawar is a widow; she lost her husband a few years ago as a result of sudden death. It was a very difficult time for her but she recovered her senses and started working at people's homes to survive financially. 

Now all three of her sons do different work, so Munawar has stopped working. She now stays at home and does her household responsibilities. Her two eldest sons are electricians by profession and have a workshop in the market, where they repair refrigerators and other electronic items. Her youngest son sells clothes. He makes bulk purchases from Multan and Faisalabad and sells in his local city. They all contribute to their family financially through their earnings.  

Munawar has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her sons, who want to improve their electronics-repair business. With the loan, they will purchase the latest repairing tools, which will help them do their business better and offer quality services to their clients. 

They have been operating this business for the past six years and Munawar is confident that an investment will improve their business and increase their income. She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her fourth loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained a good credit behavior and never missed any meetings. 

Note: In the photo, the lady holding the book called Asasah Passbook is Munawar.

loans.use: To buy the latest repairing tools for an electronics-repairing business

loans.name: Lennin Anselmo

texts.es:
LENNIN ANSELMO R. M. TIENE DOS AÑOS DE TRABAJAR COMO CAJERO, ES SOLTERO SIN HIJOS ACTUALMENTE ESTUDIA EN LA UNIVERSIDAD POR LA NOCHE Y TRABAJA POR EL DIA.
EL ACUDE A CEPRODEL PARA SOLICITAR SU PRIMER FINANCIAMIENTO PARA COMPRA DE MATERIALES DE CONSTRUUCION COMO: ARENA, CEMENTO, HIERRO Y ZINC PARA LA CONSTRUCCION DE UN CUARTO EN SU CASA DE HABITACION.
texts.en:
Lennin Anselmo R. M. has worked as a Cashier for two years.  He’s single and has no children.  He is currently studying at the University at night and works during the day.

He is calling upon Ceprodel to request his first loan to buy building materials and supplies like: sand, cement, iron rods and zinc metal sheeting to build a room at his house.

loans.use: To buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Olga

texts.es:
Olga, tiene 50 años de edad, es casada, tiene dos hijos y vive en la ciudad del Calca del departamento de Cusco, Perú. Olga trabaja en el Ministerio de Salud en el área administrativa, ella nos cuenta que tiene una pequeña botica. Ya son 10 años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Olga en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar medicamentos.  

Olga pertenece al banco comunal “Señor de Huanca” de la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Olga is 50 years old, married, and has two children. She lives in the city of Calca in the Department of Cusco, Peru. Olga works for the Ministry of Health in the area of administration. She tells us that she has a small pharmacy. She has been in this business for 10 years and she does well thanks to the effort she puts into her work. Right now, Olga needs the loan to buy medicines.

Olga belongs to the Señor de Huanca Communal Bank within Asociación Arariwa. She is grateful for the opportunity provided with the loan and promises to make her payments according to schedule.

loans.use: To buy medicines

loans.name: Jairo

texts.en: Jairo S. Osanois 41 years old, married, and has five children.  He has been operating a cafeteria for four years.  He was previously running a barber shop.   He has employed two people to help him in his business.  Through Faulu Kenya, he has learned how to save his money, which has helped him to improve his business.  He hopes to open a big hotel in the future.  He is requesting a loan of 20,000 KES, which he will use renovate his business premises.

loans.use: To renovate his business premises

loans.name: Brigida

texts.es:
Brigida tiene 42 años y nació en la comunidad de Yanahuara de la provincia de Urubamba del departamento del   Cusco, Perú. La socia Brigida es casada y fruto de esta unión tiene tres hijos. Actualmente, Luzmila vive en la comunidad donde nació y su actividad económica de Brigida es la crianza de animales menores como por ejemplo ovejas, chanchos, gallinas y cuyes. En esta oportunidad Brigida requiere el préstamo para comprar animales como por ejemplo cuyes.  
      
Brigida pertenece al banco comunal “Villa Marcelo Virgen del Carmen” de la Asociación Arariwa Cusco y se encuentra muy contenta por los servicios que le ofrece la Asociación.
texts.en:
Brigida is 42 years old, and she was born in the community of Yanahuara, in the province of Urubamba in the department of Cusco, Peru. Brigida is married with three children, and she currently lives in the community where she was born. She raises small livestock animals, such as sheep, pigs, chickens, and guinea pigs, for a living. Brigida hopes to use this loan to buy animals, particularly guinea pigs (a traditional food source in the Peruvian Andes).
      
Brigida belongs to the "Villa Marcelo Virgen del Carmen" community bank, part of the Cusco Arariwa Association, and she is very pleased with the services offered by the association.

loans.use: to buy animals such as guinea pigs.

loans.name: Mastura's Group

texts.en:
Mastura Z., 62, is the leader of this group. She is a resident of the town Kadamjai, known for its stibium plant, exporting its goods to all parts of the country and to neighboring nations. Mastura’s husband works in that plant, while she has been breeding and reselling livestock animals for forty-one years now. 

Her kids are grown and live independently, so she devotes her entire time to promoting her business. The initial capital was only 500 soms, but Mastura believes that the main reason for success in business is commitment and full devotion. Her secret formula of success has worked out well and now her business brings 3 000 soms monthly. The purpose of Mastura’s loan is the purchase of five sheep. As the leader of the group, Mastura promises to control and motivate the entire group to work hard for the sake of family prosperity and successful repayment of the loan.

         --- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
								
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase five sheep.

loans.name: Enhtuvshin

texts.en:
Enhtuvshin is 46 years old and lives with his wife and two children in their own house in Dornod province, Mongolia. His older daughter is a student while his younger one helps with the family business. He manages a good trading business at a border city of Mongolia. Before his business operation he used to work as a driver in his younger brother's company for 10 years. He started a motorcycle trading business three years ago and gained much experience. Also, he sells grocery products such is a rice, flour, etc. 

Even within this short period of time, he has managed to build a strong customer base and a good relationship with his suppliers. He is planning to expand his business in the future. He is a serious man who attributes his business success to his good accounting skills. He is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT of loan to purchase more products and to increase his business sales.

loans.use: To purchase more products for resale.

loans.name: Vinanua

texts.en:
Vinanua is from the village of San Vicente Alto, Oroquieta City. She is 33 years old, married and has two school-aged children. Vinanua runs a rice retail business.

She has been engaged in her business for 2 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. Vinanua joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. 

Vinanua is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP with which she will purchase more sacks of rice for her rice retail business. This will be her fifth loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand her business. 

About PMPC
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of rice for her rice retail business

loans.name: Delia

texts.es: Delia, de 40 años, es una mujer luchadora y honesta, que tiene 3 hijos, los dos mayores son de su primer compromiso y laboran de manera independiente, mientras el último hijo es de su pareja Jeremías con quien convive desde hace 3 años en su casa propia, ubicada en el caserío de Alto Yapas. Las horas que emplea en la agricultura, junto a su esposo, se ve recompensado cuando comercializa los productos oriundos de la zona. Donde siembra café, frutas cítricas y plátanos, en sus terrenos propios, desde hace 3 años. En temporadas de cosecha, ella recibe la ayuda de sus hijos, a quienes le paga por día 20 soles, lo que más le gusta de su labor es retirar la maleza de sus tierras, para que cada fruto se desarrolle libremente; sin embargo le incomoda tener que trasladar sus cosechas hacía su localidad para encajonarlo y embarcarlo a los mercados de “Lima” y “Huancayo“. Por ello hace poco comenzó a entregar el grano de café a una cooperativa que se encarga de exportarlos a otros países. Como su oficio es rentable, quiere adquirir más terrenos productivos y plantar más cantidad de frutos. De igual manera, acondicionó una pequeña tienda de comestibles en su casa donde vende productos de primera necesidad. Pero según menciona le falta mejorar la infraestructura de su vivienda, por ello está ahorrando cada vez más, y de esa manera poder mejorar su calidad de vida. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Los progresistas”, y este es el tercer crédito con MFP, donde conoce la metodología de trabajo de su banco comunal, está feliz de continuar perteneciendo a este grupo, porque es unido. Delia, comenzó su cosecha de café, con la primera fase que es la extracción de los primeros granos maduros de café, por ello con el crédito comprará varios sacos de abono orgánico que esparcirá entre sus cultivos para que se nivele el proceso de maduración.
texts.en: Delia is 40 and a hardworking and honest woman.  She has 3 children, the two oldest work independently and the youngest is the last child of her companion of 3 years, Jeremías; they live together in Alto Yapas. The time she spends working with her husband in agriculture are profitable at harvest time; they grow coffee, citrus fruit and plantains on their own land, and have done so for the last 3 years. Her children help her bring in the harvest, and she pays them 20 soles per day.  She enjoys clearing the cropland and weeding, allowing the fruit crops to develop.  She finds it difficult to transport the harvest, package it and get it to markets in cities such as Lima and Huancayo. Delia has now begun selling coffee beans to an export company, and now plans to acquire more land to put into coffee cultivation. She has also established a small general store in her house, and hopes to improve its conditions in the future. Delia is a member of the communal lender “Los progresistas”, and this loan will be her third with MFP, so she is familiar with the group's credit terms. Delia will use this credit to buy sacks of organic fertilizer for her coffee crop, to increase quality and production.

loans.use: to buy organic crop fertilizer

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es:
Manuel tiene 61 años de edad, es soltero vive con parientes tiene 6 hijos todos son casado, viven en Parroquia San Pablo perteneciente al Cantón San Miguel.

Los miembros de la V.R.C UNION Y ESPERANZA  se encuentra ubicada en la Parroquia San Pablo a 30 minutos de la oficina en San Miguel los miembros de esta ventanilla se dedican a la agricultura siembra de maíz, papas y al comercio ventas de legumbres y otros.

Manuel se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y en pocas cantidades siembra tomate de árbol, este trabajo lo viene desarrollando desde hace mucho tiempo, las compras las realiza en San Miguel y Vende sus productos en San Pablo y San Miguel en las ferias.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas de maíz y de tomate, el crédito el ayudado a aumentar los ingresos y la producción, ha enfrentado desafíos como la falta de trabajadores y el variación del clima que en ocasiones a dañado los cultivos. Su sueño es comprar terrenos.

Le gusta festejar todas las fiestas del año.
texts.en:
Manuel is 61 years old, single and living with relatives.  He has six married children.  They live in San Pablo Parish belonging to San Miguel Canton.

The “Unión y Esperanza” (Unity & Hope) communal bank is located in San Pablo Parish 30 minutes from the San Miguel office.  The members of this communal bank are corn and potato farmers and sell vegetables and others.

Manuel farms corn and small amounts of tree tomatoes.  He’s been in this occupation for a long time.  He makes his purchases in San Miguel and his sales take place in farmers markets in San Pablo and San Miguel.

He is asking for a loan to buy corn and tomato seeds.  The loan has helped him increase income and production.  He has faced challenges like the scarcity of laborers and variations in the weather that occasionally have damaged crops.  His dream is to buy land.  He enjoys celebrating all the annual festivals.

loans.use: to buy corn and tomato seeds.

loans.name: Luzminda

texts.en:
Luzminda is 51 years old and married. She has six children.

She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Luzminda has been farming sugarcane for 10 years and also earns additional income by running a sari-sari (variety) store and raising pigs.

Luzminda is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to buy more farm land .

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Job

texts.en:
Job is 37 years old, married, and has five children.  He has been in farming for over ten years, producing maize, tea and tomatoes, which are all sold locally. He employs two farmhands.  He also operates a retail shop to subsidize his farming.

Job has requested a loan of 46,800 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow.  He says the loan will help uplift his family's living standards. He is planning to get another loan after full repayment of the first one and buy more cows.

Job says lack of capital and crop diseases are the challenges to farming.

loans.use: purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is married and has five children. She is married to a farmer. For the past 11 years, Elizabeth has lived in Elmina. She sells ladies underwear and uses her income to support her family and help pay school fees and utility bills. 

Elizabeth is requesting a loan to buy ladies underwear to sell. With the profit from her expanded business, Elizabeth plans to save to open a shop.

loans.use: to buy ladies underwear to sell

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph has a mixed farm in his hometown in eastern Kenya that produces milk, potatoes, maize and French beans. He has been in the farming business for 20 years now, selling all his farm produce at the local market. He employs one farmhand. He also depends on his pension pay to cater to the needs of his family. His major challenges in farming have been insufficient water for irrigation and pests and diseases that affect his production.

Joseph has made a loan request of 30,000 Kenyan shillings in order to cultivate french beans and cowpeas. He says that the income that will be generated from this project will enable him start a small grocery shop. He intends to acquire at least five dairy cows and an acre of land to expand his horticultural farming in the next five years. 

Joseph is 67 and a married father of four children who are all adults.

loans.use: To cultivate french beans and cow peas.

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
Nilda is 54 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is separated with nine children.
 
Nilda has a retail shop that sells fruits & vegetables like melons & squash. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for PHP 4,000 to buy squash & melons to sell.

Nilda is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Nilda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy squash & melons to sell

loans.name: Chanthouen

texts.en: 27 year old Chanthouen sells vegetables with her husband and makes $5 per day. She has two children, aged 1 and 2 years. Every month, she has to spend $80 on food, $5 on electricity, and $10 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $500 to buy pigs to raise and then sell. This loan will help her family to have another income besides selling vegetables, and will enable them to save money for sending her children to school when they are ready.

loans.use: To buy pigs to raise and sell

loans.name: Felista

texts.en:
Felista has practiced farming for the last eight years. She is 32 years old and the single mother of three school-going children.  

She was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers and this will be her second loan. She repaid her previous loan of KES 10,000 well and in good time. She plans to use the loan to buy seeds and fertilizer.

In the future, she hopes to become one of the leading farmers in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Tomasa

texts.en: Tomasa, who works hard to support her family, is married and has been operating a fishing business in the Philippines for five years. She has requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase a new engine for her fishing boat. Tomasa would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase a new engine for her fishing boat.

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan is 28 years old, married and has one child. The family lives in the peaceful village of San Jose, Baggao, Cagayan. To make a living, she operates a general store selling farm supplies in the nearby public market. She had been in this business for almost a year. The daily net profit of PHP 500 goes to their daily needs at home such as meals and the allowance of her child.

She has insufficient funds, which is why she is asking for a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy hog feed, medicines, vitamins, fertilizers and seeds to sell in her store. This will help increase the capacity of sales from her business.

She hopes to earn more income and improve her daily sales to boost her profits for the education of her child.

loans.use: to buy hog feed, medicines, vitamins, fertilizers and seeds to sell in her store.

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora is 43 years old and is married and the mother of four children. She lives in Bunawan, Calamba Misamis Occidental. For the past six years, she has run a general store and she earns a monthly income of 3,000 PHP. Nora’s general store is a great help to her family and helps sustain their day-to-day needs. 

Nora is requesting a 5,000 PHP loan to expand her business and buy more products to sell. In the future, she plans to be more progressive with the help of GDMPC.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise

loans.name: Abd Al Kareem

texts.en:
Abd A. Kareem, a hardworking, independent, 57-year-old man, has three daughters and two sons. 

He is a well-known person in A. Karak where he lives because he is running more than one business; one of them is an aluminum accessories workshop where they make and sell aluminum window frames and other stuff. 

This workshop has been successfully running for almost four years. Now Abd A. Kareem has applied for this loan in order to buy more aluminum materiA. and also improve the workshop decorations.

loans.use: to buy more aluminum material and also improve the workshop decoration

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert, who is married and blessed with two children, lives in Disimuray, Cauayan City, Isabela, where he has operated his corn farm business for 10 years. His wife manages their hog-raising business for additional income. He is now requesting a loan of 25,000 PHP to purchase fertilizers, seedlings and insecticides for his farm.

In the future, Robert is hoping to grow his business for the betterment of their daily living. He believes that nothing is impossible to a person who has strong faith and strength of mind.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, seedlings and insecticides for his corn farm.

loans.name: Maria Paz

texts.es: La señora María es cliente nueva de la institución ella es de nacionalidad Chilena pero esta radicando en Bolivia desde hace diez años  ella tiene tres hijos que se encuentran estudiando a los cuales los esta haciendo educar sola ya que esta separada de su esposo,  la Sra.  María se dedica  ala venta de ropa la cual trae de chile cada dos meses ella esta viviendo en la zona de Irpavi II en una casa en alquiler esta solicitando el préstamo para la compra de mercadería por las fiestas de fin de año para traer ropa de temporada ella la comercializa entre sus amigas y mamas del colegio de sus hijos, es una persona muy amable y dinámica, se siente agradecida por la confianza brindada en la otorgación del credito.
texts.en:
Señora María is a new client for the institution.  She is a Chilean national, but has been living in Bolivia for the last ten years.  She has three children who attend school.  She is ensuring their education on her own, as she is separated from her husband.

Señora María works selling clothes that she brings over from Chile every other month.  She lives in the Irpavi area in a rented home.  She is requesting the loan to purchase merchandise for the year-end festivals, so that she can get seasonal clothing.  She sells to her friends and to the moms of her children's school-friends.

She is a very friendly and dynamic woman, who is grateful for the trust being given to her through provision of the loan.

loans.use: to purchase seasonal clothing.

loans.name: Orbany

texts.es: El señor Orbany a sus 39 años de edad es padre de dos hijos de 9 y 4 años de edad, se dedica a la soldadura, plomería y arreglos eléctricos en fincas y casas, el cual alterna con la atención de una legumbreria. El señor Orbany aprendió este oficio por medio de un hermano.  El señor Orbany necesita comprar un compresor que le permita realizar con mayor facilidad su trabajo con el fin de brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes. El sueño del señor Orbany es tener su propio taller de soldadura, plomería y generar con este empleos directos y mejores ingresos para brindar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Señor Orbany is 39 years old, and is the father of two children aged 9 and 4.  He works doing soldering, plumbing and electrical repairs in farms and homes, which he does in addition to selling vegetables.

Señor Orbany learned his trade from his brother. Señor Orbany needs to purchase a compressor which will allow him to undertake his work with greater ease, with the end goal of providing better service to his customers.  

Señor Orbany's dream is to have is own soldering and plumbing workshop.  With this he would be able to take on jobs directly and earn better income to provide his family with a better quality of life..

loans.use: to purchase a work tool (a compressor)

loans.name: Shida B Group

texts.en:
Bamanasi is the facilitator of the Shida B group. Bamanasi and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Bamanasi and his group during Kenya’s next planting seas on in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

Bamanasi takes care of two children at home. He joined One Acre Fund in order to grow enough food to ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Bamanasi had a very good maize yield, harvesting 16 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Bamanasi was only able to harvest 8 bags of maize on 1 acre of land.

With income from maize sales, Bamanasi will educate his children and save for future use.

In 2012, the members of Shida B group will each plant maize plots of between ½ and 1 acre of land.

The photograph shows Bamanasi with his group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.en: Beatriz lives in the town of Talibon, Bohol. She is 60 years old and earns a living through farming. Beatriz tills her land to grow rice crops to sell. She also raises pigs in her backyard. Beatriz works hard to improve her income in order to support her family financially. She requested this loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers and pig feed. She plans to help send her nieces and nephews to school.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and pig feed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction materials

loans.name: Kefah

texts.en:
Kefah is 49 years old married woman, a mother of 5 children. she lives in Al Russeifeh, Jordan.
Kefah is looking to have a loan of 500JDs thus she can improve her house living conditions, fix it and buy some new furniture.

loans.use: to fix her home and buy new furniture

loans.name: Sabine

texts.fr: Mariée à un coiffeur du nom de Paul, Sabine est âgée de 24 ans. Sabine n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Sabine vit avec son mari. Les diverses charges de la maison sont supportées par le couple. Pour assurer ses diverses charges, Sabine vend des chaussures depuis six ans. Afin de renforcer son activité, Sabine sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de son activité et de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle. Les crédits antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter des chaussures.

loans.name: Maria Ines

texts.es:
La socia  es la señora  María Ines, ella pertenece al banco “Los Lideres” de la ciudad del Cusco - Perú.  
La socia tiene 41 años de edad es soltera y tiene 03 hijos, la socia alterna sus actividades  diarias con el negocio de restaurante, la socia  lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia elabora diferentes tipos de platos como arroz con pollo, sopas, saltados entre otros, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicito el crédito para la compra de insumos como aceite, arroz entre otros.
L a socia María Ines está muy agradecida con KIVA por permitirle continuar con su actividad económica la cual representa el principal ingreso económico y sustento de su familia.
texts.en:
Sra. María Ines belongs to the Communal Bank “Los Lideres” (The Leaders) which is in the city of Cusco, Peru. She is 41 years old, single, and has three children. María Ines divides her time between her daily activities and her restaurant business. She has been in this line of work for quite some time and is doing very well thanks to the effort she puts forth each day into her business. María Ines prepares different types of dishes such as chicken with rice, soups, stir-fried meats, and other foods. She wants to keep working so that she can continue to support her family.

María Ines is requesting a loan in order to buy supplies such as oil, rice, and other items. She is very appreciative of Kiva for allowing her to continue her business since it represents her main source of income for sustaining her family.

loans.use: to buy rice, oil, and other supplies.

loans.name: Şemsiye

texts.en:
Semsiye is a married mother of three.  She sells cosmetics products through a network system.  She has used a microloan twice before to buy cosmetic and cleaning products wholesale, which she then succesfully sold.  With her third microloan she plans to buy more cosmetic and cleaning products wholesale and expand her business.  She is motivated by her desire to provide for her childrens’ future.

Translated from Turkish by Maya staff

Şemsiye hanım evli üç çocuk annesi.  Netwörk sistemi ile temizlik ve kozmetik ürünleri pazarlaması yapıyor.  İki kez mikro kredi kullandı toptan kozmetik ve temizlik malzemeleri aldı sattı ve para kazandı.  Kullandığı üçüncü mikro kredi ile temizlik ve kozmetik ürünlerini toptan alarak satarak para kazanmak ve işlerini geliştirip çocuklarına iyi bir gelecek sağlamayı hedefliyor.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and cleaning products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Jane intends to invest the USD 300 into her business and use it to buy paint. There ready market hence she will be able to pay her loan with ease.

loans.name: Afua Etonam

texts.en:
Ms. Afua Etonam T. is a married mother of four children. Her husband's business of raising chickens is not very profitable, so Ms. T. has begun selling smoked fish in order to meet her family's needs. She is a very devoted and energetic woman when it comes to her business. She is calm and always welcoming and has been able to earn the trust of everyone in her town. Ms. T.'s supply can no longer meet the demand of the market. In order to do so, she is requesting a loan of $700 to build a second oven, buy a larger supply of fish and increase her production of smoked fish. This will increase her income and also her family's well-being.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame T. Afua Etonam est une femme mariée et mère de quatre (4) enfants. L’activité principale de son mari est l’élevage des poules ordinaires, ce qui n’est pas très rentable. Pour cela, Madame T. se lance dans la vente des poissons fumés pour subvenir aux besoins de la famille. C’est une femme très dévouée et dynamique dans les activités commerciales. Calme et toujours accueillante, elle arrive à gagner la confiance de tous les habitants de sa localité. L’offre de Madame T. n’arrive plus à couvrir la demande du marché. Pour cela, elle sollicite un crédit de $700 pour la fabrication d’un second four, s’approvisionner plus en poisson et augmenter sa production en poisson fumé. Ceci augmentera son chiffre d’affaire en vue du bien être de sa famille.

loans.use: To build a second oven and to buy, smoke and sell fish

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa sells hats, shoes and clothes to adolescents in her neighborhood. She has three of her own, two girls and one boy, whom she raises and puts through school with the income generated by her business. Teresa has paid off her first loan from Esperanza, which gave her the opportunity to start her own business. This loan will allow her to replenish her inventory and expand the types of products she can sell.

OTE: Teresa is a member of an Esperanza solidarity group, which means this $750 will go to finance her business as well as four other micro-entrepreneurs in her community, whom Teresa has gone through training with and they will make each loan repayment together. You will receive journals covering Teresa's progress and that of her fellow group members.

loans.use: Invest in hats, shoes, t-shirts, skirts and pants for her clothing store inventory

loans.name: Angélica

texts.es:
Angelica is married and has a 5-year-old son. Her husband is a construction worker, and his job is on and off. Angelica wanted to help him with expenses because they couldn't survive on his wages alone. Two year ago, she decided started her own business. Prior to this, she had helped her sister sell used clothing. At first, she started selling beauty products of a well-known Mexican brand, and later she decided to combine both ventures, which is what she does currently.

Angelica is requesting a loan of $200 to add more clothing to her stock and to satisfy her clients' orders for beauty products. She plans to repay the loan within three months and hopes you will help her continue growing her business. She is grateful for your support.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Angélica esta casada y tiene un hijo pequeño de 5 años de edad, su esposo trabaja como albañil y su trabajo es eventual, por ello es que Angélica decidió ayudarlo con los gastos del hogar por que no les alcanza con el sueldo del esposo. Hace 2 años fue que ella decidió tener su negocio propio por que antes de eso, ella ayudaba a su hermana en la venta de ropa usada, pero luego empezó ella a vender productos de belleza de una marca muy conocida en México y posteriormente, decidió combinar ambas actividades y es ahora a lo que ella se dedica.

Angélica esta solicitando un préstamo por la cantidad de US $ 200 para poder abastecerse de ropa y también pode cubrir los pedidos que ya tiene de sus productos de belleza, ella ofrece pagar el préstamo en 3 meses y espera que la apoyes para continuar creciendo con su negocio, ella te agradece tu colaboración.

loans.use: Purchase used clothing and beauty products

loans.name: Nataliya

texts.en: Nataliya owns a clothing and shoe sales business in Marganets, Ukraine. She started her business nine years ago, choosing to sell clothing because it was an area she knew well. Her business has done well with a good location and exposure in the market and has had stable sales. Nataliya has developed a good reputation over the years through her personal integrity, kindness toward others, and a positive attitude. Nataliya has requested a loan to add to her working capital and enable her to open a new sales location. She looks forward to expanding her business and increasing her income.

loans.use: Purchase inventory for new location

loans.name: Elghun

texts.en:
Mr. Elghun is a low income vulnerable person. He is 24 and lives in the village of Saatli city, which is situated in the south-central area of the Azerbaijan Republic in the Caucasus region.

Elghun rents a small shop in the local bazaar of Saatli town and sells food. The business is very successful and needs some investment to increase the daily sales, but Elghun has no collateral to apply to the commercial banks.

That's why he applied to Normicro Saatli branch for a $700 loan. This credit could let him buy and sell more goods and better provide the necessities of life for his parents.

loans.use: To increase variety of goods

loans.name: Farida

texts.en: Farida Kurbanova is an active client of Microinvest in the Istaravshan region, Khujand, Tajikistan. She has been in business since 2005. During these two years she has became one of the good sellers at the market and she has learned a lot about what her customers want. She often changes out her inventory and tries to have only stylish goods. Currently she is requesting a loan to use as extra capital to buy new stylish clothes for the winter season.She hopes to get a good profit from holiday trade.

loans.use: to expand her inventory to be ready for the winter season

loans.name: Mery Antonieta

texts.es:
Señora Mery is a member of the Doradinas in Action Community Bank, located in the San Jose de Sisa district, province of El Dorado, San Martin region. She is dedicated to sell casual, sport, and elegant clothes for women, gentlemen, boys, and girls. Her shop is located on the main street in the San Jose de Sisa district at the Jr. Commerce Square (in front of the Central Market). She has been doing this business for 10 years, but before she used to do it door to door and also selling to friends and acquaintances.

With the 2,000.00 soles (Peruvian currency), which she will pay back in 4 months, Mery will buy more clothes, especially for girls and boys, approximately four dozen elegant dresses of different sizes to take advantage of the seasonal holiday parties, and elegant clothing pieces for women and men ( two dozen of different sizes and brands) so she can meet the demands of her loyal clientele.

Mery is 42 years old, married and only has two children, a boy and a girl. She feels very happy because she has always count with her husband's and her family's support, which in terms has allowed her to have a shop for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Mery es socia del banco comunal Doradinas en Acción del distrito de San José de Sisa, provincia de El Dorado, región San Martín, se dedica a la venta de ropas de vestir casual, sport y elegante para damas, caballeros, niños y niñas. El negocio se encuentra ubicado en la calle principal de la localidad de San José de Sisa en el Jr. Comercio Cdra. 4 (frente al Mercado Central), se dedica a este negocio desde hace 10 años, pero antes lo realizaba en forma ambulatoria y vendiendo a los amigos y conocidos. Con el préstamo de S/. 2,000.00, el cual pagará en 4 meses, comprará más prendas de vestir, principalmente para niñas y niños como cuatro docenas de vestidos elegantes de diferentes tallas para aprovechar la venta en las fiestas promocionales, prendas de vestir elegantes para damas y caballeros (dos docenas de diferentes marcas y tallas) para poder satisfacer a su asidua clientela. Mery tiene 42 años, es casada y tiene sólo dos hijos, un varón y una mujercita. Se siente muy feliz porque siempre ha contado con el apoyo de su esposo y familia, lo que le ha permitido poder adquirir un local.

loans.use: Buying clothes for selling.

location.town: San José de Sisa - San Martin

loans.name: Rosa's Group

texts.en:
In the city of Carapeguá, in the San Blas neighborhood, a group of women have come together to begin a committee of women entrepreneurs who meet weekly to discuss their businesses and to make payments to their loans. When women come together to form micro credit groups, there is much success. They understand that success comes in numbers and their numbers are large. Sixteen women have come together from various neighborhoods in Carapeguá, and after receiving information about working at fairs and other community activities, they have realized the possibilities how their work can grow.

The women are dependent on the loans to help their businesses grow. With the loans they will purchase goods to make crafts such as linens, thread and embroidery, and also help stock their convenience stores. Together these women have seen much success and will continue to increase the size of their businesses and clientele.

loans.use: The majority of the women involved in the committee have invested their loans to buy goods for their businesses: linens, thread for sewing and embroidery.  Others buy clothes to sell as traveling saleswomen

loans.name: Justina

texts.en:
Justina is a single mother of three children. She and her mother sold a piece of land and bought another piece of property in Ciudad del Este, where they started their own clothing business. With the profits from the business Justina has since paid her mother back.

Justina has been in business now for 7 years. It is successful and brings in enough money for Justina to support her children. However, she would like to expand her business by purchasing more jeans to sell to both to men and women, and clothing for school-age children. By increasing the variety of clothing for sale, she will be able to increase her earnings.

loans.use: To buy jeans for resale in her clothing business

loans.name: Rosa Elena

texts.es:
Rosa is a 39 year old woman with a great talent for her work. She lives in the Laurels North area together with her husband and her 3 minor children. The spouses work together in her business; they sell food and beverages through the streets. This ingenious couple invented a bicycle food cart from which to sell their products. In the lower part of the cart they installed two cooking pots full of fired charcoal. They place the hot food above these portable heat sources, to keep it warm. They have two of these bicycles. Both Rosa and her husband go out on the bicycles to sell food and beverages in the streets and at construction worksites, where they have developed a good clientele.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Doña Rosa es una mujer de 39 años de edad con un gran ingenio en el trabajo, habita en los Laureles Norte junto a su esposo y sus 3 hijos menores de edad, ambos esposos trabajan juntos en el negocio de venta de comida y refrescos ambulante. Esta ingeniosa pareja en una bicicleta elaboro un anexo en la parte de enfrente en donde en la parte de abajo le adaptaron dos ollas con carbón encendido a fin de mantener caliente la comida y sobre ellos están las porras de comida caliente, tienen dos bicicletas y cada uno de ellos sale a las calles para vender comida y refrescos en las calles y puestos de trabajo de construcción donde consiguen buenos clientes.

loans.use: Invest in the raw materials she uses to prepare her food products

loans.name: Subi

texts.en:
Mambo (Hello!) from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 38-year-old Subi M.. She is married and has four children between the ages of 2 and 16.

In 2002, Subi established her mawese (local oil) business. Subi requires a loan in order to purchase the oil from farmers who extract it from the nut of a local tree. She then sells the oild in the market and to soap companies. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a leading role as a pioneer of microcredit in Tanzania through micro-leasing. Because customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, the women lack tangible collateral assets, and financial institutions do not consider them to be credit-worthy. This leads to poor financial support and, as a result, limited access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. When a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys the equipment from the client, extends a loan to her, and then leases back the same equipment – a process called a "sale and leaseback" arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase mawese (local oil) in bulk for resale

loans.name: Ernestina

texts.es:
Ernestina G. is a teacher in the urban zone of Acoyapa. She is 53 years old, and is married with two children who are professionals. She has worked in education for 27 years. She has used her previous loans to improve her house, and she will now make her dream of having a dignified dwelling a reality and get some rest once she retires.
