With the aim of attaining a more comfortable standard of living, Pech wishes to borrow some funds through Kiva in order to purchase a motorbike for transporting her items.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for transporting her items.

loans.name: Lamula

texts.en: Lamula  lives in Uganda. She is single, and has three children all of whom are in school.  Lamula has a business of selling second-hand clothes. She has been in this business for three years, and she works seven days out of every week. Lamula sells her products at the market by means of retail. Lamula has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bales of second-hand clothes. The main business challenge(s) for Lamula include transportation and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start importing clothes, and also to become a wholesale business. Lamula lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bales of second-hand clothes.

loans.name: Álvaro José

texts.es:
En municipio de Managua, el señor Álvaro José  se ha   se desempeña como Guieiza  y se dedica a esta labor desde hace cuatro años. Es acompañado y con tres personas a su cargo.

Actualmente ha acudido a ceprodel con el fin de solicitar un crédito para mejorar la condición de su vivienda en la compra de materiales de construcción, para comprar cinz, perlines y pagar mano de obra, para reparar techo que se encuentra en mal estado por medio de esta obra brindarle mejor condición de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
In the city of Managua, Álvaro José works as a guide.  He has been in this job for four years.  He lives with his partner and has three people in his care.

Álvaro José has come to Ceprodel to request a loan to improve the condition of his home.  He will buy building supplies such as corrugated metal sheets and metal beams, and pay labor costs, to repair his roof which is in a bad state of repair.  Through this building work, he will provide his family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy building supplies

loans.name: Samvel

texts.ru:
Самвелу 50 лет; он проживает в городе Ванадзоре. Жена Самвела работает учительницей в средней школе, старший сын учиться в Ереванском Государственном Медицинском Университете, а младший учится в школе.  
Более 10 лет Самвел плотницким делом. Он переделал одну из комнат своего дома в мастерскую, где он мастерит изделия из дерева. Самвел принимает заказы на изготовление мебели, а сделанные из дерева сувениры и нарды он продает в арендованном помещении в городском универмаге. Там же он продает настольные часы и картины, привезенные из Еревана. 
Изделия Самвела отличаются высоким качеством, вкусом и мастерством. Он вырезает на мебели и на нардах очень сложные орнаменты, благодаря чему у него всегда есть новые заказы. Бизнес позволяет Самвелу содержать семью и платить за обучение старшего сына. Для увеличения доходов своей семьи, Самвел хочет начать торговлю керамической посудой, вазами, статуэтками и т.д. Для этого ему необходим кредит на сумму 1,000,000 драм.
texts.en: Samvel is 50 years old.  He lives in the town of Vanadzor.  Samvel's wife works as a teacher at a secondary school, oldest son attends the Yerevan State Medical University, and the youngest son attends school.  Samvel has been involved in carpentry for over 10 years.  He re-purposed one of the rooms in his house into a workshop, where he makes products from wood.  Samvel accepts orders for making furniture and sells wooden souvenirs in a leased space at the city department store.  He also sells table clocks and paintings from Yerevan there.  Samvel's products stand out due to its high quality, taste and mastery.  He cuts very difficult ornaments on the furniture and backgammon, which is why he always has new orders.  This business allows Samvel to support his family and pay for his oldest son's education.  In order to increase his family's income, Samvel wants to start selling ceramic dishwares, vases, statuettes, etc.  He needs a loan in the sum of 1,000,000 dram for this purpose.

loans.use: to start selling ceramic dishwares, vases, statuettes, etc.

loans.name: Nyamsuren

texts.en: Nyamsuren is 49 years old and lives with his wife and children in a house in the Songinohairhan district of Ulaanbaatar City, Mongolia. His two daughters are college students and his other two children are high school students. He started his business in 1995 by driving a taxi in his local town. His business is doing well and his daily income is between 20,000 MNT to 30,000 MNT. He is a diligent and hardworking man who says, "I want to give a very good education to my children and let them study at the university. This is my main goal in life." He is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to pay the tuition fees for his daughters.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees for his daughters.

loans.name: Pov

texts.en:
Pov, 51 years old, is a cake seller who earns $5 per day. Her husband, a policeman, earns $3.20 per day. They have four children, three of whom are working, and one too young for school. Every month, Pov has to spend $150 on food, $5 on electricity, $20 on rent, and $45 on other expenses.
 
She would like to request a loan of $1,000 to buy a motorbike to help her children travel to work. She will extend her career when her profits increase.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike to help her children travel to work.

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es:
El  señor Carlos Alberto es una persona casada y tiene dos hijos  pero su esposa se encuentra  en otro pais desde hace tres años  y por lo difícil que es conseguir un trabajo; a logrado conseguir uno pero este no le alcanza para poder ayudar a su familia aquí en Bolivia, el señor trabaja en una empresa  como chofer de camión de repartición  y el sueldo que el gana es para solo la sustentación de sus hijos y de el.
 
EL Señor Carlos Alberto vive en la zona del plan 3000 a unos 30 minutos de la zona central es por este motivo que el necesita el préstamo para reparar su auto que el utiliza para poder moverse hasta su trabajo ya que el mismo queda al otro lado de la ciudad la empresa en la que trabaja  y así se pueda mejorar su calidad de vida, y llevar también a sus hijos al colegio recogerlos y evitar que les pueda suceder algo peligroso.
texts.en:
Carlos Alberto is married and has two children but his wife has been in another country for the last three years because of the difficulty in finding employment.  She’s managed to find one but it does not produce enough to help her family here in Bolivia.  Carlos works as a delivery truck driver for a firm and the salary he earns is barely enough for his and his children’s sustenance.

Carlos Alberto lives in the Plan 3000 zone about 30 minutes from the central zone and this is why he needs a loan to repair his car that he uses to get to work which is located on the other side of the city in the firm he works for.  This will improve his quality of life and he’ll also be able to take his children to school and pick them up keeping them safe from anything dangerous that could happen to them.

loans.use: to repair his vehicle.

loans.name: Alaa'

texts.en:
Alaa' is a 27-year-old young man.  He is a Palestinian National Authority employee with a decent salary. He also works as a painter to improve and increase his income. 

Alaa' will marry soon, so he is preparing for his wedding.  He wants to complete paying some of his wedding expenses such as: purchasing furniture, clothes, etc. but the amount of money he has isn't enough, so he needs to take a loan of $1,000 from FATEN. When Alaa' gets the loan, that will enable him to complete paying some of his wedding expenses.  He will feel comfortable and prepare well for this occasion. 

Alaa' is photographed in the picture.

loans.use: pay some of his wedding expenses

loans.name: Elizabeth Rita

texts.es: La señora Elizabeth es cliente antigua de la institución ella vive en la zona de Villa Pabón en anticrético tiene un hijito el cual esta en edad escolar antes la Sra. Elizabeth se dedicaba a la venta de carteras, con lo cual no le fue bien en la actualidad se dedica a la venta de sándwich en la puerta de un  campo deportivo  de lunes  a domingo, ella esta solicitando el préstamo para la compra de insumos para la elaboración de sus sándwich y fruta, azúcar  para la elaboración de los jugos, la Sra. tiene mucha clientela ya que les atiende con amabilidad, también le va muy bien con la venta de jugos, el deseo de la Sra. es el ver un día a su hijo profesional y una persona de bien, La Sra. Elizabeth es una persona muy trabajadora se siente agradecida por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is an old client of our institution who lives in the Villa Pabon zone with an 'anticretico' (a pre-paid rental contract common in Bolivia). She has a young son of school age. In the past, Elizabeth sold wallets but that didn't go well. At present, she sells sandwiches at the entrance to a sports field, Monday through Sunday.

Elizabeth is requesting a loan to buy supplies for making sandwiches, plus fruit and sugar for preparing juices. She has many customers since she attends them amiably. Selling juices is also going very well.

Elizabeth's desire is one day to see her son become a professional and a good person. She is a very hard working woman and very grateful for this offer of help.

loans.use: to buy supplies for preparing sandwiches and juices to sell.

loans.name: Jeffer Omar

texts.es:
Jeffer sigue aumentando sus ventas, gracias a la captacion de clientes que ha logrado en estos años, al introducir mas productos de variedad, el cual ha venido rotando gracias a los financiamiento.
Compro una vitrina en donde lucir mas su mercaderia, vende al contado y al credito, dando mas oportunidad a sus clientes para pagar,venta que hace ambulantes y en su casa, con este nuevo prestamo comprara: ropa, zapatos, perfume , para ambos sexo. Con estas ventas ha aumentado sus ingresos, lo que le ayudado para solventar mejor la alimentacion de su familia, mejor equilibrio en sus gastos.
texts.en:
Jeffer continues increasing his sales, thanks to the recruitment of customers he has achieved in recent years by introducing more product variety, which he has rotated thanks to the loans.

He bought a display case to show off his merchandise.  He sells in cash and on credit, giving his customers more opportunities to pay.  He makes sales as a street vendor and in his home.

With this new loan he will buy clothing, shoes, and perfume for men and women.

With these sales he has increased his earnings, which has helped him better pay for feeding his family and have a better equilibrium in his expenses.

loans.use: to buy clothing, shoes, and perfume to increase his sales.

loans.name: Hayat

texts.en: Hayat is a 44-year-old Lebanese married woman. She lives with her husband and has two working children. All of the family cooperates together especially because of the heavy costs of life.  Hayat had fifteen years of experience in selling detergents until she decided to open her own business in 2006. She sells all kinds of detergents from her home. Her husband has been working as a taxi driver for the past twenty three years. Today, she’s looking to borrow $ 2300 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to increase her inventory of cleaners and sanitary products in order to earn superior income. In the future she plans to open her own shop.

loans.use: to increase her inventory of cleaners and sanitary products.

loans.name: Ana Pearly

texts.en:
Ana Pearly is 36 years old and is a married woman with two children, age 12 and 14. She lives in the town of Talibon, Bohol with her family.

Ana Pearly manages a coconut farm. She also runs a small sari-sari (variety) store business and resells seaweeds. Ana Pearly is a hard-working mother. She said she only wants the best for her family.

Ana Pearly has requested this loan to purchase fertilizers, seaweeds and more items to sell. Ana Pearly hopes for her ventures to prosper.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, seaweeds and more items to sell.

loans.name: Hong

texts.en:
Hong, 40, is married and resides with his wife and two school-age children in Kampong Chnnang Province, Cambodia. He is a construction foreman. His wife is a dessert vendor. 

Due to a lack of enough construction materials, Hong is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase more to use in his work. This will enable him to run his construction work smoothly and increase his income. In the future, he would like to build a new house and support his children to go further in their education.

loans.use: to purchase more construction materials to use in his construction work

loans.name: Tuisfolau

texts.en:
Tusifolau is sixty years old. She is married and has 7 children.

Tusifolau owns & operates a business venture, which involves planting and harvesting taro for sale. She has 3 years of experience in this business. Tusifolau needs a loan of WST 1,000 (Talas) to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 450 Talas or US $188 per week) to improve/expand the business.

Tusifolau joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Tusifolau's 2nd loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome

loans.name: Asrar

texts.en:
Asrar is 22 years old single woman, she lives in Al Karak, Jordan.
Asrar is looking to have a loan of 400JDs thus she can sale clothes to increase her income.
Asrar is under 30 years old so her loan is youth.
Asrar is a conservative woman she is unwilling to upload her photo on internet the photo is for her brother.

loans.use: to buy and sell clothes

loans.name: Wonder

texts.en: After graduating Junior high school and learning how to weld metals and its accessories, Wonder decided to set up his own welding business center just at the road side Ve GoloKwati (near Hohoe) a very vital positioning. With over 5 years worth of experience, he is currently looking to expand his enterprise further. Unfortunately, he is limited due to a lack of funding. As a result, this loan will be used to help him by purchase more different sizes of metals and also pay for his electricity bills. He aims at using the profits from his business to help support his wife (who is a seamstress) with the upkeep of their house whilst ensuring that their only 1 child and all his unborn children will be able to experience a better life and also save enough to acquire an additional welding machine and get an assistant to assist.

loans.use: this loan will be used to help him by purchase more different sizes of metals and also pay for his electricity bills

loans.name: Seyigbe Group

texts.fr: Le groupe SEYIGBE est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans un même quartier. C'est la deuxième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Esther est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Esther est âgée de 53 ans et est mariée à un certain Alphonse. Esther a peu fréquenté l’école. Esther est mère de deux enfants, tous scolarisés et à la charge du couple. Pour contribuer aux différents besoins de sa famille, Esther vend depuis trois ans des conserves et des boissons à son domicile. Esther s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Esther sollicite un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe SEYIGBE.

loans.use: Acheter des conserves et des boissons.

loans.name: Sevil

texts.en:
Sevil is married with two children.  Her husband is a construction worker.  She makes necklaces, earrings, bracelets to contribute to her family budget.  She intends to buy the materials for the necklaces, bracelets and earrings wholesale with the microloan.  She plans to sell them and expand her business. 

Translated from Turkish by Maya staff

Sevil hanım evli iki çocuk annesi.  Eşi işçi olarak çalışıyor.  Aile ekonomisine katkı sağlamak için evde takı yaparak satıyor.  İşini geliştirmeyi ve stantlara çıkmayı planlıyor.  Aldığı mikro kredi ile toptan takı malzemesi boncuk ve aparatlar alarak takılar yapmayı hedefliyor.  Yaptığı takıları stantta satarak para kazanmak ve işlerini geliştirmeyi planlıyor.

loans.use: to buy the materials for the necklaces, bracelets and earrings

loans.name: Angel

texts.en: Angel Conforme is 52 years old and has 3 children. He’s owned this store for about four years and counts on the help of his wife who also works part time for a bakery and of his kids when they are not in school. He sells all kinds food items but concentrates on selling candies, snacks and other foods for people on the go. He is in need of capital so that he may improve his current product offerings and sell at lower prices. It is very difficult for him to maintain his inventory without the power to buy in bulk.

loans.use: Improve Inventory

loans.name: Essi

texts.en:
Born in 1979, Miss Essi K. transforms hairstyles with a golden touch. She lives with her parents, both non-working. Her father is currently paralyzed and she pays the medical costs, thanks to the income from her job. She is unmarried with two (02) children. Hairstyling is a job she has been conducting for 7 years with pride. She owns a hair salon with many apprentices and hopes to enlarge it and to equip it better to increase yield. These days, her work is highly sought after, and to satisfy this increasingly growing demand, she is asking for a loan of $800 to buy modern dryers and other accessories; this will allow her to continue providing quality training for her apprentices and to take good care of her family.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer.

Née en 1979, Mlle K. Essi a des mains d’or pour transformer les coupes de cheveux. Elle vit avec ses parents tous deux inactifs. Son père est actuellement paralysé et c’est elle qui supporte ses frais médicaux grâce aux revenus de son travail. Elle est célibataire avec deux (02) enfants. La coiffure est un métier qu’elle exerce depuis 7 ans avec fierté. Elle possède un salon de coiffure avec de nombreux apprentis et souhaite l’agrandir et mieux l’équiper pour un meilleur rendement. Aujourd’hui, ses prestations sont très demandées et pour satisfaire cette demande toujours grandissante, elle sollicite un appui financier de $800 pour l’achat des séchoirs modernes et tous les autres accessoires ;ce qui lui permettra de toujours donner une formation de qualité à ses apprentis et bien prendre soin de sa famille .

loans.use: To buy modern dryers and other accessories

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en: Juliana has been a client of Kraban Support Foundation for years now. She has had several training sessions on simple record keeping and loan management from the organization. She makes beadwork for the local and foreign market. She is seeking a loan of $900.00 from Kiva to help her expand her production.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Maria Guadalupe

texts.es:
Maria Guadalupe is married and has two small children, ages 7 and 12, who are currently in elementary school. Her husband works at a glass factory. Because her husband's salary was insufficient to be able to cover all the family expenses, Maria Guadalupe decided to start her own business a year ago to help pay the bills. After think about what she could offer, she decided to sell shoes by catalogue, since she couldn't neglect her kids or her home. Initially she offered her products to family members, neighbors and friends, and little by little she began building a clientele, who would recommend her services to their friends.

Maria Guadalupe is requesting a loan of $250 to be able to add supplies, tend to her customers better and show off the products she sells in real life and not via catalogue, because she says people are more likely to buy if they physically see things. She plans to repay the loan within three months and is very grateful for your support in helping her move ahead with her business and improve her quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

María Guadalupe esta casada y tiene dos hijos pequeños de 7 y 12 años respectivamente, ellos están en la escuela primaria actualmente, su esposo trabaja como obrero en una fábrica de vidrio. Debido a que el sueldo de su esposo era insuficiente para poder cubrir los gastos familiares María Guadalupe decidió iniciar su propio negocio y ayudar en la economía familiar. Inicio su negocio hace aproximadamente un año atrás, pensando en que podía ofrecer y se decidió por la venta de zapatos por catálogo, así no descuidaba el hogar ni a sus hijos, inicialmente empezó ofreciendo sus productos a sus familiares, vecinos y amigos y poco a poco fue teniendo una clientela, la cual también la recomendaba con sus amistades.

María Guadalupe esta solicitando un préstamo por la cantidad de US $ 250 para poder surtirse de mercadería y así atender bien a sus clientes y también poder mostrar los productos que vende en vivo y no solo por el catálogo, por que dice que la gente se anima más a comprar viendo las cosas físicamente. Ella ofrece pagar el préstamo en 3 meses y esta muy agradecida por el apoyo que le brindes para poder salir adelante en su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.

loans.use: Purchase shoes and supplies

loans.name: Celestine

texts.en:
This is a group loan to be shared by the nine women of the Takusan de Ahidjidjio association, led by Ms. Celestine D.. In their loan application, the group described their business as follows:

“Context: The project is located in Oussouye in the south of Senegal. It comprises women who work together to improve their living conditions and those of their families. Oussouye is known for its tourism, which is why local commerce to provide the hotels with foodstuffs is the principal business activity.

Purpose: The objectives of the group include increasing the income of its members, alleviating the burden of the housewife, and improving the living conditions of its members.

Business activities: In order to carry out its business properly, the group is requesting a loan to allow it to purchase merchandise in the markets of nearby towns such as Ziguinchor, Bignona and Kolda, in order to satisfy the local demand for these goods.”

Background

Senegal is one of the world’s poorest countries, yet its solid democratic tradition and highly developed associational life distinguish it from other countries in its income group. Especially remarkable are Senegal’s networks of rotating savings and credit associations, known as tontines. Commonly organized by groups of twenty to thirty housewives who live in the same village, the tontines provide poor women throughout the country with small loans to finance modest income-generating activities. Repayment rates within these associations are excellent, because they are based on local reputation and personal trust between the members. However, their financial resources are limited to the contributions of their members, frequently subsistence farmers with very little disposable income. This has prevented the traditional tontines from meeting the demand for rural microenterprise loans and restricted their impact on the economic development of their communities. The SEM Fund works to bridge this gap by linking traditional village credit associations with outside sources of finance.

Business description translated from French by Senegal Ecovillage Microfinance Fund.

«Contexte : Le projet se situ à Oussouye au sud du Sénégal ; il regroupe les femmes en en association de développement qui travail dans le but d’amélioré leurs conditions de vie et celle de leurs familles. Oussouye est réputé de tourisme et c’est pourquoi, le commerce est l’activité principale permettant aux structures hôtelières de s’approvisionner sur place.

Objectifs : Le groupement s’est fixé entre autres objectifs : - D’augmenté le revenu de ses membres - D’alléger le panier de la ménagère - D’améliorer les conditions de vie de ses membres

Activités : Pour mener a bien ces activités, le groupement sollicite un prêt de 500 000f qui lui permettra de pouvoir acheter de la marchandise dans les marchés les plus proche tel que Ziguinchor, Bignona, et Kolda ; afin de satisfaire la demande au niveau local.»

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise for resale, transportation and storage expenses

loans.name: Joice Anastacio

texts.pt:
Joice is divorced. Her husband left her for a younger woman. Joice has children, but they live with their father and stepmother. She began the loan program at the end of 2006 to be able to support her children with some of their needs, despite not living with them. Her children study. With the profits of her business, she hopes to build a better home. She doesn't intend to marry; she prefers to live alone and dedicate herself more fully to her children. She tends chickens and her business will likely grow, since after her separation she now lives in an area with great demand for chicken.

Translated by Bianca Vargas, Kiva Volunteer.

Joice e divorciad.O marido lhe deixou porque arranjou outra mais nova que Joice. Ela tem filhos, mas estes vivem com o Pai e com a madrasta. Ela entrou para o Programa em finais de 2006 para poder apoiar os filhos em algumas despesas mesmo que seja a distancia. Os filhos de Joice estudam. Com os rendimentos do negocio ela pretende construir uma casa melhorada. Ela nao pretende casar, prefere viver sozinha para poder assistir melhor os seus filhos.Ela cria frangos e o negocio esta a correr-lhe bem pois que na zona para onde foi viver depoois de se separar ha muita procura de frango.

loans.use: To buy feed and vaccines for poultry.

loans.name: Cristina Mapoissa

texts.pt:
A single mother or six children, Cristina B. operates a small grocery store from home, where she sells rice, sugar, sardines and other staples. She joined the program in November of 2006 and is now on her third loan cycle. Cristina plans to use the requested amount of $250 to increase her store's stock.

Translated from Portuguese by Aline Pereira, Kiva Volunteer.

Cristina B. é solteira e mãe de 4 filhos. Vive no bairro Malanga e tem o seu negócio na sua residência. Vende diversos produtos de mercearia como arroz, açúcar, sardinhas, pasta dentífrica, cremes para pele, etc. Entrou para o programa em Novembro de 2006 e começou com um empréstimo de 3.000MT. Está no terceiro ciclo e vai tomar 6.000MT para pagar em 6 meses com vista a compra de mais produtos para a sua pequena loja.

loans.use: stock increase

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Continue diversifying her product offerings

loans.name: Amavi

texts.fr:
Mrs. Amavi E. was born on April 20, 1980 in Kouvé in the prefecture of Yoto and is now living in Tsévié with her two children and two servants. Her husband is working in Lomé and, with only a meager salary, he has difficulty supporting his family, so she is responsible for providing for their needs. Dynamic and entrepreneurial, she supports her family using income from her various sales. She has invested previous loans wisely and has repaid them in a timely manner.

She is currently requesting a loan of US$ 400 which she will use to buy some sacks of rice and tins of oil, etc. to expand her little business. This will allow her to do more to improve the financial situation of her family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Madame E. Amavi est née le 20 avril 1980 à Kouvé dans la préfecture de Yoto actuellement, elle vit à Tsévié avec ses deux (02) enfants et deux (2) domestiques. Son mari employé à Lomé et avec un maigre salaire il arrive difficilement à couvrir les charges de la famille, ce qui fait que toutes les charges du foyer sont assurées par elle. Dynamique et entreprenante, elle subvient aux besoins de sa famille grâce aux revenus que la procure ses diverses ventes. Elle a su bien gérer les précédents crédits obtenus et les a remboursé convenablement. A présent, elle sollicite un crédit de $400 qui servira à l’achat des sacs de riz et des bidons d’huile et autres pour renforcer son petit commerce. Ainsi pourra-t-elle participer davantage à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use:
purchasing sacks of rice and tins of oil

Achat de sacs de riz et bidons d'huile

loans.name: Pío Agustín

texts.es:
Pío G. is dedicated to selling groceries in his convenience store like oil, soap, detergents, brushes, shampoos, ect. in the El Sauce district of León. He has a humble family that looks to him for education, food and protection. His business started six years ago with $100 in start-up money he obtained with the help of his children.

Pío's biggest need is purchasing supplies for his convenience store and for this reason he has turned to Kiva partner Ceprodel for support (he has been a recipient of three loans so far) in investing in his business, which has allowed him to provide for his household.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

El caballero Pio Gamez se dedica a vender productos de abarrotaría como aceite, jabón, pastes, detergentes, escobas, shampoo, etc.) en la ciudad de León en el municipio El Sauce de esta localidad. Posee una humilde familia que tiene el deber de educar y brindar protección y alimentación. Su negocio da inicio desde hace 6 años con una inversión de $100 (Cien dólares netos) que los obtuvo por medio del apoyo de sus hijos para que iniciara el negocio.

Una necesidad que atraviesa el señor Pio es que necesita invertir en la compra de los abarrotes y por esta razón es que acude a Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con créditos (Actualmente 3 créditos a su favor) que los invierte directamente en su negocio y de esta manera llevar el sustento a su hogar que tanto lo necesita.

loans.use: Purchase supplies to sell in store

loans.name: Tran Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs Trần Thị Khánh, 32, joined TYM fund in 2003. At first, she applied for a small loan because she was not sure if she would be able pay. But it turned out that she was successful so in later rounds, she applied for max loan. Her loans were used to raise poultry or buying bamboo to weave baskets. Now she notices that there is not much rice husking establishment in the area, she applies for a loan to start up a rice husking business. She needs the money to buy the machinery. She hopes that it would help increase her income, currently at 130 USD a month. She lives in Quảng Xương, Thanh Hóa with her husband and their 2 young children.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Trần Thị Khánh, 32 tuổi, tham gia Quỹ năm 2003. Những vòng vốn đầu chị Khánh chỉ dám vay mức vốn thấp vì sợ không trả được. Sau khi sử dụng vốn vay, kinh tế gia đình phát triển tốt hơn, các vòng vốn tiếp theo chị đều vay mức vốn tối đa. Số tiền vay từ Quỹ thường được chị sử dụng vào chăn nuôi hoặc mua tre đan thúng. Hiện nay, nhận thấy dịch vụ xay xát lúa gạo trên địa bàn còn chưa nhiều, chị Khánh làm đơn xin vay 575USD mua máy xay xát kinh doanh hoạt động này. Chị hy vọng sẽ nâng được mức thu nhập 130USD/tháng hiện tại lên trong năm nay. Chị Khánh đang sống với chồng và 2 con nhỏ tại Quảng Xương, Thanh Hóa.

loans.use: Buy machine to husk rice

loans.name: Twitike

texts.en:
Mambo (hello!) from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 30-year-old Twitike M.. She is married and has two children, ages 2 and 5.

In 2002, Twitike established her crop and textiles retail business. Twitike has already received and successfully repaid one loan from SELFINA, and now requires a new loan in order to purchase additional stocks of rice and traditional cloth. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a leading role as a pioneer of microcredit in Tanzania through micro-leasing. Because customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, the women lack tangible collateral assets, and financial institutions do not consider them to be credit-worthy. This leads to poor financial support and, as a result, limited access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. When a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys the equipment from the client, extends a loan to her, and then leases back the same equipment – a process called a "sale and leaseback" arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of rice, and traditional cloth for resale.

loans.name: Chhoeun

texts.en: Chhoeun A. earns $3 a day through her grocery store, which she has operated since 2000. Her husband, Oun Teav, is involved in several different trades, which is common with poor, rural Khmers who must find multiple sources of income in order to make ends meet. He raises pigs and also makes traditional rice wine. These two businesses actually go quite well together as the leftover rice mash from the rice wine can be used as feed for the pigs. He also earns about $3 per day. The couple has three children as well. They hope to use their loan to expand both of their businesses. They will purchase more grocery products for her store as well as better pig feed for his pigs. They hope to focus on pig raising in the future as this has proved to be profitable.

loans.use: To buy pig food and grocery store products.

loans.name: Eliseo Ramón

texts.es:
Eliseo P. is 40 years old and lives in the Memorial Sandio neighborhood. He's married and his wife works as a street vendor selling clothes and shoes. Together he and his wife have 3 boys. His youngest son is 12 years old and is in grade school, while his other two sons are 16 and 14 and are in high school.

Eliseo has a delivery business and he has a van that he uses for this job. Also in his free time, he works as a mechanic. He began his delivery business 15 years ago and prior to that, he worked as a mechanic.

He has plans to acquire a new vehicle for his deliveries, although his current priority is to take care of the well-being of his family. He will use the loan to build a porch for his home to provide better security to his family.

Translated from Spanish by Kim Baker, Kiva volunteer,

Don Eliseo P. tiene 40 años de edad, habita en el barrio Memorial Sandino. Es casado, su esposa es comerciante y se dedica a la venta ambulante de ropa y zapatos. Juntos procrearon 3 hijos varones, su hijo menor de 12 años está estudiando la educación primaria y sus otros dos hijos de 16 y 14 años estudian la educación secundaria. El negocio de don Eliseo es Acarreo, posee una camioneta con la que realiza este trabajo, también en los tiempos que tiene libre se dedica a la mcánica.Empezó este negocio del acarreo desde hace 15 años, anteriormente se dedicaba solo a mecánica. Entre sus planes está la adquisición de un nuevo vehículo para sus acarreos, aunque su prioridad en estosmomentos es velar por el bienestar de su familia, por lo que usará el préstamo para construir el porche de su casa de habitación, para darle mayor seguridad a su familia.

loans.use: To purchase materials to build a porch

loans.name: Patrick B.'s Group

texts.en: Patrick B. J. assumes leadership of this group. He was born in Freetown 30 years ago. He is married with 2 children. J.'s wife has been selling food items here in Makeni for the past two years now. J. will like to get a loan to give to his wife to add onto her current business. Other members of the group are: George Bating G., who wants the loan to invest in a business of some sort; George Brima K., who will use his own loan to renovate his house; and Sheka T., who wants to use his loan to continue his education. They are requesting a loan of 3,600,000.00 SLL.

loans.use: Invest in wife's business

loans.name: Zafarjon

texts.ru: Одинаев Зафарджон проживает вместе со своей семьей в Яване. Работает частным предпринимателем . Занимается купле продажей крупно рогатого скота. Кроме того хочет купить еще одну корову и занять свою жену продажей молока. Это поможет получать дополнительные доходы для семьи.Погасить кредит планирует в течение 8 месяцев.
texts.en:
Zafarjon O. lives with his family in Yavan. He has a small business in which he trades in livestock. He would like to purchase an additional cow so that his wife can sell its milk. This will help them bring in additional income to support their family. He plans to repay the loan within eight months.

Translated from Russian by Josh Machleder, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a cow

loans.name: Umed

texts.en: U. Umed is 31 years old. He is married and he has 2 children. He has a successful business selling flour at the local market of Isfara town. Umed sells an assortment of good-quality flour. Because he buys the flour at wholesale, the price is cheaper than the price of his competitors. Thus, he has many customers who even purchase flour straight from his house. Today there is a great demand for his goods and that is why he wants to request a loan of $750 to add to his working capital and allow him to purchase more inventory. He promises to repay the loan within 6 months. He is ready to work even harder and make sacrifices to achieve his goal and become a successful entrepreneur. We believe his perseverance and clear vision will become key success factors in his small business.

loans.use: To buy flour for resale

loans.name: Fanta

texts.fr: Fanta Cissé, 42 ans, mariée, 02 enfants en charge est membre du banc villageois de Alwar CMT depuis 6 ans. Elle veut un prêt pour acheter de l’huile de palme et aller le revendre à Dakar ou elle dispose d’une clientèle très fidèle. Ses revenus lui permettent d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille. <b> Le prêt qu’elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance. <b/>
texts.en:
Fanta Cissé, 42, married with 2 children, has been a member of the village bank of Alwar CMT for 6 years. She wants a loan to buy palm oil to bring to Dakar for re-sale since she has a faithful clientele there. Her earnings allow her to improve living conditions for her family. The loan that she is requesting will be reimbursed at the end of 6 months in one single repayment.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: sale of palm oil

loans.name: Aubine

texts.fr: Agée de 30 ans, Madame K. Aubine est une veuve ayant 3 enfants à charge. Depuis plus de 5 ans, elle s’est lancée dans la vente de condiments et légumes grâce à laquelle elle subvient aux besoins des enfants. Aujourd’hui, avec la multiplication des besoins du ménage, le phénomène de la vie chère et son faible pouvoir d’achat, elle ne parvient même plus à satisfaire aux besoins élémentaires de ses bouches à nourrir. Au même moment sa clientèle augmente mais son faible pouvoir d’achat ne lui permet pas de la satisfaire pour bien rentabiliser son activité. Pour toutes ces raisons, elle sollicite un crédit pour renforcer son commerce et répondre aux besoins de son ménage.
texts.en:
Mrs. Aubine K., 30, is a widow raising 3 children. For more than 5 years, she has been selling condiments and vegetables, from which business she supports her family. Today, as the needs of her household are growing, with living costs high and her buying power reduced, she can no longer manage to make ends meet so as to cover the most basic expenses of her brood. At the same time, her clientele is growing but her low buying power does not allow her to meet their needs and make her business really profitable. For all these reasons, she is requesting a loan to bolster her business so she can support her household adequately.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: sale of vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Lovely

texts.en: Lovely O. sells provisions, drinks and foodstuffs. She is 31 years old and married with 4 children. She buys her goods from the market in her community and the drinks from a distributor. She is happy with her business. She needs the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more provisions, drinks and foodstuffs to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks, provisions and foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Isaiah

texts.en: Isaiah A. M. is married and has 2 children. He has received no formal education. Isaiah sells and repairs electrical gadgets at Aboom in Cape coast, which he has been doing since 2003. Isaiah uses his income to pay his children's school fees, the family's utility bills, and other expenses. Isaiah will use the loan to expand his business by purchasing additional electrical items for resale. He plans to invest the extra profit in his children's education.

loans.use: Purchase of electrical items for resale

loans.name: Sabali Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Sabali (composé de 4femmes  mariées) ont une moyenne d’âge de 31 ans avec en moyenne 3 enfants. Elles résident dans le quartier  Babemba de la ville de sikasso.
Elles  exercent des activités commerciales différentes (vente de : condiments, chaussures, savons et friperie).
Elles collaborent avec  l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso  pour satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. Elles sont à leur troisième prêt solidaire (prêt de groupe).Les prêt précédents ont été correctement remboursés.
Elles comptent utiliser ce prêt pour acheter 2 balles de friperie, 3 sacs de100kg de savons traditionnels (gros morceaux), 2 douzaines de paires de chaussures et 4paquets de condiments. Elles s’approvisionnent sur place à Sikasso et environnants..
Les produits sont vendus en détail et  au comptant dans les marchés de la ville de Sikasso  et dans les quartiers à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes. 
Elles espèrent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen de 19 000 FCFA par mois qui sera utilisé pour subvenir aux besoins de la famille et investir le reste dans les activités.
texts.en:
The members of the group Sabali are composed of four married women who average 31 years of age and three children. They reside in the Babemba district of the city of Sikasso and do various commerce in: condiments, shoes, soaps, used clothing and such.

They are collaborating with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to satisfy the needs of their customers. They are on their third solidarity loan (group loan). The preceding ones have been correctly repaid. They plan to use this loan to buy two bales of used clothing, three 100-kg sacks of traditional soaps (big pieces), two dozen pairs of shoes, and four packets of condiments. Supplies are gotten locally in Sikasso and surrounding areas. The goods are sold retail for cash in the marketplace of Sikasso and in the districts to customers composed of women and men.

With this loan, the group members each hope to realize a monthly profit of 19,000 francs CFA that will be used to provide for the family and to invest the rest in their businesses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy various goods

loans.name: Sanobar

texts.en: Sanobar is an enterprising mother looking to make a better future for the well being of her 5 children, which motivates her to work day to day in the cultivation of crops such as: wheat, potatoes, onions, and watermelons. Sanobar tends to her business with great care and dedication. Her sister helps her with the business as well. They sell their products at the local market. Sanobar is one of the better sellers but what keeps her back is her limited product range. In order to sell more, she needs to grow more on her land. This is the reason why Sanobar is asking for a loan, and she expects that it will help her to increase her business and, above all, give her the purchasing power to meet the needs of her family.

loans.use: Purchasing of the seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Adiza

texts.en:
Adiza I. is a 40-year-old mother of three boys. Her first child is now a trained teacher, whiles the rest are still in school. She is very hard-working and resourceful. She lives with her husband and the children at Bekwai, a suburb of Obuasi in the Ashanti region of Ghana. Her husband works for a metal products company.

Adiza has traded charcoal and grocery products in her neighborhood for five years now. Charcoal is a very popular source of energy for cooking in almost all Ghanaian traditional homes. Adiza obtains her supply of charcoal from the surrounding villages. She purchases them from specific villages like Eduporsu and Awhiam in the Ashanti region where she lives, and she retails them to her customers.

She hopes to receive GH¢600 to make business progress by restocking her inventory. She wants to use the loan to buy a bulk supply of charcoal, sugar, evaporated milk, and other grocery products to increase her inventory. She hopes the loan will enable her to increase her savings to pay her children's educational fees. She would be grateful for your assistance.

Adiza belongs to a village bank called ‘Shei Allah’.

loans.use: To buy bulk supply of charcoal and grocery products.

loans.name: Josephine Achieng

texts.en: Josephine Achieng O. is a 30-year-old single mother of three children, ages 14, 9 and 5. To pay for their school fees, she sells Chapati (deep-fried flour or maize). She is asking for 10,000 KSH to help her buy more ingredients so she can cook more Chapati. She lives and works in the Nyamasari slum.

loans.use: To purchase more ingredients for chapati

loans.name: Cloud

texts.en:
Cloud M. is married and is a Tanzanian micro-businessman. He runs a double business at Yombo Vituka ward in Dar es Salaam. He runs a photo studio and a clothing shop.

He purchases his business items in the Kariakoo City business center from the photo studio shops and clothing wholesale shops. He sells to retail customers in Yombo Vituka.

He is requesting a loan of Tshs 1,400,000 to buy more business items to meet his customers’ needs.

loans.use: To purchase more items for his photo and clothing businesses

loans.name: Lucía Otilia

texts.es:
En el Mercado La Terminal de la ciudad de León la señora Lucrecia P. con gran entusiasmo se dedica a comercializar ropa el cual es vendida por ella misma para llevar el sustento a su casa de habitación.

Hoy en día la razón por la cual ha acudido a Ceprodel es para  solicitar un crédito para la compra de la ropa y así proceder a comercializarla en su localidad,
texts.en:
In the Terminal Market in the city of Leon, Mrs. Lucrecia Perez puts all her energy into selling selling clothing (that she also buys herself), which helps her contribute to her household expenses. She has requested a loan from Ceprodel so that she can buy more clothing and advertise in her area.

Translated from Spanish by Corinne Gilroy, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying clothes

loans.name: Afia

texts.en:
Afia J. is currently in the business of selling drugs at a clinic and is requesting a loan to stock more drugs in her clinic. Afia is 19 years old and is married to a husband who is a nurse. She has no children. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a hospital.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations.

BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: stock more drugs in her clinic

loans.name: Jinalyn

texts.en:
Jinalyn B. is a mother who aspires to a better future for her four year old daughter. She and her husband Jomarie agreed to get a loan from ASHI in order to attain her aspiration in life.  In 2007, Jinalyn joined ASHI. That year, she only received PHP5,000 loan. After two years of  maintaining her good performance in ASHI such as a good repayment record and a good attendance in center meetings, she is now qualified to apply for a loan in a higher amount.

Just recently, Jinalyn applied for a loan from ASHI amounting to PHP14,000. This loan will be used as additional capital for  the business she had been doing since the time she joined ASHI - her buy and sell  fish business. 

Through the opportunity Jinalyn receives from ASHI, she believes that her loan will not only enhance her business and child's education but also will provide her family a secured house.

loans.use: To buy and sell  fish

loans.name: Tina Marie

texts.en: Tina Marie F., 26, is married with no children.  She has three years of experience in the Chinese Cookies business. She sells to the general public six days per week. She has had no previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 150 Tala.  SPBD loans are Tina Marie’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: Purchase flour, sugar, onions, soya sauce and garlic

loans.name: Ubaidullo

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
      Убайдулло пожилой мужчина 60 лет. Он женат и отец 6-х детей. Его жена нигде не работает. Она сидит дома и делает домашнюю работу, кормит скот. Убайдулло занимается откормом и продажей скота. Наступление лета для Убайдулло – это сезон закупа скота, потому, что летом скот и его корм стоит дешево. И для откорма скота не надо много тратиться. Скот ест горную траву, и Убайдулло экономит на корме скота. С наступлением зимы Убайдулло продает часть откормившегося скота. Но он не покупает скот. Он покупает корм, для откорма оставшегося скота.
texts.en:
Ubaidullo is an elderly 60-year-old man. He is married and is a father of 6 children. His wife is not employed. She stays at home, does domestic work and feeds livestock. Ubaidullo is involved in feeding and selling livestock. Summer time for Ubaidullo is the season for purchasing livestock because livestock and animal feed prices are cheaper during the summer. And he does not need to spend very much on feeding livestock. Livestock eats mountain grass, allowing Ubaidullo to save on livestock feed. At the onset of winter, Ubaidullo sells some of the fed livestock, but he does not buy new livestock. He buys animal feed for the remaining livestock.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Livestock feeding and sales

loans.name: Almira

texts.en: Almira C., 33, lives with her husband Elvin, 32, a family driver, and their two grade school children in the heart of a joyful community in Maricaban, Pasay City. Almira owns a general store located just in front of her house. She remembers starting this business five years ago with a handful of items to sell. She now earns close to P10,000 a month from her general store. Almira joined the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative in 2004, the same year she opened her general store. She is applying for a P15,000 loan from CCT which she said she will use to expand her store by purchasing more items to sell. About CCT The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice. This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context. It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ.

loans.use: To purchase more items to sell

loans.name: Karuna

texts.en:
Karuna C. is a 44-year-old lady lives in Tangal, Lalitpur. She lives in a single family with her husband and two children. Her husband, Mr. Rakesh C., is engaged in his own small business. She has one son and one daughter. Her son and daughter are now studying at the university.

Mrs. Karuna C. opened her small restaurant a few years ago. In her restaurant, she sells newari foods. Newari food is very popular in Lalitpur district because a majority of the people in this region are newar and newari food is also very delicious to eat. She also serves tea and coffee to the customers.

To meet the increasing demand, she is requesting Rs 25,000.00 to buy various food materials for her shop. She utilizes her income for household expenses.

loans.use: To buy food materials for her work

loans.name: Claudia Julieta

texts.es:
La señora Claudia M. es madre soltera y tiene tres hijas adolescentes bajo su responsabilidad, que actual mente están estudiando.
Está solicitando un préstamo para pagar las colegiaturas y comprar los uniformes de sus hijas ya que no pueden entrar a la escuela si no tiene liquidada la inscripción, y para la señora Claudia es muy importante que sus niñas tenga los estudios necesarios para su futuro. 
Es por eso que está solicitando el crédito y piensa pagarlos con el ingreso que genera de su empleo, en una tienda donde vende accesorios de plata en el departamento de administradora. Esté es el ingreso que tiene para su familia y con el cual un parte será para pagar el crédito.
(La persona que aparece en la foto es una de sus hijas ya que la señora Claudia se encontraba en su trabaja cuando realizamos la visita.)

loans.use: Pagar la inscripción y comprar los útiles escolares

loans.name: Jeanny

texts.en:
Jeanny R. is from the village of Lupagan,Clarin,Misamis Occidental. She is 42 years old. Jeanny is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Jeanny owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale. Jeanny has been engaged in her business for over 21 years and earns approximately 12,000.00 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Jeanny joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jeanny has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future. Jeanny is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Jeanny from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Fely

texts.en: A loving and hardworking mother who continuously works for the betterment of her family: this is Fely V.. She is 45 years old and married to Jun V. who is a tricycle driver and who also helps his wife to run their business. They have two children who are 19 and 21 years old and are still studying. The family lives in the village of Barangay Mabini, Cadiz City, Negros Occidental. The couple strives really hard to provide for the future of their children. Jun drives the tricycle (a motorcycle with a passenger sidecar) that they own to shuttle passengers around town for a fee. Fely started a general store using recycled lumber for its structure just so she could have a place to setup her business. She knew even then that, once the business became stable, she would be able to start repairs and improve the structure. In addition to these two businesses, the couple also wakes up before dawn to buy fish either in the market or in the fishing port and sells it in front of their general store. Fely also started selling coffee and snacks as well as coconut wine adjacent to her house. In 2002, Fely joined NWTF-Project Dungganon to access additional capital for their expanding businesses. With more capital, she was able to increase her monthly income to PHP 20,000 on the average, providing their family with a more comfortable living and enabling her to make improvements to her store and house and have some left for savings. Fely borrowed PHP 29,500 on her previous loan which she used as additional capital in her general store business. She paid all of her weekly installments in full without any delays within her loan term. She now is borrowing the same amount of PHP 29,500 to use as working capital for her business. The income from it will be used to support the family's household needs. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the call of not just a few, but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: To use as additional working capital for her general store

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane B. strongly believes that attaining a higher level of education will lead her children to having a well compensated job or to a stable one. Although her six eldest children have stopped going to school, she still encourages them to go back. However, because of poverty and low income, she somehow understands the reason for her children’s decision.

Instead of succumbing to frustrations and disappointments, Mary Jane wants to grow her husband’s fishing business so as to increase the volume of fish she directly sells to people in their village and in the neighboring villages. Through this, their income will be increased and she will be able to support the education of her three youngest children until they graduate from college.

The loan she is requesting now is the greatest opportunity for her to change the pattern of life of her three remaining children. Also, she would love to prepare herself financially for the possibility that some of her older children will go back to school.

loans.use: To buy an engine and other materials for her husband's fishing boat

loans.name: Annie

texts.en: Annie R. is an entrepreneur from Norala, South Cotabato. She started with a small sari-sari store in 2004. Now she manages a piggery. She is 57 years old supporting six children in her family. She needs additional capital to expand her business. She joined Community Economic Ventures, Inc. because it has low interest charges in financing. She’s requesting a loan of 21,000 Philippine pesos to buy groceries for her store and repair her piggery house.

loans.use: To buy groceries and repair a piggery

loans.name: Alfreda

texts.en: Alfreda S. is from the village of Salimpuno. She is 28 years old, is married, and has one school-aged child. Alfreda owns and operates a business planting and harvesting cassava for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 2,900 PHP a month. In 2006, Alfreda joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,900 PHP from PMPC. Alfreda is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. This loan will be her 5th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise

loans.name: Khoudia

texts.fr:
-Khoudia  N.
Madame Khoudia N. est une habitante de Yoff  Mbenguene. Elle   est  sociétaire de la caisse de l’U-IMCEC depuis novembre 2003.Elle est mariée  et mère  de cinq enfants dont l’âge  varie entre 12 et 25 ans. Elle  est âgée  de 38 ans et a déjà bénéficié  de 3 prêts  antérieurs  au sein de l’institution. En  plus de ses six enfants elle gère  cinq autres personnes sous sa charge. Elle  a démarré  son activité  de commerce depuis l’âge  de 20 ans. Elle  est spécialisée  dans la vente de tissus, draps et aussi de poissons, activité  qu’elle a apprise par l’intermédiaire  de sa Tante. Son intérêt  dans cette activité  est  qu’elle réalise  des bénéfices  et parvient a s’occuper dans le temps.
Madame Khoudia emprunte  un montant de 150 000 frs dans le but d’augmenter son fond de roulement   et  de mieux valoriser l’acquisition des  produits qu’elle commercialise .Par conséquent   elle pourra  faire face a l’accroissement de la 
demande de sa clientèle.
Toujours dans son optique de participer activement a la lutte contre la pauvreté   l’U-IMCEC avec l’appui positif des prêteurs   réussit   a soutenir  les femmes dans l’exercice d’activités  lucratives génératrices de revenus, ce  qui favorise un développement  socio économique   apprécié.
texts.en:
Mrs. Khoudia N. is a resident of Yoff Mbenguene. She has been a member of U-IMCEC since November 2003. She is married and the mother of 5 children who range from 12 to 25-years-old. She is 38-years-old and has already benefited from 3 previous loans from this institution. In addition to her six children, she is in charge of five other people. She started her commercial business at the age of 20. She specializes in the sale of fabric, sheets and also fish, an activity she learned under her aunt's guidance. Her interest in this activity is to make a profit and hold a job over time. Mrs. Khoudia would like to borrow 150,000 frs with the goal of increasing her working capital and acquiring more of the products which she trades. Consequently, she could meet the growing demands of her customers.

Always looking to actively participate in the fight against poverty, U-IMCEC - with the positive support of lenders - succeeds in supporting women in revenue-generating activities which promote valuable, socioeconomic development.

Translated from French by Kelly Percival, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase of Working Capital

loans.name: Pablo

texts.es: Pablo de 49 años es un hombre muy trabajador, vive con su esposa Albertina de 34 años y sus hijos Aron de 13, David de 12 y Esther de 07 años, en su casa propia.Desde hace un año se dedica a la fabricación de máquinas refrigeradoras, conservadoras, entre otras, y  tiene gran cantidad de clientes ya que se ha hecho conocido por los buenos acabados que realiza, le gusta mucho esta actividad ya que esta acostumbrado al trabajo rudo, además  le proporciona  buenos ingresos económicos,  lo que le alcanza suficiente para la manutención de sus pequeños, que son su razón de vivir. En un futuro quiere aperturar  su propio taller ya que actualmente trabaja en asociación con un grupo de compañeros que  brindan este mismo servicio. Todos son muy unidos, pero Pablo piensa mucho en su familia y en brindarles un futuro mejor, es por esta razón  que quiere independizarse y emprender el negocio de manera individual.Este es el  segundo crédito con MFP y promete ser muy puntual y responsable como en las anteriores veces.Con el dinero del préstamo quiere comprar herramientas y maquinaria  para empezar su propio negocio.
texts.en:
Pablo, age 49, is a hard working man who lives with his wife, Albertina (34) and his children Aron (13), David (12), and Esther (7) in his own home. For about a year he has worked manufacturing refrigerators and ice chests, among other appliances. He has a large client base because he is known for the well-finished products that he makes. He likes his job because he is accustomed to hard work and because he earns good income, which is enough to support his three children who are his reason for living. Currently Pablos works with a group of colleagues who offer the same services but in the future he wishes to open his own shop. The group is very united but Pablo thinks a lot about his family and providing them with a better future, so he wants to become independent and launch his own, individual business. This is his second loan with MFP and he promises to be punctual and responsible as he was previously. With the money from this loan he wants to buy tools and machinery to start his own business.

Translated from Spanish by Mary McKee, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase machinery and new tools for his business

loans.name: Merenaite

texts.en:
Merenaite F. is 36 and married with 1 child (6 years-old).  She owns a business venture, planting & harvesting breadfruit for sale.  Merenaite has many years of experience in this business.  Merenaite needs a loan of WST $1000 to purchase general farm supplies & equipment.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 180 tala or US $75 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2009, Merenaite joined SPBD.    This is her 1st loan with SPBD.   SPBD's loans are Merenaite's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Merenaite F. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                1.5 out of 3
Level of Education:                              1.5 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         1.89 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              2 out of 3

You can view pictures of a typical vegetable garden in Samoa, taken by a Kiva Fellow, at:   http://picasaweb.google.com/agnes.p.chu/VegetableGarden#

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress. The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation. A higher number represents a higher score. For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase general farm supplies & equipment

loans.name: Ilhom

texts.en:
Ilhom I. is married with three children. This is an average size family in Isfara, Tajikistan. However, Ilhom is also a unique entrepreneur. Together with his wife, he has been selling blankets, towels, shawls and other things at the central city market for about 6 years. The secret of his success is simple: not only does he let his customers know the benefits of his products,  he also gives them a sense of relationship which brings them back again and again. However, he doesn’t want to stop where he is at with his venture. Ilhom is seeking a loan of $1000 USD to re-stock the merchandise in his store. We believe that Ilhom’s desire to excel in pleasing his customers will determine his further success and encourage new customers to buy from him.  


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing new supplies of goods to sell.

loans.name: Nasser

texts.en:
Nasser is a 19-year-old man who lives in Bint Jbeil, southern Lebanon. Nasser has owned a grocery store since 2009. He sells candies, roaster, beverages and lots more. He requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for his store. 

This is his second loan cycle and he has always paid on time. Nasser is special in his work because he is welcoming. His clients are people from his region. When he first started his business, he didn’t have enough cash to diversify his merchandise. He decided on doing his business because he wanted to have independent work. In the future, he plans on improving his business.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for his store

loans.name: Carlos Manuel

texts.es: Don Carlos Manuel S. pequeño agricultor de la comarca El Pijibay del municipio de el Rama, es casado con la Sra. Cleotilde, tiene 4 hijos, Carlos Antonio de 36 años y Delvin de 34, quienes ya se casaron y tienen su propia familia, y las menores Carla de 15 estudiando 3er año de secundaria y Fatima de 8 añitos en 4to grado de primaria, habitan con el; Esta necesitando fortalecer su inventario ganadero por lo que solicita a Afodenic su primer financiamiento para la compra de 5 toretes ya que quiere aprovechar el precio que tiene el ganado.  La finca del Sr. Carlos Manuel S. es apta para el manejo de semovientes ya que presenta las condiciones necesarias, tales como aguajes, pastos y praderas. Personalmente atiende su finca ayudado por su hijo y mano de obra que contrata temporalmente. Sus vecinos y colindantes dicen que es una persona honesta y cumplida con sus compromisos.
texts.en:
Carlos Manuel S. is a small farmer from the El Pijibay region in the municipality of Rama. He is married to Cleotilde, and has 4 children. His oldest sons are: Carlos Antonio who is 36 and Delvin who is 34, they are both married and have their own families. His youngest daughters are: Carla who is 15 and studying in her 3rd year of secondary school, and Fatima who is 8 and in 4th grade. Carlos’ youngest children live with him. Carlos would like to strengthen his cattle inventory, which is why he is requesting his first loan through Afodenic; his first loan will be used to purchase 5 young bulls given that he would like to take advantage of the current price of the cattle. Carlos Manuel S.’ ranch is well equipped to raise livestock as it contains the necessary elements for cattle raising, such as watering holes, pastures, and meadows. He personally attends to his ranch, helped by his son and workers that he hires seasonally. His neighbors say that he is an honest person, who fulfills his commitments.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase young bulls.

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma P. lives in Gango Ozamiz City. She is 50 years old, married and has six adult-aged children. To make a living, she runs a specialized retail store where she sells noodles, canned goods, eggs, vinegar, shampoo, soap, toothpaste and other items. Thelma has been engaged in this business for more than 15 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from her work.

In 2009, Thelma joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her life and ability to engage in business. She has successfully repaid a loan for 5,000 PHP from GDMPC, and has applied for a new loan of 7,000 PHP to buy additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated by her business to improve her family's life. 

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Narantsetseg

texts.en:
Narantsetseg is 40 years-old and lives with her son in Zavhan province, Mongolia. She and her son live together in a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent called a ger. Her son, Munhsaihan is 9 years-old and attends a local secondary school.

At present, Narantsetseg operates a traditional Mongolian clothing manufacturing business in her town. She makes Deel, the traditional Mongolian clothing, with a variety of designs for her many customers. Narantsetseg has been operating her business since 2001, and has gained a great deal of  experience over the past nine years. As her business is the only source of income for her family, she has focused on improving her skills as a sewer and growing her business. The most important thing for her is being able to provide for her son's education. She says, “I would like to bring up my son in a correct way and to be financially available for his education.” She is requesting a 200,000 tugrug (~ 150 USD) loan to purchase more silk and other materials in anticipation for the upcoming university graduations when demand for her products is very high.

loans.use: To purchase more materials.

loans.name: Mujeres Luchadoras 1 Group

texts.en:
Ana is the coordinator of her group, Mujeres Luchadores (Fighting Women), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in the urban slums surrounding Santiago, a large city known for its tobacco production, where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple, rented structure with husband and two children.

Ana is excited to be taking her fourth loan with Esperanza, after having successfully repaid her previous loans and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her nail salon business by purchasing more acrylic nails, as well as women's underwear and inexpensive jewelry to sell to her clients. She will use the profits to invest in a vehicle to make her life easier, as well as saving toward her long term goal of owning her own home. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To purchase acrylic nails, women's underwear and jewelry

loans.name: Sok Ny

texts.en:
Mrs. Sok Ny C. is a 31-year-old married woman who lives in Taok Ma village in Kandal province. She is a farmer but she does not have a piece of land on which to grow a crop, so she decided to ask for a loan to add her saving to buy a plot of land.

Mrs. Sok Ny C.’s husband, Mr. Sokha Kai, owns a motorbike that he uses to pull a trailer to transport passengers and goods. He is shown with her in the photo. The couple has three children: two are students in the local school and the youngest one is a year old.

loans.use: To add to her savings to buy a plot of land to farm

loans.name: Thavy's Group

texts.en: This group loan, which consists of eight members, is located in Chher Teal village in Kandal province. Mrs. Samnang L. is 31 years old and is the village bank president who has selected by the members. The members of this village loan will use it to buy supplies, equipments and other items to support their different purposes. Mrs. Samnang L. is a pig breeder while her husband, Mr. Sopheap Pael, is a police officer. For supporting pig breeding, Mrs. Samnang L. decided to ask for a loan to buy pig food for pig breeding. This couple has four childR. who all are students in the local school. The childR. also help their mother with her business.

loans.use: To buy pig food

loans.name: Ishmael Sam-Rat

texts.en:
Ishmael Sam-Rat S. is a businessman who trades in used clothes at Labour Road, Shenge market, Bo. He is married with two children and has three brothers who assist him in selling his stock. Both of his children are in primary school.

Ishmael is requesting a loan in order to increase his stock so that he can meet his customers’ needs. He intends to use the profit to start construction of his house.

loans.use: To buy more used clothing to sell

loans.name: Fenny Kache

texts.en:
Fenny K., 45, is a married mother of three children. Her husband Khamisi Katana is a 53-year-old businessman. Fenny runs a water-selling kiosk in Bamburi, a business that she has operated for five years. Fenny’s side business is poultry farming in the same area and this is also doing well.
