This marks Fenny’s second loan from KADET and with the money she hopes to purchase chick broilers, buy chicken feed, and to connect another water kiosk. She hopes to become a successful businesswoman in future.

loans.use: to purchase chick broilers, buy chicken feed, and connect another water kiosk

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Tu buy riced 80/20, pheasant-rice, sugar, oil, sodas

loans.name: Rosine

texts.fr:
jeune femme de 40ans, celibataire avec 2 enfants dont l'age varie entre 16 et 20 ans. En 1990 Elle se lance dans la vente des  fournitures des bureaux et scolaires quand elle arrete ses etudes pour cause de soutien.

Son etalage est installe devant le Centre Culturel Francais,ou il ya plusieurs administrations, ecoles ,lycee et ministeres ou les gens ont besoin des ses fournitures.

Avec le pret qu'elle compte recevoir elle va acheter 10 rames de papiers, les cahiers de toutes tailles, des bics de differents qualites et couleurs, trombones, agrapeuses, chemises et sous chemises...tout ce dont on a besoin pour le bureau et la scolarite.
A l'avenir elle a un projet d'ouvrir une papeterie, et avec ses epargnes , elle va continuer a aider ses enfants a faire des longues etudes universitaires, tres accueillante elle est vraiment disponible pour ses clients
texts.en:
A 40-year woman, single with two children, 16 and 20 years of age. In 1990, when abandoning her studies because of the need to support herself, she started a business selling office and school supplies. Her stand is located in front of the French Cultural Center, in an area with many administrative and governmental offices and schools (including a high school), where people have a need for her supplies. With this loan she is hoping to receive, she will purchase 10 reams of paper, notebooks in various sizes, ballpoint pens of various quality grade and color, paper clips, staplers, file folders and subfolder inserts…everything that is needed for the office and classroom. In the future, she envisages opening a stationery store. With her savings, she will continue helping her children receive a full university education. She is very friendly and always there for her customers.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing office and school supplies

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer V. is from the village of Punit. She is 30 years old. Jennifer is married and has two infant children. Jennifer owns and operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Jennifer is just starting this business.

In 2009, Jennifer joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business. She has successfully repaid her last loan from ASKI, which was for 7000 Philippine pesos (PHP) and was used purchase additional products to sell.

Jennifer is now requesting her third loan from ASKI, for 9000 PHP, which will also be used to to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: expanding store inventory

loans.name: Mao

texts.en: Mao D., 47, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Kompong Chnang Province, Cambodia.  This area is known for its quality palm products. D. sells shoes to earn an income of USD 10 per day. Her husband is employed at a magazine company, earning an income of USD 2 per day. D. is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase more shoes to sell. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her third loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: buy more shoes to resell

loans.name: Benetta

texts.en:
Benetta, aged 57, is a widow with two children and lives in Kangemi, a Nairobi suburb. She sells charcoal for fuel to the local households in Kangemi which is an urban area where most clients are low income earners. She has done this for the last five years. 

With this loan, she plans to buy 12 sacks of charcoal so as to add stock to her business. This is her 1st loan with KADET LTD and she has never borrowed from other financial institutions. In the future, she hopes to expand her business and improve the lives of her two children by giving them their necessary basic needs.

loans.use: Benetta is planning to buy 12 sacks of charcoal at kshs 800 each totalling to kshs 9600, ksh 400/ will be for transport.

loans.name: C2873 Abizeranye Group

texts.en:
Jean de Dieu is 30 years old and single.  Jean de Dieu is the leader of a group called Abizeranye. The group is known for selling a variety of goods and for their transportation business.  This group has been in this business for about three years and the business hours are from early in the morning until late in the evening.

Jean de Dieu and his team need to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company.  With this loan, Jean de Dieu and his team will hopefully expand his business by purchasing one additional motorcycle and a variety of goods, mainly foodstuffs.  If successful, this team will hopefully earn more profits and these profits will allow this team to keep reinvesting for better financial stability.

loans.use: To buy another motorcycle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy yarn in a variety of colors so that she can continue to knit

loans.name: Isfandiyor

texts.ru: Ахтамов Исфандиёр проживает в городе Душанбе. Возраст, 25 лет. Женат, имеет одного ребенка. Жена, домохозяйка. Сам Исфандиёр имеет высшее образование, экономист. По профессии не работает. Сейчас у него дилерский центр, где он пополняет балансы, продает сим - карты и карты для пополнения балансов. Этим видом деятельности занимается уже 6 лет. Кредит берет для покупки сим - карт.
texts.en: Istafandiyor A. lives in the city of Dushanbe.  He is 25 years old, married and has one child.  His wife is a homemaker.  Istafandiyor has a higher education, as an economist.  He does not work in that field.  Currently, Istafandiyor has a dealer center, where he refills usage balances, sells SIM cards and cards for refilling balances.  He has been involved in this business for 6 years.  He is requesting this loan for the purchase of SIM cards.

loans.use: Purchase of SIM cards

loans.name: Hadjah

texts.en:
Hadjah B. lives in the Kilokore neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is single and has three children, two of whom are in school.  She also takes care of additional family members. 

Hadjah has a business selling clothes.  She has been in this business for seven years, and she works 5 days out of every week. Hadjah sells her products in a shop, by means of retail. 

Hadjah has requested a loan of 800,000 from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bales of second-hand clothes. She also generates additional income through tailoring. 

The main business challenges for Hadjah include transportation and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to make her businesses more profitable by importing clothes herself. 

Hadjah lives in a home that she owns.  She doesn't have access to electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: To buy clothes for resale

loans.name: Metchico

texts.en:
Metchico T. is from the town of Surallah. She is 46 years old, married, and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Metchico raises crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. 

Metchico joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Metchico has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Metchico is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and other farm needs. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay for her children's tuition fees.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizers, and other farm needs

loans.name: Keldihan's Group

texts.en:
Keldihan A. is a resident of Tashkomur and the leader of this group.  Keldihan is 53, married, and has one child who attends school.  Her husband works in construction.  In order to earn money to cover family expenses, Keldihan breeds livestock animals. She resells livestock after fattening at a higher price. She has been doing it for 25 years and earns 5,000 soms a month. With money received from the loan, she wants to purchase more livestock animals for breeding.  In the future, she hopes to improve the family's living conditions and purchase a new house.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan.  MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly), and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135   If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase livestock

loans.name: Victor Manuel

texts.es:
Victor Manuel tiene 33 años de edad, es soltero y reside junto a su familia en el distrito de Túcume,una zona conocida por su atractivo turístico, ya que cuenta con varias ruinas que datan de tiempos pre – incaicos. Pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y se encuentra situada a más de veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a brindar servicio de fotografía y grabación de actividades sociales y especiales. El cuenta con una cámara la cual utiliza para realizar esta actividad en la zona. Los ingresos que le brinda esta actividad le sirven para solventar sus gastos y sacar adelante a su familia. El es bastante conocido en la zona y siempre cuenta con una clientela estable, que suele solicitar sus servicios siempre.

Victor Manuel desea adquirir una cámara adicional que le permita brindar mejor servicio y de esa manera recibir mas ganancias, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Victor Manuel is 33 years old.  He is single and lives with his family in Túcume district.  This is an area that is known for its tourist charm as it has several ruins that date from pre-Incan times.  It is located in Lambayeque province, more than twenty minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

Victor Manuel provides photography services and recording services for social activities and special activities.  He has a camera which he uses in his business.  The profits that he makes cover his expenses and help him to get his family ahead in life.  He is quite well known in the area and has a stable number of customers who always use his services.

Victor Manuel would like to acquire an additional camera that will allow him to provide a better service.  This way, he will be able to make more profits.  For this reason, he is requesting a loan for 1,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: To buy an additional camera which will enable him to provide a better service

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” VIRGEN ASUNTA  DE OROPEZA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Oropesa, perteneciente a la provincia de Quispicanchis y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Gladys; ella tiene 50 años de edad, conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de productos de belleza como cremas.shampus,colonias,perfumes entre otros .la socia es consultora de bellesa de las siguientes marcas avon,esika,unique y dupre ,ella se siente feliz ya que mediante este negocio ella saca a su familia adelante. 

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de mas productos para su negocio y así poder seguir adelante con lo que le gusta hacer y de esa manera saca a su familia adelante. 

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Gladys is a member of the "VIRGEN ASUNTA DE OROPEZA" community bank which is located in Oropesa district, in Quispicanchis province, in Cusco department.

Gladys is 50 years old.  She lives with her partner and has 2 children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business selling beauty products such as creams, shampoos, colognes, perfumes, etc.  She is a beauty consultant for the following brands: Avon, Esika, Unique and Dupre.  Gladys feels happy since, through her business, she gets her family ahead in life.

Gladys is requesting this loan to buy more products for her business so that she can continue to get herself and her family ahead in life doing what she enjoys doing.  She is happy to be receiving a loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: To buy more products for her business and thereby be able to get herself and her family ahead in life doing what she enjoys doing.

loans.name: Glory's Group

texts.en:
Glory V. is from the village of Victoria. She is 47 years old. Glory is the group leader of a six member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Glory V. Group.

Glory is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Glory owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Glory has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Glory joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Glory has successfully repaid a previous loan of 13,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase new items to expand product offering. Glory is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Glory from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of the borrower's children. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Tessi Yvone

texts.es:
La señora Tessi es socia del banco comunal Virgen De La puerta del distrito calleria, departamento de Ucayali, tiene 21 años de edad, un hijo menor y su esposo trabaja en un casino.
Tessi solo lleva un año como socia de este banco comunal, se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza por catálogo.
Con éste préstamo de S/. 1,700.00 invertirá en la compra de más productos para stock y así tener prodcutos disponibles para cualquier ocasión y así poder conservar su clientela, porque ahora la competencia es demasiada y si dan facilidad, van a poder conservar su clientela,  pagara s/.700.00 de su caja de pedidos y comprará 3 colonias para bebes,  1 talco para bebe, 2 champú, 3 perfumes para damas, 3 colonias para caballero, 2 cremas para el cuerpo, 5 labiales, 3 esmaltes de uñas.
La señora Tessi  tiene una niña recién nacida y el trabajo que tiene le da tiempo para estar con su niña, de esa manera ayuda también con algunos gastos a su esposo.
Manuela Ramos ha sido de gran ayuda para ella porque puede trabajar y generar ingresos a su hogar.
texts.en:
Tessi is a member of the “Virgen de la Puerta” (Virgin of the Door) communal bank in Callería district, Ucayali department.  She’s 21 years old and has a minor son; her husband is employed at a casino.

Tessi has only been a member of this communal bank for a year.  She sells catalogue beauty products.

With this 1700 new sol loan she will buy more products to stock in order to have merchandise on hand for whatever occasion thus keeping her clientele because competition is now quite heavy and if they provide any advantages they will keep their customers.  She will pay 700 new soles per case of orders and will buy 3 infant colognes, 1 baby talc, 2 shampoos, 3 women’s perfumes, 3 men’s colognes, 2 body creams, 5 lipsticks and 3 nail polishes.

Tessi has a newborn daughter and the work she has gives her time to spend with her little girl as well as helping her husband with some of the expenses.

Manuela Ramos has been of great help to her because she can work and generate income for her home.

loans.use: She will buy three infant colognes, 1 baby talc, 2 shampoos, 3 women’s perfumes, 3 men’s colognes, 2 body creams, 5 lipsticks and 3 nail polishes.

loans.name: Genoveva

texts.es: Genoveva tiene 50 años, vive sola en su casa propia. Hace más de 5 años se dedica a la agricultura, siembra principalmente papa, maíz y arveja entre otros productos. En ocasiones sus hijos la ayudan cuando es temporada de siembra o cosecha, en donde requiere de mayor mano de obra, además contrata el servicio de peones que le permite optimizar el tiempo y vender su cosecha en el mercado local. Para ella es ventajoso desarrollar la agricultura porque le permite tener el alimento disponible, además de que en algunos productos es rentable aunque reconozca que por factores climáticos haya un riesgo de perder la inversión pero sus años de experiencia le dan la capacidad suficiente para  prevenir dentro de sus posibilidades para mejorar, es por eso que seguirá adelante en esta actividad. Es su primer crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta y motivada de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero y agradece a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito solicitado, comprará sacos de abono.
texts.en:
Genoveva, age 50, lives alone in her own house.  She has been farming for five years.  She mostly plants potatoes, corn, and peas, among other products.  Her children sometimes help her during the planting or harvesting seasons, which require more labor.  She also hires workers.  That allows her to optimize time and sell her harvest at the local market.

It is advantageous for her to farm because it allows her to have food available.  Also, some products are profitable even though she realizes that there is a risk of losing her investment due to climate factors.  However, her years of experience give her the capacity to prepare for the possibilities in order to improve.  That is why she will get ahead in this business activity.

This is her first loan with MFP.  She is very happy and motivated to know that she has financial support.  She is grateful to the people who will be the lenders of the loan she is requesting.  It will be very useful to the progress of her business.  She will use the requested loan to buy sacks of fertilizer.

loans.use: To buy sacks of fertilizer

loans.name: Adonay

texts.es:
Adonay Pérez C., tiene la edad de 22 años, está soltero y vive con sus papás. El quiere comprar los insumos necesarios para la asistencia de su cafetal y tenerlo en buenas condiciones para esta próxima cosecha. El cuenta con el terreno ya en producción y lo que quiere es incrementar la producción de la plantación para obtener mejores rendimientos en cantidad y calidad este año, al igual que llegar a crecer como caficultor de la zona. El piensa en su futuro y en obtener ganancias para una mejor calidad de vida y así también ir alcanzando sus metas personales propuestas.
Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Adonay Pérez C. is 22-years-old. He's single and lives with his parents. He wants to buy the necessary supplies for the care of his coffee plantation so that he can have it in good condition for the next harvest. He's relying on land that's already in production, and what he wants is to increase the production of the plantation in order to gain better output in quantity and quality this year, at the same time managing to expand as a coffee grower in the region. He thinks about his future and about earning an income to improve his quality of life and achieve his personal goals. This is his first loan from FUDECOSUR. He hadn't had other loans from state banks, but FUDECOSUR has offered him this loan with ease and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for the care of his coffee plantation

loans.name: Nidia Lucia

texts.es: La señora Nidia Lucia tiene 39 años, Nidia es una mujer luchadora que se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general como ropa nueva, bolsos, cosméticos, calzado, perfumes. Ella vende sus productos en diferentes lugares pues así encuentra una gran variedad de clientes, los distribuye en diferentes lugares y también a personas que le encargan. Todas las semanas viaja a estos lugares a repartir su mercadería. El crédito lo utilizara para la compra de zapatos, camisetas, camisas, bóxers, blusas, bikinis, libretas, cuadernos, lápices, colores, bolsos, cosméticos entre otros.
texts.en:
Nidia Lucia is 39 years old.  She is a tenacious woman who sells general merchandise like: new clothes, purses, cosmetics, footwear and perfumes.  She sells her products in several places because that’s how she gets a variety of customers.  She sells in several places but also to people who place orders with her.  She travels weekly to these places to distribute her merchandise.

She will use the loan to buy shoes, t-shirts, shirts, boxer shorts, blouses, bikinis, notebooks, writing tablets, pencils, crayons, purses and cosmetics, among others.

loans.use: to buy shoes, t-shirts, shirts, boxer shorts, blouses, bikinis, notebooks, writing tablets, pencils, crayons, purses and cosmetics.

loans.name: Balvina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LAS AMISTOSAS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urcos, perteneciente a la provincia de Quispicanchis y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Balvina; ella tiene 48 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de animales como chancho y cuyes, la socia también vende comida y pan en el distrito de Urcos, la socia realiza diferentes tipos de negocios y saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar los negocios. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar alimentos para los animales y comprar productos para vender comida.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Here is a member of the communal bank named "The Friends". It is located in the district of Urcos, belonging to the province of Quispicanchis and the department of Cusco. 

Her name is Balvina. She is 48 years old, married common-law, and she has 4 children. She alternates her daily activities with her livestock sales business, including pigs and guinea pigs. She also sells prepared foods and bread in the district of Urcos. She carries out different types of businesses in order to support her children. She wants to expand and improve her businesses. She requests a loan to purchase livestock feed and to purchase ingredients she needs to sell her foods. 

She is happy for this loan and she is committed to making her payments.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and ingredients to prepare foods

loans.name: Violah

texts.en:
Violah J. R. is a single lady of twenty-nine who lives in Cheplasgei on the outskirts of Eldoret. She keeps poultry for sale in the same area and has been in this business for six years now. She gets a monthly income of KES.7,000.


This will be Violah's fourth loan from KADET LTD. She plans to use the entire loan to buy poultry feed and add more chicks to raise.

With the additional income that she will get she wants to buy more poultry so that she can expand her business. In future she wants to build rental houses so that she can add to her income.

loans.use: To buy poultry feed and more chicks to rear.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is 23 years old and single, and he takes care of 3 children.  Emmanuel sells second-hand men's and children's clothes in the market.  He works from 7 am to 6 pm every weekday.  He has been in this business for 5 years and he currently employs one person to help him.

He has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company to buy more second-hand men's and children's clothes to sell.  With this loan, Emmanuel will be able to earn more profit, which will allow him to save in the future.  He plans to build a house with his profit.

loans.use: To buy more second-hand clothes to sell.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua sells fried fish and Fante kenkey (a staple dish similar to a sourdough dumpling) in Abura near Brasi. She is a widow taking care of seven dependents, whose needs are increasing. Efua therefore needs to increase her production to increase sales to be able to take care of them. A loan will help her buy more maize and fresh fish to fry for sale. She anticipates reinvesting her new profit back into her business.

loans.use: to buy more maize and fresh fish to fry for sale.

loans.name: Luis Oswaldo

texts.es:
Luis es un padre de familia 37 años de edad, vive con su esposa e hijos en su casa propia, cuenta con servicio sólo de luz, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de la Illimo, que se encuentra a una distancia larga del departamento de Lambayeque.  Esta zona la actividad principal es la agricultura y ganadería.

Luis de hace algunos años se dedica a la crianza y venta de ganado porcino (cerdos), su corral se encuentra en la parte posterior de su casa, los alimenta con comida balanceada para que sus animales lleguen a tener un crecimiento óptimo y así pueda ofrecerlos a los diferentes mercados de la zona obtenindo  muy buenas ganancias para solventar sus gastos diarios.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2000 nuevos soles para comprar animales y su respectiva comida, para engordarlos y poder ofertarlos a sus clientes a un buen precio.  Luis es una persona trabajadora y muy responsable que lo único que quiere es que su negocio crezca cada vez más para poder cubrir su crédito y poderles dar un mejor nivel de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Luis is a 37 year-old father who lives with his wife and children in his own home which has only electricity.  It is located in the rural area of Illimo district, a long distance from Lambayeque department.  The main business activities in this area are farming and livestock raising.

Luis has been raising and selling pigs for some years.  He has a pen located in an area behind his home.  He feeds his animals with balanced feed so that they grow optimally and he can then sell them in the different markets in his area and make very good profits with which to cover his daily expenses.

Luis has requested a loan for 2,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa to buy animals and their respective feed.  He will fatten the animals and then sell them to his customers at a good price.  Luis is a hard-working, very responsible person and the only thing he wants is for his business to continue growing so that he can repay his loan and be able to provide his family with a better standard of living.

loans.use: to buy animals and feed

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 31 years old and married with two children.  He runs a bodaboda (motorbike) transport business to earn a living.  Apart from the motorbike transport business, he supplies cakes to generate more income.  John was previously earning a living from his small kiosk.
  
John joined Empathy group in Faulu Kenya so that he could easily access business loans because the members of the group guarantee each other's loans.  He has requested 40,000 Kenyan shillings to buy a motorbike.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike

loans.name: Nabil

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 38 years old, married and has three children.

In 2006, Nabil opened a women's accessories and clothing store. He has a deep understanding of local consumer needs,  a good reputation and he is well known in his area.

He is requesting a $2800 loan to add more inventory and to renovate his shop. He is aiming to gain more profits to improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To add more inventory and renovate his shop.

loans.name: Ysmael

texts.es: El Sr. Ysmael vive en casa de sus padres en la zona el Dorado, es soltero y hace un año que se dedica a la elaboración de pan con la colaboración de sus padres, actualmente tiene su propio capital donde ya es independiente, el crédito que se le otorgo es para la compra de harina, manteca, azúcar por quintal ya que tiene mucha clientela. El sr. Ysmael coloca sus panes en las ventas por su barrio y otros lugares que con el tiempo se esta haciendo conocer.   El sr. quedo muy agradecido por oportunidad y confianza que se le brindo al otorgarle dicho crédito.
texts.en:
Sr. Ysmael lives at the home of his parents in the District of El Dorado. He is single and has been making bread for the past year alongside his parents. Ysmael currently possesses his own capital, so he is independent. The loan being provided to him will be used to buy flour, butter, and sugar by the “quintal” (1 quintal = 46kg) since he has many customers.

Sr. Ysmael offers his baked goods for sale in his neighborhood and in other places where he has gained a reputation over time. He is very grateful for the opportunity and the trust that has been demonstrated to him by providing this loan.

loans.use: to purchase flour, butter, and sugar.

loans.name: Haydar

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 33 years old, married, and has one child. 

Haydar has had a car workshop since 2000 that sells spare parts. He has much experience in this field, and has a good reputation as he is well known in his area. 

He is requesting a $2000 loan to make a sliding door and a ceiling for his workshop, and to purchase additional inventory. He is aiming to make more profit to improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: To make a sliding door and a ceiling for his workshop and to purchase additional inventory

loans.name: Sonun

texts.en:
Sonun lives in Balykchi, a small town in Isykul region. She is 53 and, unfortunately, a widow. She has raised a son who is 23 and works as a policeman. Sonun went into business 10 years ago selling fish in a local market, but now runs a business selling hosiery and women's underwear. She earns about 8,000 soms a month, a good salary, and is applying for this loan to buy school uniforms to sell this fall. Her goal for the future is to earn enough money to improve her life by repairing her house and buying new furniture. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---
This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and see a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to buy school uniforms to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Kadzo

texts.en:
Kadzo is a married woman with five children, two boys and three girls. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food, electricity and school fees.

For the past two years, she has operated a vegetable stall business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of competition from other vegetable stall operators. Kadzo dreams of accessing bigger loans to expand her business in the future.

With the KSHS 20,000, she wants to purchase sacks of tomatoes, onions, potatoes and vegetables for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of tomatoes, onions, potatoes and vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy chickens and eggs.

loans.name: Ayoko Akouavi

texts.fr:
Ayoko Akouavi est une femme âgé(e) de 32 ans. Elle est célibataire. 
Ayoko Akouavi travaille comme revendeuse de produits d’alimentation générale depuis 2007. Elle vend à domicile après achat au Grand Marché de Lomé. 01 personne l’aide dans l’exercice de son activité.
Ayoko Akouavi a requis son  second cycle de prêt à WAGES afin d’acheter des savons, des bidons d’huile, du lait et divers.
texts.en:
Ayoko Akouavi is 32 years old and single. She has been working as a retailer of general grocery products since 2007. Ayoko buys her products at the Grand Marché  in Lomé and then re-sells the goods at her home. She has one assistant. 

Ayoko is requesting a second loan from WAGES in order to buy soap, barrels of oil, milk and miscellaneous items.

loans.use: to buy general grocery products

loans.name: Emily

texts.en: Emily is a 34-year-old hardworking business woman.   She is married and is blessed with two children. For the past year, she has been selling coffins to earn a living. She also practices poultry farming. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, Emily has been able to save her money and access business loans.  In the next 5 years, she wants to expand her business. She is requesting for a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy more coffins to resell.

loans.use: buy coffins to resell

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en:
Isaac is a very hardworking man who has operated a motorcycle taxi for the past three years. He is a good client. He was introduced to KADET LTD through a marketing campaign done by KADET staff within the town. 

He has applied for his first loan, which he plans to use to buy spare motorcycle parts. He will use the return from the loan to buy a salon car to operate as a taxi, which earns better income than a motorcycle.

His dream is to be rich and self-sustaining in life.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for a motorcycle

loans.name: Maria Ines

texts.es: Maria Ines tiene 57 años, es una mujer muy luchadora y además disfruta de tener este negocio que le ha generado los ingresos necesarios. Ella se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras, además de este negocio también se dedica a la  crianza de aves, Maria siempre esta innovando en su negocio pues ella siempre está pensando en mejorar sus ganancias cada día. Este financiamiento es para la compra de fertilizantes, herramientas necesarias para sembrar entre otros.
texts.en: Maria Ines is 57 years old.  She is a very tenacious woman who enjoys her business which has made her the income she needs.  She sells fruit and vegetables and also raises farmyard birds.  Maria is always innovating in her business as she is always thinking of how to improve her profits every day.  This loan will be used to buy fertilizers and tools that she needs to sow crops.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and tools she needs for sowing crops

loans.name: Army Group

texts.en:
Joan is a mother with four children at home. She joined One Acre Fund due to One Acre Fund’s best prices and in order to ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Joan had an excellent maize yield, harvesting 10 bags on ½ an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Joan was only able to harvest 3 bags of maize on ½ an acres of land. With income from maize sales, Joan will educate her children, build a house and invest in livestock rearing.

Joan is the facilitator of the Army group. Joan and her group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. In 2012, the members of Army group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land. Joan is photographed with her group members.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Joan and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February, 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

loans.use: to source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Darlin Karin

texts.es:
Darlin tiene 31 años de edad, casado desde hace 12 años, vive en el Barrio Cabañas de San Pedro Sula, tiene un hijo de 12 años de edad, quien esta estudiando. Su esposa hace productos de manualidades para vender y aporta al hogar.

Hace 8 años que Darlin se a dedicado a vender varios productos entre ellos artículos de cocina (ollas), productos de limpieza, lociones, champú, ropa (pantalones, blusas), etc. 
Este negocio lo estableció con dinero propio, luego solicito prestamos con ODEF para ir incrementando su inventario, este es el séptimo préstamo y lo va invertir en compra de ropa como ser: pantalones, blusas y lociones, ya que viene la temporada buena para la venta.
Su meta es seguir con este negocio, invirtiendo más para vender más y mejorar la economía del hogar.
texts.en:
Darlin, 31, has been married for 12 years.  He lives in San Pedro Sula’s Cabañas neighborhood.  He has a 12 year old son who is in school.  His wife makes manual arts to sell and contribute to the home.

Eight years ago Darlin started selling varied products.  Among them are kitchen ware (pots), cleaning supplies, lotions, shampoo, clothes (pants, blouses), etc.  He started the business with his own funds and then requested ODEF loans to increase inventory.  This is his 7th loan and he will use it to buy clothes like pants and blouses and lotions because a season that’s good for sales is approaching.  His goal is to stay in business investing more to sell more and improve his home’s economy.

loans.use: to buy assorted stock merchandise.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.es:
Josefina nació en el distrito de Huayllabamba de la provincia de Urubamba del departamento del Cusco y ahora vive en la ciudad de Urubamba, ella tiene 65 años de edad y es casada y fruto de esta unión tiene cinco hijos.
 
Josefina desarrolla sus actividades cotidianas y económicas en la ciudad de Urubamba, ella se dedica  a la venta de chicha de quinua en uno de los mercados populares de la ciudad de Urubamba. Ya son varios años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. 

Josefina requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos como sacos de azúcar, sacos de quinua y otras cosas más. 

Josefina se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma. Josefina pertenece al banco comunal “Tercer Milenio” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad de Urubamba.
texts.en:
Josefina, 65, was born in Huayllabamba, a district in the Peruvian "departamento" of Cusco.  She now lives in the city of Urubamba with her husband and their five children.
 
Josefina operates a drinks business in Urubamba.  She sell "chicha de quinua" [a traditional quinoa-based drink] in one of Urubamba's most important markets.

Josefina will use this loan to buy supplies--sugar, quinoa, etc.--for her drinks business.

Josefina is grateful for the opportunities that this type of lending provides and is committed to repaying her loan in the agreed-upon time.  She belongs to the Tercer Milenio community bank, an Asociacion Arariwa partner in Urubamba.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her drinks business.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is 30 years old and married to a farmer in her village. She has been involved in buying and selling hogs for over two years and has extensive experience in this business. This business brings in a good profits both to the business and the family budget. Elizabeth dreams to lift her family from poverty; this is why she works hard at her hog raising business. She also wants to provide the necessities for her pigs. Therefore, she has requested a loan of P12,000 to acquire feed, vaccines, and vitamins for her pigs. She hopes this will make them fit and nourished, and provide higher prices when it is time for them to be sold. She also hopes to grow her business to secure a good living for her family.

loans.use: To acquire feed, vaccines, and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Babacar

texts.fr: Monsieur Babacar  est âgé de 30 ans. Il habite au Sénégal  et évolue dans  le commerce et le vente de tissus, draps et  parfums depuis un an. Il a choisi cette activité dans le but de  se procurer des revenus qui l’aideront à  prendre en charge ses besoins personnels. Ce qui l’intéresse  surtout c’est l’aspect lucratif de son activité. Il est membre de l’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC depuis avril 2011. Il sollicite un crédit de 200 000 frs prévu pour  l’achat de tissus, draps et parfums qui seront destinés a la vente. Son objectif est d’améliorer ses gains financiers.
texts.en:
Babacar is 30 years old.  He lives in Sénégal and has been making progress with his business selling cloths, fabrics, and perfumes for one year.  

He chose this activity in order to generate income that would help take care of his personal needs. What interests Babacar the most about his business is its profitable nature. 

Babacar has been a member of one of the UIMCEC branches since April of 2011. He is seeking a loan of 200,000 FRS [XOF] intended for the purchase of fabrics, cloths, and perfumes intended for resale.  His aim is to improve his profits.

loans.use: to purchase fabric, cloth, and perfumes for resale.

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en:
Isaac is 31 years old and married with one nine-year-old child.  He lives in Eldoret in the North Rift region of Kenya.  He has been an active farmer for four years and also runs a transport business in the local market.  Isaac’s farm produces milk that he sells in the local market.  Isaac says dairy cow feed is extremely expensive and is the major limitation in dairy farming.

Isaac requested a 31,200 KES loan from Kiva partner Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow.  He hopes the income will help him pay for his child’s education.  Isaac is focused on expanding his livestock supply to ten cows, possibly with the income generated from the current dairy cows and transport business.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow for his dairy farming business.

loans.name: Riza Mae

texts.en:
Riza Mae is twenty years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. For the past two years Riza Mae has had a shop where she sells canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Riza Mae has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. She has requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to buy more stocks of food for her shop. She hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of food for her shop.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en:
Even though Aba grew up in poverty without an education, this has not stopped her from fulfilling her dream of achieving a better life for her and her family. Currently, she is an entrepreneur. She prepares and sells banku for a living. Banku is a traditional Ghanaian dish made using fermented corn and cassava dough that is mixed proportionally and cooked in hot water into a smooth white paste. Banku is usually served with okro stew, groundnut soup, palm nut soup, or pepper sauce. 

Aba primarily sells her banku at Ayensudo located in Elmina. Her business enterprise has grown substantially since she began 11 years ago. She uses the income from her business to help her raise her three children. 

Aba has identified that there is a growing demand among consumers for her banku. She is unable to meet their needs due to limited inventory. Thus, she aims to use her loan to purchase a greater quantity of maize and cassava to help her to prepare more of her tasty banku.

With the new profits from her expanded business, Aba wants to ensure that all of her children will be given the opportunity to further distance their family from poverty.

loans.use: to purchase a greater quantity of maize and cassava to help her to prepare more of her tasty banku

loans.name: Yan's Group

texts.en: Yan is a villager from Battambang province. She has nine children, three of whom are in school. To secure the decent food in her family, she grows rice and works as a paid-worker. Now, she is shortage of working capital to support her farmland. This is the first loan for Yan with VisionFund(Kiva’s partner). She leads a group of two to get a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy rice seed and fertilizer for her crop. She hopes that she can make triple income than before.

loans.use: To buy rice seed and fertilizer for her crop

loans.name: Feruza

texts.ru: Феруза молодая дехканка района Н.Хусрав. Ей 23 года. Она замужем и мать одного 4 летного сына. Муж хороший, добрый человек. Он находится на заработках в Российской Федерации по причине, что он в стране не нашел себе подходящую работу. Он зарабатывает, чтобы обеспечить семью.  Феруза на районе занимается животноводством. Она выращивает мелко рогатого скота у себя во дворе. 5 лет Феруза продвигает свою деятельность. Ей животноводческой деятельность является основной, потому что доход от этой деятельность обеспечить ее ребенка и семью. Ферузе хотелось расширить деятельность путем увеличения поголовье скота, по этой причине она обратилась за кредитом. За счет кредита она купить несколько мелко рогатого скота. Ваша поддержка поможет ей достичь своих целей.
texts.en:
Feruza is a young peasant from Nosiri Khusrav district. She is 23 years old. She is married and has a four year old son. Her husband is a good, kind man. He lives and works in Russia because he could not find a suitable job in Tajikistan. He is working in order to support his family. 

Feruza is engaged in animal husbandry in the area. She breeds small cattle at home in her yard. Feruza has been pushing forward with her business for five years. Stock breeding is her main business, because the income from this business supports her child and family. 

Feruza wants to expand her business by increasing her livestock headcount, and for this reason she has applied for a loan. Your support will help her to achieve her goals.

loans.use: to expand her stock-breeding business and to buy livestock.

loans.name: Hak's Group

texts.en:
Hak is a married woman and she blessed with three children. Living in Battambang province, she has made a living farming rice, raising cows, and pigs. Having been in this business for 10 years, she is able to earn about 40,000KHR per day. 

Hak is just with VisionFund for this cycle and now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy seeds and use a portion of it to pay for labor in harvesting rice as well. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income from her rice paddy.

loans.use: to use her portion to buy seeds for supporting her farmland

loans.name: José Victor

texts.en:
My name is Victor S., I have been working in my clothing store for eight years. It is located in the market of my city and is frequently visited by neighbors and people traveling through town. At this moment in time I would like to have more summer clothes. My family consists of my two children and my wife and we have to work to support our small family.

Descripción del Negocio: Mi nombre es Víctor S., me dedico a la venta de ropa desde hace ocho años. Esta ubicado en el mercado de mi ciudad por lo que es bastante visitado por vecinos y personas en transito. En este momento quiero tener mas ropa de verano. Mi familia es de dos hijos y mi esposa por lo que tenemos que trabajar para mantener a mi pequeña familia.

loans.use: Buying underwear, trousers for men, women and children, beach towels and bathing suits.

loans.name: Tamasha

texts.en:
This 39-year-old woman was born in Fizuli region Kurdmahmudlu village. She is married, has 4 children. 
Tamasha has a smal business where she sells agricultural produce: fruis, vegetables and etc. She started off working by selling as a street vendor.
Having borrowed a loan of $400 she bought agricultural produce.
Now she needs a loan of $700 to expand the area of her business.
Notwithstanding she lives on front line she works very hard to improve her business.
Tamasha has been engaged in this business for 6 years.

loans.use: To expand the area of her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: The loan will be invested in the purchase of materials with which to cover current client orders, and in the purchase of new replacement parts for bicycles.

loans.name: Sing

texts.en: Mrs. Sing K. S. is 56 years old and lives in Phnom Penh, Cambodia with her husband and their 7 children.  Sing K. S. sells fruit at the market while her husband is a construction foreman.  Together, they earn approximately $7/day.  One of their children works in Malaysia and sends back part of their income to the family, and the other 6 children are students and help around the house.  This loan will be used to purchase pipes and other construction materials for Sing K. S.'s husband.

loans.use: To purchase pipes for construction business

loans.name: Mutribahon

texts.ru:
Mutribahon N., 28, has high school education. She is married with 2 children. Her husband is engaged in trading, the children are at a day care. Mutribahon sells men's underwear and women's robes. She has been in trading business for 8 years. Mutribahon had started to sell men's underwear with $80 in assets. After getting her first loan of $70 from Microinvest in 2004 she has added women's robes to her assortment. The loan helped her to increase the revenue to twice it's original size. In the future she plans to open one more trading kiosk.

Translated from Russian by Elena Sheyner, Kiva Volunteer.

Назирова Мутрибахон – 28лет. Образование среднее, замужем, мать двоих детей. Муж занимается торговлей, дети ходят в детский сад. Она занимается продажей мужскими нижними белями и женскими халатами. Занимается торговлей 8лет. Начала свою деятельность с 80$. Раньше до получения займа она торговала только мужскими нижними белями. После получения первого займа в сумме 70$, которое получила в «Микроинвест» в 2004году, добавила в свой ассортимент и женские халаты. С помощью займа увеличила товарооборот в два раза и в будущем планирует открыть еще одну торговую точку.

loans.use: to open another trading place

loans.name: Sawssan

texts.en: Sawssan sells cosmetics and gold in Roueiss, located in the suburbs of Beirut. She needs $700 to buy enough products for her business. Sawssan is a 38 year old married woman who is happy to be professionally active.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics products for her sales business

loans.name: Parbati

texts.en:
Mrs. Parbati N. is a 33 year old lady who lives in Sainbu Bhainshepati VDC, Lalitpur. Sainbu Bhainshepati VDC is one of the fastest developing villages of Lalitpur. She lives with her husband and two sons. Her husband, Shanker N., works in a private office.

Mrs. N. opened her tailoring shop two years ago. She makes different types of custom-fitted ladies' dresses in her shop. She prefers to makes ladies' dresses like kurta-salwar, blouses, petticoats, ladies long dresses, and dresses for newborn babies. She received six months of training in tailoring from a local tailoring shop. Now she is asking for her first loan of Rs10000 to buy raw materials like cloth, thread, and a cutting machine for her tailoring works.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for her work

loans.name: Dominga Mercedes

texts.es:
Dominga Mercedes M. is a lady of limited resources who began her current economic activity by selling vegetables in the market. To do this she buys vegetables in cash at the market; occasionally she buys on credit, but looks for a way to pay the debt as soon as possible.

Mrs. M. has been in this business for the past 18 years: it is quite an effort because daily she has to carry all of the bags and baskets of vegetables to her stand in the market in Leon. She started her business with money she earned from others she had selling her wares in the area around the market.

Currently her business is located within the central market in Leon, at a stand which has 2 sections, using baskets and buckets loaded with all types of vegetables and fruits.

Before she had this business, she worked in the fields cleaning cotton, but with a lot of effort, together with her husband, they were able to get ahead in order to secure a future for their children.

Ceprodel has been her best ally over the past 3 years with 10 loans granted. She is an excellent client and little by little her business has improved, as has her house, thanks to the credits she has received.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer.

Dominga Mercedes Martínez es una dama de escasos recursos que inició su actividad económica con la venta de verduras en el mercado. Para ello, compra las verduras de contado en el mercado y en ocasiones compra a crédito pero con mucho esfuerzo, busca la manera de pagar esta deuda lo inmediato posible.

La Señora Martínez tiene este negocio desde hace 18 años atrás costándole muchísimo esfuerzo, por lo que diariamente tiene que cargar con todas las bolsas y canastos de verduras hacia su puesto de venta en el mercado de León. Inicio su negocio con un capital producto de la ganancia de otros negocios que ella tenia vendiendo a los alrededores del mercado con su mercadería al aire libre.

Actualmente su negocio se ubica en el mercado central de León en un puesto de venta que tiene 2 tramos utilizando canastos, panas y baldes, todos cargados de todo tipo de verduras y frutas.

Antes de tener este negocio trabajaba en el campo limpiando algodón pero con mucho esfuerzo y lucha en conjunto con su esposo, lograron salir avantes para garantizar el futuro de sus hijos.

Ceprodel ha sido su mejor aliado en los últimos 3 años con 10 créditos otorgados, excelente cliente y su negocio ha mejorado al igual que su vivienda poquito a poco, gracias a todos los créditos que ella ha recibido.

loans.use: Purchase of vegetables

loans.name: Ceila

texts.es:
Ceila lives on Rafael Pavon Street in the area of July 16th, located in the city of El Alto. She lives with her husband and her 5 year old son. She works alongside her husband in the fabrication of jackets and coats, which they distribute at wholesale in various fairs within the city. The loan will be used in the purchase of work material, such as fabrics, leathers and linings. This is the first loan request with Impro and the evaluation made has qualified her for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Wendy Wise

Ceila vive en la calle Rafael Pavón de la zona 16 de Julio, ubicada en la ciudad de El Alto. Vive junto a su esposo y su pequeño hijo de 5 años. Trabaja junto a su esposo en la confección de chamarras, sacones los cuales distribuye al por mayor en las diferentes ferias de la ciudad. El crédito lo destinara en la compra de material de trabajo (telas, cuero, forros, etc.). Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada la califica para otorgarle el préstamo.

loans.use: Purchase of fabrics, leathers and linings for the making of coats and jackets.   Compra de telas, cueros, forros para la confección de chamarras y sacones.

loans.name: Julia Rosa

texts.es:
Julia Rosa A. O. is 56 years old. She has a grade 2 education. She has one daughter who is already out of the house.

She's been in commerce for 25 years. Apart from the buying and selling of men's and women's clothing, she has always sold fruit in the districts of Quiruvilca y Otuzco, and aslo sells food, soda and beer in her home. In addition, she makes aprons, skirts and slips which she sells to the women in her community and in other towns.

When Julia joined Banco Comunal "San Juan de Miraflores", she was given her first loan of 300 soles (3 soles = $1) with which she bought a variety of fabrics to continue tailoring, as well as some sweaters, pants and outfits.

With the loan of 2000 soles, which she'll repay in 4 months, she'll travel to Lima to buy clothing such as sweaters, jackets, pants and other wholesale items of clothing.

Julia is the president of the "Asesguida" group that is in charge of the activities and celebrations of the region. She is also the vicepresident of the dining hall of the "Santísima Trinidad de Cuyuchugo".

Translated by Beatriz Yuste, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Julia Rosa A. O. tiene 56 años de edad, estudió sólo hasta el segundo grado de primaria. Tiene una hija quien ya no depende de ella. Hace 25 años que es comerciante. Desde siempre ha vendido frutas por los distritos de Quiruvilca y Otuzco, además vende en su casa comida, gaseosas y cerveza, aparte de la compra y venta de ropa para damas y caballeros. Asimismo confecciona mandiles, faldas y enagües los cuales ofrece y vende a las mujeres de su comunidad y por los diferentes caseríos. Ella forma parte del Banco Comunal “San Juan de Miraflores” en el que le dieron su primer préstamo de S/. 300.00,con este dinero compró una variedad de telas para seguir confeccionando, así mismo también compró un cuarto de chompas, pantalones y conjuntos. Con el préstamo de S/.2000.00 que cancelará en 4 meses viajará a Lima para comprar ropa, chompas, casacas, pantalones y otros al por mayor. La señora Julia es presidenta del cuartel “Asesguida” el cual se encarga de las actividades y celebraciones de su región, además es vicepresidenta del comedor “Santísima Trinidad de Cuyuchugo”. Su mayor sueño es poner un negocio en la ciudad de Lima con el fin de estar más cerca de su hija quien ahora radica allá.

loans.use: To buy sweaters, pants and other items of clothing.

loans.name: Phung Thi

texts.vi:
Like a lot of other families, Phùng Thị K. family living condition was difficult before joining TYM. Mrs K. is 56 years old. Beside working on the family rice field, she did not have have any side job . Their house is very small so it is cramped. She also has a lot of children so things are really difficult. Her first loan from TYM was 200 USD which was used to raise pigs. She had barely enough money to feed her children. After years of hard work and determination, her children had grown up. They have a job so they could contribute financially. With her savings, she had built a house worth 6000-7000 USD. Her dream has come true. When the loan officers came to visit her in her new house, she was very emotional when she talked about how TYM had helped her turn her life around. Her wish is to remain a TYM member forever, continuing her business. This time she requests a loan of 1200 USD to buy a new batch of breeding pigs.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Cùng với một số gia đình khác trước khi tham gia Quỹ, hoàn cảnh gia đình chị Phùng Thị K., 56 tuổi, thuộc diện khó khăn. Ngoài làm mấy sào ruộng, chị cũng không có nghề phụ gì thêm, căn nhà nhỏ tạm bợ rất chật chội. Nhà lại đông con nên khó khăn lại càng khó khăn hơn. Ban đầu chị chỉ vay một hai trăm USD đầu tư chăn nuôi nhỏ. Hàng ngày chị đi chợ rau cỏ đủ cho nhu cầu sinh hoạt tối thiểu cho gia đình. Sau nhiều năm vất vả, chịu thương chịu khó, các con chị giờ đây đã trưởng thành. Số tiền các con đi làm tích cóp cộng với vốn vay, chị đã xây được căn nhà rất khang trang trị giá 6000-7000USD. Mơ ước của chị giờ đã thành hiện thực. Khi chúng tôi đến thăm gia đình thì căn nhà đã hoàn tất, với niềm vui mừng chị K. không giấu được vẻ xúc động khi nói về những thay đổi của gia đình từ khi tham gia Quỹ. Nguyện vọng của chị là sẽ tiếp tục tham gia Quỹ lâu dài và mãi mãi, tiếp tục vay vốn phát triển kinh tế. Mức vốn đề nghị của chị cho vòng này là 1200USD mua lợn giống thay cho lứa lợn mới xuất chuồng.

loans.use: Buy pigs

loans.name: Virgínia  João

texts.pt:
Virgínia João H., born December 27, 1971, in Maputo, lost her father when she was four years old and lived with her mother until she was ten. She went on to live with an aunt until she was seventeen. She only studied up to seventh grade, due to family financial difficulties.

In 1993, she married her husband and had a child. In 2007, her husband lost his life. She went to live with her son and three other family members.

She started her business when she was seventeen, selling used clothing. Later she changed her business, going on to sell food items.

The impact of her business activity is important in her family, as it ensures income; and in the community, by supplying groceries, shortening the distance for her neighbors to go shopping.

Through a friend, she heard of the existence of Hluvuku. She solicited a loan of 15,000 meticais for the purchase of a bunch of chickens for resale, and one part for the purchase of chicks for resale as well, strengthening the volume of her business. Her product has been most sought after on weekends and at the end of the month, when there is more demand.

In the future, she would like to have a store where she can stock her products, as she currently delivers to homes. Her loan will go to toward that end.

Translated by Ilse Ackerman, Kiva volunteer

Virgínia João H., nascido aos 27 de Dezembro de 1971 em Maputo perdeu o pai apenas com 4 anos tendo ficado a viver com a mãe até aos 10 anos. Depois foi viver com uma tia até aos 17 anos, estudou apenas até 7ªclasse devido as dificuldades financeiras dos seus progenitores.

Em 1993 junta-se com seu marido com o qual tiveram um filho, em 2007 seu marido perde a vida ficando a viver com seu filho e mais três familiares.

Iniciou o negócio com 17 anos onde começou por vender roupa usada mais tarde mudou de negócio passando a vender géneros alimentícios.

O impacto da sua actividade é notório na sua família uma vez que garante o seu sustento e na comunidade pelo facto de fornecer géneros alimentícios encurtando distância dos seus vizinhos na procura destes.

Através duma amiga mais próxima ficou a saber da existência da Hluvuku tendo solicitado um empréstimo de 15,000.00mt para compra de um lote de frangos para revenda e uma parte na compra de miudezas de frangos para o mesmo fim, o que veio a reforçar o volume do seu negócio. O seu produto tem mais saída nos fins de semana e o nos fins do mês onde a procura é bastante maior.

Futuramente almeja ter uma loja onde poderá colocar os seus produtos uma vez que actualmente faz entregas domiciliarias aos seus clientes e para tal recorrerá ao empréstimo.

loans.use: To increase stock of chickens

loans.name: Sak

texts.en:
Sak S., age 40, is a mother of four children and lives with her husband in Prey Veng, Cambodia. Before she had a small business in Prey Veng, but because of the difficulty and because it made less income she decided to move to Phnom Penh to create another business. Recently, she has become a vendor in a busy market selling eggs, and normally she receives three dollars of profit a day. Her husband is a wedding chef and earns around $2 per day. This couple has four children, one of whom is selling eggs with Ska S., two are students, and the other one is too young to attend school.

She would like to get a loan from Kiva to purchase more eggs to sell in order to expand her business, moreover, to receive more income to support the family.

loans.use: She hopes to use this loan to purchase more eggs to sell.

loans.name: Tamaraneh Group

texts.en:
Gabrilla Thular is the Tamaraneh group leader. Thirty-two years old and married with four children, he owns a grocery shop in the town of Magburaka in Sierra Leone. With his previous loan, he increased his stock. Garbilla now feels strong to access a larger loan and would like to expand the business.

Manuel is a carpenter and would like to buy carpentry tools; Safoa would like to purchase more materials to increase the production of Gara tye dye; Aminata would like to increase her stock of dried fish; and Joseph wants stock for his grocery store. The group is therefore requesting a loan of Le,3,000,000 ($US1,025) for these purposes.

loans.use: To purchase stock of fish, cotton materials and dyes, carpentry tools and drinks.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria, thanks to her work, can offer her children and her family daily nutrition, but more than that, she feels active and useful for her family and helps her partner, she dedicates herself to the production and sale of citrus fruit. Although daily, this activity takes time and care she does it with a lot of optimism, knowing that thanks to this she can continue growing, not only economically, but also as a person. Victoria has many desires to be able to increase her plantation, for this she thinks to acquire more land and different plants to better the variety of her delicious products, as a result she will increase her sales and profits.

Translated from Spanish by Fallon Shields, Kiva Volunteer.

Victoria gracias a su trabajo puede ofrecerles a sus hijos y su familia un alimento diario, pero más que eso, ella se puede sentirse activa y útil para su familia y una ayuda para su pareja, ella se dedica a la producción y venta de frutos cítricos. Aunque diariamente esta actividad toma tiempo y cuidados ella lo ofrece con mucho optimismo, sabiendo que gracias a ello podrá seguir creciendo, no sólo económicamente, sino también como persona.Victoria tiene muchos deseos de poder ampliar sus plantaciones, para ello piensa adquirir otro terreno y adquirir plantas diferentes para aumentar la variedad de sus deliciosos productos, para así incrementar sus ventas y ganancias.

loans.use: To purchase additional lands and other plants to increase her fruit production.

loans.name: Ayoko

texts.fr:
Revendeuse de bouillie et de gâteau depuis 30 ans, K. A. Ayoko est née en 1958 à Aklakou. Elle est mariée et a quatre personnes à charge. C’est une femme dynamique, très dévouée et ayant le sens de l’entreprenariat.

Cependant, elle dispose d’un faible pouvoir d’achat qui ne lui permet pas de répondre  à la forte demande de sa clientèle. Par conséquent, elle ne dégage pas une rentabilité suffisante devant lui permettre de faire face aux diverses charges du ménage.

C’est pour augmenter son pouvoir d’achat afin de maximiser de bénéfice lui permettant d’améliorer les conditions et niveau de vie de son ménage qu’elle sollicite un crédit qui lui servira de fonds de roulement.
texts.en:
A retailer of bouillie, a hot breakfast cereal similar to polenta, and cakes for 30 years, Ayoko K. Oha was born in 1958 in Aklakou. Married and responsible for four people, she is a dynamic and very dedicated woman, with a sense of entrepreneurship. Nevertheless, she contends with poor purchasing power, which prevents her from meeting the high customer demand. Consequently, she does not clear sufficient profit to permit her to meet her various household’s expenses. In order to maximize profits and improve her household’s standard of living, she requests a loan that will provide her with the working capital to increase her purchasing power.

Translated from French by Joyce K., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase and processing of corn into hot breakfast cereal

loans.name: Kin

texts.en: Mrs. Kin C. lives in in Thmei Village in Takeo Province. She is a farmer and her husband, Mr. Oun Yeng, is a silk weaver. His business now is going very well and he has a lot of customers but it is difficult to take his product to his customers. In order to solve this problem, Mrs. Kin C., is asking for a loan to buy a second-hand motorbike for this purpose. Her husband is on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy a second-hand motorbike

loans.name: Bertha Francisca

texts.es: Doña Bertha D. tiene 61 años de edad, es casada, tiene cinco hijos que ya no dependen de ella ya que estan casados, su esposo trabaja en conjunto con ella, su deseo es poder continuar trabajando y salir adelante ahora con un nieto que tiene a su cargo, ya que es su voluntad desear ayudarle ahora en su educacion, Doña Berha, se dedica a la venta de gaseosa, pan, golosina, frutas, ella tiene un triciclo donde comercializa en los diferentes puntos del municipio de malpaisillo, el cual tiene mas de 15 años de ejercer, dando inicio como producto de la necesidad de ayudar con los gastos del hogar ya que su trabajaba como jornaleo y no tenia un ingreso fijo, por  lo que decidio poner su pequeño negocio, que en la actualidad es su unica fuente de ingresos, con el financiamiento pretende invertirle a su negocio especificamente en la compra de materi prima como azucar, frutas, colorantes, entre otros productos, esperando contar con el apoyo nuestro en el mejoramiento de su negocio.
texts.en:
Bertha D. is 61 years old, married and has five children who are out of the home and married. Her husband works with her. Her wish is to be able to continue working and to prosper. She now cares for her grandson, and wishes to help with his education. Bertha sells carbonated beverages, bread, sweets and fruit. For 15 years, using a three-wheeled cart, she has sold at various locations in the town of Malpaisillo. She began this endeavor out of the need to help support the family because her husband worked as a day laborer and did not have a steady income. As a result, she decided to start her small business, which is now their sole source of income. She plans to invest the loan in the business, specifically in the purchase of ingredients like sugar, fruit and coloring, amongst other products. She hopes to have our support in improving her business.

Translated from Spanish by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 35-year-old Magdalena M. from Mwanza. She is married with four children between the ages of eight and 18 years. Magdalena has been running an African clothes business since 2006. She sells traditional clothing worn by Tanzanian women, called kanga and vitenge. The kanga is a piece of printed cotton fabric often with a border along all four sides. It is printed using the silkscreen method with its pattern in frames. Kitenge (the Swahili plural is vitenge) is a cotton fabric with wax print, printed by using rotary printing machines. Kitenge is an expressive textile: the various colors, patterns, writings and symbols represent moods, feelings, cultures, and traditions of native African people. Magdalena works at the business for 12 hours per day, six days per week. Magdalena currently earns about 120 USD from her business. She is requesting a loan of 400 USD in order to purchase more African clothes to resell. Magdalena thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of microcredit in Tanzania. The organization is devoted to the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through microfinance as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets; thus, they are deemed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more clothing for resale

loans.name: Ruth De Jesus

texts.es: La señora Ruth de Jesús Dávila, tiene la edad de 24 años,  habita en el borgoña ubicado en el municipio de Ticuantepe, junto a su esposo, el cual trabaja como jardinero en una casa privada para poder ayudarle con los gastos de la casa, ya que tiene a su cargo a la mamá, ellos todavía no tienen hijos. Los planes hacia un futuro es llegar a establecer el negocio ya que ella trabaja vendiendo ropa en los departamentos de nuestro país. Ella solicita es préstamo para comprar mas ropa y obtener ganancia ya que este mes de Diciembre las ventas son buenas y quiere logra vender en esta temporada para obtener buenas ganancias
texts.en:
Ruth de Jesús Dávila is 24 years old and lives in the Ticuantepe municipality. Her husband works as a gardener at a private home in order to help with the household expenses. As she cares for her mother, they still do not have any children. Her plans for the future are to establish a business, as she sells clothing throughout various areas of our country. She requests this loan to buy clothes so she has more merchandise to sell during this month of December when sales are brisk. She wants to sell a great deal during the holiday season to bring in a good amount of income.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a variety of clothing for adults and children.

loans.name: Mery Angelica

texts.es:
La señorita Mery es socia del Banco Comunal “Dante Nava” de la provincia de Puno, en el departamento de Puno. Tiene 40 años de edad, es soltera  y  madre de 3 hijos. Con su primer  préstamo de S/. 300 compró papelería para su librería  y madera para confeccionar ataúdes  y venderlos en su funeraria. Tiene casi 8 años trabajando con el banco. Mery nos cuenta que compro una capilla ardiente
Con este préstamo de S/. 2000 que pagará en 4 cuotas comprará  madera para almacenar en su taller y más material para su librería.
Mery desea continuar trabajando para comprar un lote y construir su casa propia.
texts.en:
Ms. Mery is a member of the “Dante Nava” microfinance institute in the province and department of Puno. She is a 40-year-old single mother with 3 children. With her first 300.00 PEN loan, she purchased stationery for her bookstore and lumber to make coffins for her funeral parlor. She has been working with the microfinance institute for almost 8 years. Mery states that she purchased a funeral chapel. With this 2,000.00 PEN loan, which will be repaid in 4 monthly installments, she will purchase lumber to store it in her carpenter’s workshop and materials for her bookstore.

Mery wishes to continue working so that she can buy a plot of land and build her own house.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase lumber and materials for her bookstore

loans.name: Sabougnouma Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Sabougnouma (composé de 4 femmes  mariées) ont une moyenne d’âge de 38 ans avec en moyenne 4 enfants. Elles résident dans le quartier  hamdallaye la ville de sikasso.
Elles  vendent des articles différents vente : de condiments, de pomme de terre et d’encens).
Elles collaborent avec  l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso  pour satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. Elles sont à leur troisième prêt solidaire (prêt de groupe).Les prêt précédents ont été correctement remboursés.
Elles comptent utiliser ce prêt pour acheter, 5 paniers de pomme de terre, 2kg de (Mayon ciseni) 5kg de (guenien) plus 2 bouteilles de parfums et 4colis de condiments. Elles s’approvisionnent sur place à Sikasso et environnants (3eme Région administrative du Mali).
Les produits sont vendus en détail, sur commande et  au comptant dans les marchés de la ville de Sikasso (Médine et le grand marché de la ville) et dans les quartiers à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes. 
Elles espèrent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen de 20.000 FCFA par mois qui sera utilisé pour payer les intérêts du prêt, subvenir aux besoins de la famille et investir le reste dans les activités.  
Elles souhaitent continuer leur collaboration avec SORO YIRIWASO, afin de pouvoir devenir chacune d’elle une grossiste et renforcer leur bonne rénommée.
texts.en:
The members of the group Sabougnouma are composed of four married women who average 38 years of age and four children. They reside in the Hamdallaye district of the city of Sikasso and sell different goods: condiments, potatoes, and incense.

To satisfy the needs of their customers, they collaborate with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are on their third solidarity loan (group loan). The preceding ones have been correctly repaid. They plan to use this loan to buy 5 baskets of potatoes, 2 kg of “Mayon ciseni”, 5 kg of “guenien” plus 2 bottles of perfume, and 4 packages of condiments. Supplies are gotten locally in Sikasso (third administrative region of Mali) and in surrounding areas. The goods are sold retail, by special order, and for cash in the marketplace of Sikasso (Médine and the grand marketplace of the city) and in the districts, to customers composed of women and men.

The group members each hope to realize a monthly profit of 20,000 francs CFA that will be used to pay the loan interest, to provide for the family, and to invest the rest in their businesses. They would like to continue their collaboration with SORO YIRIWASO in order to become wholesalers and to strengthen their good reputations.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy condiments, potatoes, incense, and various other goods

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
Ms. G. is 30 years old and not married.  She is a hairdresser and her salon is located in the Kennedy neighborhood of the city of Caacupé.  She has been working as a hairdresser for more than 12 years, and now she has a permanent clientele, made up especially of the area’s civil servants, who always come to her salon to request manicures, pedicures, hair coloring, and hair cuts.
