She says that her greatest achievement was to have located her salon in an area with many people and to equip it with the necessary equipment to provide the services that are in the highest demand.  This enabled her to grow her clientele and make herself well-known in the neighborhood. 

Ms. G. has a related project to augment her business with the purchase of display cabinets where she would be able to sell jewelry and beauty products, among other things. 

With the loans she receives from Fundación Paraguaya she can buy furniture and some accessories for her hair salon.

loans.use: Supplies such as hair dyes, creams, shampoos, and furniture for the salon

loans.name: Guldith

texts.es:
La señorita Guldith N. R., pertenece al Banco Comunal “Nuestra Señora de la Paz”, vive en la Av. Micaela Bastidas Nº 355, Distrito de Tarapoto, Departamento de San Martín. Es Soltera, tiene 41 años y no tiene hijos.

Con el primer préstamo de S/. 500.00 que fue motivada por su familia a sacar el préstamo para aumentar sus productos de abarrotes. Tiene 04 años trabajando con el Banco.

En la actualidad continua con negocio de venta de abarrotes en un ambiente ubicado en su propia casa.

Con el préstamo de S/2,000.00 que cancelará a plazo de 06 meses, lo invertirá en la compra de papel higiénicos, detergentes, galletas, útiles de higiene personal y del hogar en cajas, también  verduras en kilos,  gaseosas en docenas, huevos en javas., para así estar bien abastecida y tener contentos a sus clientes.

Ella; es quien toma las decisiones en las ganancias de su negocio, y en lo personal se muestra mas comunicativa y con muchas ganas de seguir adelante.  
 
Guldith, manifiesta su agradecimiento a Manuela Ramos por permitirle crecer como empresaria y Mujer.
texts.en:
Guldith N. R. is a member of the "Nuestra Señora de la Paz” community bank. She lives in the district of Tarapoto in the department of San Martín. She is 41 years old, single and has no children. Her family encouraged her to borrow her first loan of 500 soles to increase her stock of groceries. She has been working with the bank for four years. She is still running her grocery store business from her own home. She will invest this 2,000 soles loan to be repaid in six months in the bulk purchase of toilet paper, cleaning supplies, cookies, personal hygiene items and home cleaning items, as well as buying vegetables by the kilogram, soft drinks by the dozen and eggs by the crate so that she can be well supplied and satisfy her customers. She makes all the decisions with respect to the income from her business. She has become more outspoken and has a great desire to succeed. Guldith is grateful to Manuela Ramos for allowing her to grow both as an entrepreneur and as a woman.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy toilet paper, detergents, cookies, personal hygiene items and items for the home. To buy vegetables, soft drinks and eggs

loans.name: Matluba

texts.ru: Козибобоева Матлуба 1980 года рождения, замужем имеет 2 детей. Имеет среднее образование. Она  хорошая домохозяйка и портниха. Дома она шьет платья и другие национальные одежды. Кроме этого она дома содержит скот который после откорма подают на рынке. Также коровы которые у них есть дают молоко. Они продают молоко и другие молочные изделия и на рынке. Таким образом у них есть постоянный источник  дохода. Муж и братья  помогают выводить скот на рынок. С поддержкой мужа и Микроинвест она развивает свой бизнес швеи и откорм скота.
texts.en:
Matluba Koziboboeva was born in 1980, is married and has two children. She has a high school education. Matluba is a good homemaker and dressmaker. She sews dresses and other traditional clothing at home. In addition, she raises livestock that is sold at the market after it is fattened. In addition, cows that they own provide milk. They sell milk and other dairy products at the market. This provides them with a constant source of income. Her husband and brothers help her to drive the livestock to market. With the help of her husband and MicroInvest, Matluba is growing her dressmaking and livestock businesses.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of livestock

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en: Adwoa A., a fishmonger, is married with two children. She has sold fried fish at Siwdo since 2004. Her husband is employed as a teacher. She received an education through junior high school.  Adwoa uses her income to pay for her family’s basic needs such as food and also her children’s school fees. Adwoa will use this loan to purchase additional fish for selling. With the increased profits, she will pay for her children’s school fees; thereby securing their education and future.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish for selling

loans.name: Ronal

texts.es: Ronal es un joven muy conciente y trabajador, a sus 19 años vive en un cuarto alquilado y lo que más desea es culminar sus estudios universitarios, para poder sobresalir en la vida. Su juventud no fue un impedimento para que pudiera poner su negocio de llamadas telefónicas, el cual es muy concurrido, ya que está ubicado en un lugar muy céntrico, como es el mercado Laykakota (mercado importante de la ciudad de Puno), cuenta actualmente con 4 cabinas, las cuales le dan los ingresos necesarios para pagar sus estudios. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es que puede aprovechar el internet que utiliza el locutorio, para realizar sus trabajos universitarios e investigar sobre algunos temas. Lleva un año en esta actividad y lo que menos le gusta es tener que permanecer todo el día dentro de su negocio, teniendo que cerrar sólo cuando va a la universidad. Sus anhelos son terminar sus estudios y mejorar su calidad de vida. Este es el primer préstamo de Ronal con MFP y está dispuesto a pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo, en su banco comunal es muy querido, ya que es el más joven del grupo. Con los 1000 soles solicitados planea poner una cabina más, para así mejorar sus ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Ronal is a very conscientious and hard working young man. At the age of 19 he lives in a rented room and what he most desires is to finish his university studies to be able to get ahead in life. His youth was not an impediment for him to open his call center business, which is very busy as it is located in a very central location, the Laykakota market (important market of the city of Puno). He currently has 4 cabins, which gives him the income necessary to pay for his studies. What he most likes about his work is that he can take advantage of the internet that the call center uses to do his university projects and research about some topics. He has been doing this activity for a year and what he likes least is having to remain inside of the business all day long, only closing when he goes to the university. His wishes are to finish his studies and improve his quality of life. This is his first loan with MFP and he is prepared to make all of his payments on time. In his communal bank he is much loved as she is the youngest in the group. With the 1000 soles requested he plans to add another cabin to be able to improve his earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To add a telephone cabin to his business

loans.name: Melita

texts.en:
Melita L. is from the town of Mohon, Aloran. She is 33 years old. Melita is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Melita owns & operates a for-hire motorcycle business.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing transport services to local community members. Melita has been engaged in her business for over one year and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2004, Melita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Melita is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP, which will be used to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. This loan will be the 10th loan taken out by Melita from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair a transport vehicle

loans.name: Awa

texts.fr: Awa N., 37 ans est mariée avec 03 enfants et 02 autres membres de sa famille en charge. Elle s’active dans la vente de sucre et de glaces Ce prêt va lui permettre d’acheter le sucre  pour le revendre et entretenir son activité de vente  de glace.
texts.en:
Awa N., 37, is married with 3 children and two other family members in her care. She works selling sugar and ice. This loan will allow her to buy sugar for resale so she can maintain her business selling ice.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: sale of ice and sugar

loans.name: Sisi

texts.en: Sisi T., 31, is married with 3 children.  She has 2 years of experience in the taxi business.  She provides service to the public 6 days per week.  She has no previous loan(s) with SPBD.  Sisi expects her weekly net cash flow to be 400 Tala (~166 USD).   SPBD loans are Sisi’s only access to capital because she is not able to qualify for a loan from traditional banks.

loans.use: Purchase car parts and a spare battery.

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en: Sophia is 30 years old. She is a married woman with two children. Currently all her kids are in school. She sells frozen foods like chicken, mutton, fish, meat, etc. in the local market where she lives. She travels to Kumasi to purchase her stock of goods from the big cold-storage houses. She makes sure she buys only what she can afford, which mostly is not enough. She does not have adequate funds to support her business. This has affected her operation, especially in the face of increasing food prices. With the loan, she wants to purchase more cartons of frozen foods, like fish, chicken, pork, and meat, to enable her to raise enough income to expand her sales. It is her dream to give her children a better education.

loans.use: To buy cartons of frozen foods, like fish, chicken, mutton, etc.

loans.name: Katarina

texts.en:
Katarina S.'s main source of income comes from providing cargo transport services to local community members (0). She is a 39-year-old woman living in the town of Vaitele K Fou. She is married and has three school-age children. Katarina has been engaged in this business for over one year and earns approximately 800 WST a month.

In 2009, Katarina joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve  her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities.  Katarina is requesting a loan for the first time from SPBD. Katarina is requesting a loan of 1,000 WST which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. Katarina plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business.

About SPBD:
SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide service

loans.name: Ganu

texts.en:
Mrs. Ganu C. is a grocery shopkeeper in the village of Bhaishipati. She started her grocery store two years ago to strengthen the economic condition of her family. She sells different types of grocery goods such as rice, maize, snacks, etc. in her shop.

Due to the lack of money she cannot expand her business and attract more customers. To solve this problem, she is requesting a loan of Rs 30,000 to expand her business.

Mrs. C. lives in a single family home with her husband and two children. Her husband, Mr. Raghunath, works is an electrician. They have one son and one daughter and both children are now studying.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to sell

loans.name: Carmen Rosa

texts.es:
La señora Carmen Rosa es socia del Banco Comunal “Señor de la Caña”  que esta ubicado de el distrito de Plateria, Provincia de Puno, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 34 años de edad, estado civil casada y es madre de 02 hijos y tiene estudios de primaria completa, vive en la comunidad de la Rinconada.

La señora trabaja con el movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 01 año,  con un préstamo inicial de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles  para la compra de lanas para elaboración de artesanías. 

En este momento ella solicito un préstamo de S/. 500.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra de ganado menor ovinos para engorde, la Sra. Carmen Rosa también se ayuda elaborando artesanías a palitos.

Su mayor sueño es poner una tienda grande de abarrotes.

A ella le gustan las capacitaciones.
texts.en:
Ms. Carmen Rosa C. is a member of the “Señor de la Caña” Communal Bank, located in the Plateria district of the Puno province, department of Puno. She is a 34-year-old married mother with 2 children. She lives in the Rinconada community and has a high school diploma. Ms. C. has been working with the Manuela Ramos movement for a year. She used her initial 500.00 PEN loan to purchase wool to make her handicrafts. At this time, she is requesting a 500.00 PEN loan to purchase sheep to raise for meat. Carmen Rosa also earns a little extra money by making stick handicrafts. Her biggest dream is to set up her own general store. She likes the training offered by her microfinance institute.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sheep

loans.name: Phum

texts.en: Phum C. is a widow with four children children. She resides in Battambong Province Province. To make a living, she works as a construction worker everywhere in the province, typically earning US $2.5 per day which is the primary source of income for the family. One of her children is also a construction worker with his mother to assist the family. Both of them try to work hard everyday to ensure a good living for the family. She is asking for a loan of US $150 to buy construction implements for her child to improve his business. (She is pictured while she is preparing lunch for her children)

loans.use: buy suppliments for the contruction

loans.name: Khudoyor

texts.en:
S. Khudoyor was born in 1966 in Kumsangir district, where he now works as a farmer. He is married and has 4 children. His main business is agriculture, which provides him with the means to meet the needs of his family. Khudoyor owns a large piece of land where he cultivates different kinds of vegetables but due to the poor quality of the soil and the insects, he is no longer able to satisfy market demand. Very hard-working, he is asking for a loan of $2000 USD to buy seed, mineral fertilizer, fuels and lubricants . The loan will greatly improve Khudoyor’s income and his family's living standards. Khudoyor expresses his gratitude to everyone for supporting him and promises to repay the loan in time.      


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing seed, mineral fertilizer, fuels and lubricants

loans.name: Munkhzul

texts.en:
J. is 34 years old and lives with his wife and three children in the Khovd province of western Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. His two older children attend a local secondary school, and his youngest child goes to kindergarten.

J.’s wife helps him with their meat retail business. He began his business in 2006 and since then, he has stabilized his operation and gained a lot of experience. He hopes to keep his business stable and grow it in the future so that he can afford to improve his family’s quality of life. He is requesting a loan of 600,000 tugrug (~420 USD) in order to purchase livestock for his business.

loans.use: To purchase livestock for his business

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is 43 years old and married with three children between the ages of 6 and 15 years old. He runs a green grocery in Machakos, a busy market town near Nairobi. He sells paw paws, bananas, and tomatoes. He also sells fruit at the Nursery Tree in Nairobi for extra income. He is requesting a loan for Kes. 30,000 to purchase mangoes and packing crates and to pay for transport between Machakos and Nairobi. He describes himself as a hardworking man and hopes to be able to expand sales into other nearby towns and supply his fruits to large hotels.

loans.use: To purchase mangoes and packing crates and to pay for transport

loans.name: Mumina

texts.en: Mumina is 22 years old and married to Abdikadir Godana. She has operated her retail shop in Naivasha town for the last two years. Mumina was introduced to KADET by her friend and this will be her second loan. She repaid her first loan well. She plans to use the cash from this loan to add more dry foodstuffs in bulk to her shop's stock (sugar, wheat, maize flour and rice) in preparation for the festive season which will see demand for these dry foodstuffs go up. Mumina hopes to open a supermarket in the future to serve the clients from her area who currently have to travel long distances to get to one. About KADET: The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to improve the living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To add dry foodstuffs in bulk

loans.name: Oussama

texts.en:
Oussama is 49 years old and lives in Saida, Southern Lebanon, with his wife and their six children. Since 2007, Oussama has owned a grocery store selling candies, canned food, home cleaning products, juice, and other products. Oussama's business is speciA. because he offers a wide range of products to his clients who are his friends and neighbors. When he began his business, he had financiA. challenges purchasing and expanding his merchandise. Oussama decided to pursue his business because he wanted to have independent work. In the future, he plans to keep improving his store. 

He is requesting a loan from A. Majmoua to purchase merchandise for his store. This is the first time that Oussama has requested a loan from A. Majmoua.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for his store

loans.name: María Fátima

texts.es:
La señora María Q. se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras tales como papaya, sandia, y cebolla entre otras verduras ofrecidas en el mercado el mayoreo en Managua.
Ella tiene 17 años de trabajar en este tipo de negocio ante que iniciara este negocio ella era trabajadora domesticas y opto por iniciar en esta actividad.
Su núcleo familiar es de un hijo en conjunto con su conyugue.
Ella solicita un crédito a ceprodel para la compra de frutas tales como sandia, papaya, cebolla y plátanos con el objetivo de aumentar su inventario y por ende aumentar sus ganancias.
Ella actualmente lleva 3 crédito con ceprodel el cual le ayudado para solventar sus necesidades y generar su capital de trabajo.
texts.en:
María Q. sells fruits and vegetables like papayas, watermelons, and onions, among other vegetables. She sells at the wholesale market in Managua. She has worked for 17 years in this type of business. Before starting this business she worked as a domestic employee, but she decided to start this activity. Her family consists of one child and her life partner. She is asking Ceprodel for a loan to buy fruits like watermelons, papayas, onions, and bananas to increase her inventory in order to increase her earnings. She currently has three loans with Ceprodel. They have helped her pay for her necessities and generate working capital.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy watermelons, papayas, onions, and bananas

loans.name: Him

texts.en:
Mr. Him H. is a villager in Thmei village in Takeo province, and he is 26 years old. He is a farmer who owns a piece of land where he grows rice to make a living.

His wife, Mrs. Sorn Ton, is a silk weaver. In her weaving business, she faces a problem because she does not have enough silk to weave. Thus, Mr. Him H. decided to ask for a loan for purchasing additional silk for his wife's business. 

He is the father of three children, one of whom is enrolled in the local public school, while the other two are too young to go to school or work. His wife is shown on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To purchase additional silk for his wife's business.

loans.name: Joséphine

texts.fr: H. Joséphine est née en 1968 à Porto-Novo, capitale administrative du Bénin. Joséphine est mariée à HOUNGUEVOU Michel, un chauffeur, et est mère de cinq enfants, dont trois sont encore à sa charge. Tous les enfants sont scolarisés. Joséphine vit depuis une dizaine d’année à PK 10 dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji, avec sa famille. Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la famille. Joséphine n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Pour se prendre en charge et assurer les charges qui lui reviennent, Joséphine mène comme activité, la vente de fruits au parc MIVVO à Sèmè-Podji. Joséphine vend également du maïs, ce qui lui permet d’avoir plusieurs sources de revenus. C’est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, et aussi à Adja au Mono, que Joséphine s’approvisionne. Joséphine exerce cette activité depuis 8 années et a déjà bénéficié de trois crédits auprès de ALIDé. Joséphine a bien remboursé tous ces crédits. Très sollicitée par ses clients, Joséphine ambitionne renforcer son activité et agrandir son étalage afin de faire face à la demande sans cesse croissante. C’est la raison pour laquelle Joséphine sollicite un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Joséphine H. was born in 1968 in Porto-Novo, the administrative capital of Benin. She's married to Michel HOUNGUEVOU, a driver, and she's the mother of five children, and she has to support three of them. All her children attend school. For about ten years, Joséphine has been living with her family in PK 10, in Sèmè-Podji. The couple supports the family expenses together. Joséphine never attended school. To provide for herself, she sells fruits at the MIVVO park in Sèmè-Podji. She also sells corn, which enables her to benefit from several income sources. She gets her supplies in Dantokpa, an international marketplace in Benin, as well as in Adja, in Mono Department, Benin. Joséphine has been running this business for eight years, and already benefited from three loans from Kiva's partner, ALIDé. She repaid these loans without problems. She's in high demand, and ambitions to bolster her business and expand her stall in order to meet an ever-increasing customer demand. This is why she's seeking a fourth loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and resell fruits (bananas, oranges, etc.) and corn

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en: Hassan is a 36-year-old man who lives in Tyre, southern Lebanon with his wife and their two children. Hassan has owned and operated a mobile phone store for almost two years. He sells new and used mobile phones and accessories like covers, chargers, earphones, and more. He decided on doing his business because of his experience in sales and mobile phones, since he used to work in a mobile shop before. When he first started, he had some financial issues because opening a mobile phone shop requires a lot of money to buy his merchandise. For the first time, he has requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise and new mobile devices. Hassan’s clients are mainly people from his region. In the future, he plans to improve his work by starting to repair mobile phones.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise and new mobile devices.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John L. is a businessman who sells shoes. He started this business in 2009 after quitting his previous job as a bar tender. He is twenty-five years old and still single. He is determined to make his life a success.
 
John buys his stock in Uganda twice a month, and he would like to increase the amount of stock he can sell. That is why he is requesting a loan worth KSH 20,000. He hopes the loan will enable him to expand his business so that he can one day own a house.

loans.use: To increase his stock of shoes for sale.

loans.name: Belinda's Group

texts.en:
Belinda M.'s main source of income comes from butchering and selling a variety of meats in her community. She is 40 years old, married and has four school-aged children. They are from the village of Dugayong, Amulung, Cagayan. Belinda is just starting this business.

In 2010, Belinda joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Belinda is requesting a loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her first loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue to pay the tuition fees of her children. 

Belinda is the leader of a five member group accessing a loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members, if someone is delinquent or defaults.

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Women In Power Group

texts.en:
For 3 years, Beatrice D. has been selling fish at the Thinker’s Village Market in Paynesville, Liberia. She is 57 years old, married and has seven children. She did not have the opportunity to go to school due to financial problems.

Beatrice sells quality fish which keeps customers returning. She plans to use her 8,000 Liberian dollar (LRD) portion of this 38,000 Liberian dollar group loan to purchase more fish to improve her business.  She dreams of building a house and sending her children to school.

Beatrice is the leader of this group of five borrowers called "Women In Power". In the photo that accompanies this profile, Beatrice is the one holding the sign.

About LEAP:
The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating microfinance institution with 13 branches across the country. Founded in 1994, this non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship. LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs and puts emphasis on lending to women.

Join Team LEAP - Liberia lending team on Kiva today: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=10019

loans.use: To purchase more fish

loans.name: Moudjanatou

texts.fr: Cette dame a appris la couture, comme cette activité ne marchait pas pour elle, elle s’est lancée dans le commerce des produits d’alimentation générale, sa clientèle est constituée de toutes  personnes, son stock de marchandises a baissé, elle voudrait reconstituer son stock c’est pour cette raison qu’elle sollicite un crédit pour l’achat des cartons de spaghetti, 4 boîtes de  tomates en boîtes de conserve, divers détergents et divers produits d’alimentation générale.
texts.en:
This is a women who learned tailoring.  Since this business wasn't doing well for her, she got started in the commerce of grocery items.  Hers customer base is composed of all people.  With the drop in her inventory, she would like to replenish it.  This is why she's requesting a loan for buying some boxes of spaghetti, four boxes of canned tomatoes, different detergents, and a variety of grocery items.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying grocery items to sell

loans.name: Ofelia's Group

texts.en:
Ofelia S. is from the village of Brgy. Bitnong, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya. She is the group leader of a 10-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Ofelia is 47 years old, married, and has 7 school-aged children. To make a living Ofelia raises pigs for fattening and sale. Ofelia has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Ofelia joined ASKI to improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from ASKI which she used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future.

Ofelia is requesting her third loan, for 12000 PHP, which she will use to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve her family’s general living conditions.

About ASKI

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Northeastern and Central areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

Note

To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies.

loans.name: Chanthy

texts.en:
Mrs. Chanthy B., age 31, and her husband, Mr. Chanra Khem, age 39, have been married since 1993. They have four children, two sons and two daughters. One of their children works in a garment factory, two attend school, and another one is still very young. The family lives along National Road Number five about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. 

Chanthy and her husband are farmers who grow vegetables and mushrooms. She does not have enough capital to purchase seed, fertilizer and pesticides to maintain her vegetable and mushroom farm, so she is asking for a loan of $1,000 to supplement her capital.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies

loans.name: Gemeniano

texts.en:
Gemeniano L. is from the village of Poblacion, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. He is 54 years old, is married, and has five adult children. Gemeniano owns and operates a business providing motorcycle services to local community members. He has been engaged in his business for over thirty years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Gemeniano joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase materials needed to provide service. Gemeniano is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to expand services provided. This loan will be his fifth from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to expand services provided

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr: Madame Fatou  F.  est une femme divorcée  ayant en charge 2 enfants dont l’âge  varie entre 20 et 26 ans. Elle est âgée  de 44 ans et a adhéré  à la caisse de Bambilor depuis septembre 2009. Elle évolue  depuis 5 ans dans le secteur du commerce et s’active dans l’achat et la vente d’huile. C’est après  avoir abandonne les études  qu’elle s’est oriente dans ce commerce. Ce qui l’y intéresse c’est son aspect lucratif grâce auquel elle parvient à satisfaire ses besoins vitaux. Le prêt de 300 000 frs qu’elle sollicite sera destine a l’achat de 18 bidons d’huile de 20 litres chacun. L’accroissement  de ses bénéfices  pourra l’aider a gérer  les frais de scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Ms. Fatou F. is a divorced woman in charge of two children, whose ages range from 20 to 26 years. She is 44 years old and joined the Bambilor group fund in September 2009. She has been involved in the business sector for 5 years and is engaged in buying and selling oil. She started her business after having abandoned her studies. What interests her about business is the income it generates, thanks to which she is able to provide for herself. This loan of 300,000 frs that she is seeking will be used to buy 18 cans of oil, each containing 20 litres. The increase in her profits will help her manage the costs of educating her children.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase rice, canned goods and cooking oil

loans.name: Bokk Xalaat Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité BOKK XALAAT est créé depuis deux ans. Il est composé de 11 femmes issues toutes du même village. Elle se sont organisées et constituées par voisinage et par affinité et partagent la même idéologie. 

Madame Aminata C., debout à l'extrême droite de la photo est responsable du groupe de solidarité. Elle est âgée de 58ans. Elle est mariée sans enfants mais a la charge de 03 enfants adoptés. 

Elle fait un petit commerce. Elle est détentrice d'une table à domicile où elle vend des beignets, des jus de fruits naturels, des balais traditionnels, des arachides etc.

Son prêt lui permettra d'acheter en quantité suffisante la marchandise énumérée ci-dessus. 

Son objectif est de construire une cantine et faire l'extension de son activité de petit commerce tout en renforçant son niveau d'épargne.
texts.en:
The Bokk Xalaat solidarity group was created two years ago. There are 11 women in the group, who are all from the same village. They decided to organize themselves because they lived close to each other, had the same interests and shared the same ideology. Mrs. Aminata C., standing at the extreme right of the photo, is the leader of the solidarity group. She is 58 years old and is married. She has no children of her own, but she is raising 3 adopted children. Mrs. C. runs a small business. She sells fritters, natural fruit juices, traditional brooms, peanuts, etc. from her home. The loan will allow her to buy stocks of these for her business. Her goal is to grow her business and build a canteen while putting aside some money for savings.

Translated from French by Eileen Jessop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies and expand her small business

loans.name: Khursheed's Group

texts.en:
Khursheed is a resident of Multan, which is the fourth largest city in Pakistan. She is a housewife and spends her time at home doing her household chores. Khursheed’s husband operates a rice-selling business. 

She is the mother of six children. Unfortunately none of them is literate. All four of her sons are working: her eldest son operates a donkey cart; the second son takes orders for handkerchiefs from different shops; the third son has a vehicle tire shop; and the youngest son does embroidery work.  Her daughters help her with the domestic chores. 

Khursheed has applied for a loan from Asasah for her eldest son who wants to buy his own donkey cart instead of renting one.  This is her first loan from any MFI. She hopes that this investment will prove successful for her son and he will be able to increase his income by improving his business.

loans.use: Purchase a new donkey cart

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a 48-year-old gentleman married to Esther. They have eight children, who all go to school. 

Peter was introduced to Kadet by existing members and this will be his second loan. He plans to purchase additional cattle for resale at a profit. Peter has been in the cattle-selling business for the last 20 years and likes the business since he makes good profit from it.

His future plan is to expand his business and move to other towns to sell his cattle, hence making more profit to sustain his family.

loans.use: To buy cattle for resale

loans.name: Constantino

texts.es: Constantino vive en la zona Huacallia, Provincia  Aroma, del Departamento La Paz, junto a su   esposa y sus hijos  los cuales se encuentran en edad escolar. Se dedica a la cría de ganado vacuno cuya producción de leche la vende a Pil Andina (Planta industrializadota  de leche). El crédito será destinado a la compra de ganado vacuno. Es su primer  crédito en Impro y el primero vía Kiva.
texts.en:
Constantino lives in the zone of Huacallia, province of Aroma, department of La Paz. He lives with his wife and their children who are school age. He works raising cows that produce milk that he sells to Pil Andina (an industrial milk plant). This loan will be for buying more cattle. This is he first loan with Impro and his first time on Kiva.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Fanning, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: C2351 Twiyubake Group

texts.en:
Jacqueline is 30 years old and married with four children who are between 3 and 11 years old.  Jacqueline is the leader of the group called Twiyubake and this group is commonly known for selling cooked food in a restaurant. In addition to that, some of these group members sell clothes in the center of that area.  It is after doing their business that they sit together and realize their income in general.  Jacqueline and her team have been in this business for about three years and the business hours are from 5 am to 8 pm every day.

Jacqueline and her team are requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company.  With this loan, this team will expand its business by purchasing different styles of clothes to sell and equipment to be used in the restaurant to increase the quantity of food they cook as their customers increase.  If successful, Jacqueline and her team will hopefully earn more profits, which in turn will allow her to keep reinvesting for better financial stability. In addition to that, they will continue improving the their families' lifestyle.

loans.use: To purchase more styles of clothes

loans.name: Marlenny Esther

texts.es:
Marlenny es madre soltera, tiene 31 años y vive junto a su hijo en el distrito pesquero de San José, una zona que pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y se encuentra ubicada a más de veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace dos años a la preparación y venta de alimentos en un local ubicado estratégicamente en una de las principales calles de su distrito. Por las mañanas vende ceviche y por las noches vende comidas rápidas en un carrito sanguchero. Sus negocios tienen mucha acogida en la zona debido al buen trato que ofrece a sus clientes y a la buena sazón con la que prepara sus platos. Con los ingresos que percibe de estos negocios ella se encarga de sacar adelante a su menor hijo.

Marlenny desea adquirir algunos insumos con los cuales pueda ampliar la producción de su negocio. Ello le permitirá aumentar sus ventas y percibir mayores ganancias. Para lograr su objetivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.

Marlenny es una mujer luchadora y que ha sabido salir adelante sola. Las personas que le conocen le consideran una mujer tranquila y bastante luchadora.
texts.en:
Marlenny is a 31 year old single mother who lives with her son in the fishing district of San José, an area which belongs to the province of Lambayeque, over twenty minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

She has prepared and sold food from a store which is strategically located in one of the main streets of the district. In the mornings she sells ceviche and at night she sells fast food from a hot dog stand. Her businesses are warmly welcomed in the district because of the good service she provides and her flair for cooking. She uses the income that she makes from these businesses to raise her youngest son.

Marlenny would like to purchase some supplies to increase her production and, in turn, increase her sales and her earnings. To achieve this objective she has decided to apply to Edpyme Alternativa for the first time for a loan of 2000 nuevos soles.

Marlenny has a great fighting spirit and knows how to get ahead alone. The people who know her consider her to be a peaceful and courageous woman.

loans.use: Purchase of supplies to increase production

loans.name: Adidjatou

texts.fr: A. Adidjatou est née le 15 Septembre 1963. C’est une veuve qui n’a pas d’enfant. Depuis près de sept ans, Adidjatou vit donc seule au quartier Sènadé à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Adidjatou arrive à faire face à ses différents besoins, grâce au revenu que lui procure son activité. Adidjatou n’a jamais fréquenté l’école. Il y a une vingtaine d’année que Adidjatou mène comme activité la vente de divers produits de soins (savons de toilette et de lessive) à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. C’est également dans le même marché que Adidjatou achète ses produits. Adidjatou a déjà obtenu un crédit auprès de ALIDé et a bien effectué le remboursement. Face à la demande de plus en plus grandissante de sa clientèle, Adidjatou désire augmenter son fonds de roulement et élever le niveau de son activité afin de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle. C'est la raison pour laquelle Adidjatou sollicite pour la deuxième fois l'appui financier de ALIDé.
texts.en: Adidjatou A. was born on 15 September 1963. She is a widow and has no children. For close to seven years, Adidjatou has thus lived alone in the Sènadé area of Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Adidjatou is able to meet her various needs thanks to the income provided by her business. She never went to school. For about twenty years, Adidjatou has run a business selling various toiletry products (soaps and detergents) at Dantokpa, the international market in Benin. She buys her goods at the same market. Adidjatou has already obtained one previous loan through ALIDÉ (one of Kiva's field partners) and was able to repay it properly. Faced with the growing demands of her clientele, Adidjatou wants to increase her working capital and raise the level of her business in order to better respond to the needs of her customers. This is the reason why Adidjatou, for the second time, is seeking financial support through ALIDÉ.

loans.use: To buy boxes of soap and detergent

loans.name: San Antonio De San Roque Group

texts.es:
La Banca Comunal “San Antonio de San Roque” iniciará su  primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, en el Centro Focal de Panamericana.  Está compuesta por nueve integrantes, ocho mujeres y un varón.  Los negocios que ellas desempeñan son variados: venta y elaboración de pan, venta de chocolates y dulces, tienda de barrio, elaboración de  mantas, inicio de negocio, confección de chamarras, macramé de mantas, y tejidos, hilado de lana de vicuña y tejido a crochet, macramé de mantas.

 En el caso de la presidenta, señora Damiana está casada, es madre de tres hijos dos mujeres y un varón, indica que  cuenta con el negocio de tejido y venta de aguayos (el aguayo es un tejido en forma cuadrada de aproximadamente un metro por lado, son utilizados para cargar a los bebés a la espalda u otros.).  Ella aprendió este oficio de su madre hace más de veinte años atrás. La señora Damiana indica que los aguayos que ella elabora son muy apreciados por que están hechos de lana natural, son resistentes, mantienen el calor de lo que estuvieran  envolviendo, podría ser un bebé.
La elaboración de los aguayos se efectúa en el domicilio y generalmente son elaborados a pedido.  El dinero que la señora Damiana está solicitando le servirá para comprar lana.
texts.en:
The “San Antonio de San Roque” community bank is beginning its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer in the Panamericana regional office.  The group has nine members, eight women and one man.  The businesses which its members run are varied: making and selling bread, selling chocolates and pastries, neighborhood store, making blankets, starting a new business, making jackets, blanket macramé, knitting, spinning vicuña wool and crocheting.

In the case of the group president Damiana, she is married and has three grown-up children, two girls and a boy.  She tells us that she has a knitting business where she sells 'aguayos' (an 'aguayo' is a square-shaped knitted cloth which is approximately one meter long on each side.  It is used to carry babies or other things on your back).  She learned this trade from her mother more than twenty years ago.  Damiana tells us that the 'aguayos' which she makes are very much admired because they are made from natural wool, they are hard-wearing, they keep in the heat of whatever they are wrapped around, perhaps a baby.  She makes her 'aguayos' in her home and they are generally made to order.  The money which Damiana is requesting will be used to buy wool.

loans.use: To buy wool

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida T., 51, is making sure that her family has enough for their daily needs. Married to Ramon T., a butcher, they find comfort in their children. She makes sure that she helps her husband earn enough for their three children who still live with them, so that they can have a better life. She has been managing her variety store while operating a food vending business as well.

Zenaida has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year now. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship* meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow quite a few times in CCT’s Cooperative. She is consistent in paying her dues because she uses the money she borrows to expand and improve her businesses. 

To help her continue operation of her businesses, she would like to apply for a PHP40,000 loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital for her expanding business by buying groceries, toiletries and beverages for her variety store. She will also use some of the loan to purchase more raw ingredients for her food vending business.

She dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she can leave a successful business as a legacy to them.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her food vending business and additional stock for her variety store.

loans.name: Isaiah

texts.en:
Isaiah O. is 35 years old and from the Kondele area of Kisumu. He is married to Juliet, and together they have three children: Daniel (12), Venesa (7), and Sydney (2).

Isaiah has been selling second-hand clothes for ten years. He is applying for his first loan from Kadet Ltd. after being introduced by a friend who had benefited from a Kadet loan. Isaiah intends to use the money to buy more bales of clothes to add to his stock. The profits made from his business will be used to support his family and pay school fees for his children.

He hopes to see his business grow and educate his children to the university level.

loans.use: To purchase bales of clothes to add to his stock.

loans.name: Griselda Margarita

texts.es: Griselda Margarita M. D. A. D. 32 años D. edad, resiD. en Perulapía en el departamento D. Cuscatlán. Ella vive junto a su esposo y tres hijos D. 9, 7 y 1 año D. edad. Griselda posee una tienda en la cual venD. productos D. primera necesidad para el hogar y para las personas tales como: jabón, shampoo, pan, leche, golosinas, y otros productos más los cuales son básicos en este tipo D. negocios. Ella cuenta con muy buenas referencias por parte D. sus vecinos y amigos, ya que tanto Griselda como su esposo son personas muy trabajadoras, las cuales se dedican por completo al bienestar D. su hogar. Griselda solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda surtir su negocio con todo lo necesario para aumentar su inventario y D. esta manera ofrecer más productos a sus clientes y así mejorar sus ganancias y poder salir adelante junto a su familia.
texts.en: Griselda Margarita M. D. A. is 32 years old.  She lives in Perulapía, in Cuscatlán department.  She lives with her husband and three children aged 9, 7 and 1 year old.  Griselda owns a store in which she sells convenience store items such as: soap, shampoo, bread, milk, candy and other products which are basic in this kind of business.  She has very good references from her neighbors and friends since both Griselda and her husband are very hard-working people who are totally committed to the well-being of their household.  Griselda is requesting a loan so that she can stock her business with everything she needs to increase her inventory, offer more products to her customers, improve her profits and thereby get her family ahead.

loans.use: To buy essentials

loans.name: Juana Nilda

texts.en: Juana Nilda belongs to the “Virgen Asunta de Oropesa” cooperative bank, which is located in the Oropesa district of the province of Quispicanchi in the deparment of Cusco, Peru. She is 42 years old, a widow with two children. She buys and sells construction materials to municipalities and is requesting the loan to purchase more construction materials to sell.  She is also an elementary school teacher. She is very happy with the loan granted, and commits to making her payments within the established time frame.

loans.use: Invest in her construction materials business

loans.name: Imelda's Group

texts.en:
Imelda C. is from the village of Victoria. She is 42 years old. Imelda is the group leader of a 7-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Imelda C.'s Group.

Imelda is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Imelda owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting & harvesting  a variety of vegetables for sale. Imelda has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Imelda joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Imelda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 13,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. Imelda is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Imelda from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Leonor Angelica

texts.es:
La señora Leonor es socia del banco comunal Mujeres Del 2000, del Distrito D. calleria, departamento D. Ucayali. Tiene 64 años D. edad y tiene 3 hijos mayores
La señora Leonor  lleva 1 año trabajando con los préstamos D. Manuela Ramos, que le ha servido para poder comprar algunos productos para surtir su negocio.
La señora Leonor tiene una bodega pequeña pero bien surtida D. productos comestibles, se dedica por completo a su negocio porque también es una mujer que vive sola.
Su nuevo préstamo D. S/. 1,000.00 nuevos soles lo invertirá totalmente en implementar mas el negocio comprando: una pequeña vitrina D. vidrio, 2 cajas D. galletas rellenitas, 1 caja D. chocolate, 1 caja D. lentejitas, 3 bolsas D. caramelos, 1 bolsa D. tofi, 2 cajas D. chicle, 1 caja D. chocolate sapito, 1 paquete D. wafer.
La señora Leonor está trabajando porque hacerlo es parte D. su vida y también porque lo necesita para sentirse bien con ella misma, agradece a Manuela Ramos porque ha pensado en las mujeres y sus necesidades.
texts.en:
Mrs. Leonor is a member of the "Mujeres del 2000" communal bank in the district of Calleria in the department of Ocayali.  She is 64 years old and has three adult children.

Mrs. Leonor has been working with loans from Manuela Ramos for a year.  She has used the loans to supply her business.  She has a small store that she keeps stocked with different food products.  This is a full-time job for her since she lives alone.

She plans to use the new loan for 1,000 PEN to buy more items for her business such as a small glass showcase, 2 packages of filled cookies, 1 box of chocolates, 1 box of chocolate drops, 3 bags of caramels, 1 bag of tofi, 2 bags of chewing gum, 1 box of little frog chocolate and 1 package of wafers.

Mrs. Leonor says working is part of her life and she wants to feel good about herself.  She is grateful to Manuela Ramos for helping women in need.

loans.use: To buy a glass showcase, 2 packages of cookies, 1 box of chocolates, 1 box of chocolate drops, 3 bags of caramels, 1 bag of tofi, 2 boxes of chewing gum, 1 box of little frog chocolate, 1 package of wafers

loans.name: Juana De Dios

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “CAPAC QOYA”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito D. Qoya, provincia D. Calca, Departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra: Juana; La socia tiene 73 años D. edad, la socia  es viuda; la socia trabaja en el mercado D. Coya vendiendo productos D. chuño, papa, moraya, carne y verduras. La socia tiene unos terrenos D. cultivos que al día D. hoy se encargan D. cultivar sus hijos que ya son independientes, ella sigue con su stand en el mercado atendiéndolo diario y abasteciéndolo, La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos secos y aumentar sus ventas.

La socia está feliz con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Señora Juana is 73 years old, a widow and a member of the communal bank "CAPAC QOYA".  The bank is located in the Qoya district in the province of Calca and the department of Cusco.  She works in the Coya market selling potatos, chuño and moraya (Peruvian potatoes), meat and vegetables that she grows on a piece of farmland.  She attends to and stocks her stand in the market daily.  She also has children that are now independent.

She is requesting a loan to purchase dried products and increase her sales.  She is happy with the loan granted and is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: To purchase dried products to increase her sales

loans.name: Lovette Kinnie's Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is pleased to present to you this group of teachers from one of the primary schools in Blama, a town in eastern Sierra Leone.   

The teachers of this school have come to SMT for a loan of SLL 5,600,000 in order to improve on their standards of living. Some of them will use this loan to buy house building materials, some to buy pieces of furniture, others to pay school fees for their children, and so on.  At the end of each month, the school’s bursar is directly responsible for deducting their repayment amount to repay SMT.   This is the first loan that this group has applied for from SMT/Kiva lenders. 

Lovette Kinnie B. is the leader of this group of teachers. Lovette is 45 years old and was born in Bialargo in southern Sierra Leone. She is a teacher and has been in the teaching profession for the past 32 years. Lovette is married to a farmer and they have 3 children -- 2 of whom are attending secondary school and 1 is no longer attending school. Lovette will use her share of the loan to pay school fees for her children and invest the remainder in her fried cake business. She will buy frying oil and flour in large quantity in order to produce a larger number of cakes for sale.

loans.use: Pay school fees for her children and use the remainder of the loan in her fried cake business

loans.name: Mariama  K

texts.en: This is 34 year-old Mariama.  She is married and has four children. In 2005, Mariama established her grocery. She began her business because she wants to fight poverty and to help her husband in providing a livelihood for the family. Mariama opens her business every day except on Sundays. Mariama has a good loan repayment history. She needs a loan of 4,000,000 Sierra Leonean leones (SLL). Mariama requires a loan in order to buy more foodstuffs. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy grocery store inventory

loans.name: Elmer Antonio

texts.es:
Elmer de 36 años de edad, reside en San Miguel, tiene un taller de enderezado y pintura, vive con su esposa y un hijo de 3 años de edad, dependen económicamente de él.
Elmer tiene el negocio ubicado en su casa de habitación, trabaja todos los días sin tener un horario fijo, pero realmente depende de la demanda de trabajos que tenga para así dedicarle el tiempo necesario, su ventaja es que no existe otro taller cerca del lugar.
El solicita un préstamo para comprar pinturas y una pulidora, esta será una gran ayuda para el desempeño de su trabajo, brindado un mejor servicio a los clientes. Para Elmer este financiamiento es el inicio hasta lograr ampliar el taller y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Elmer, 36, lives in San Miguel.  He has an Auto Detailing shop.  He lives with his wife and 3 year old son who depend on him economically.

Elmer’s business is home-based.  He works every day without a fixed schedule.  He works according to the jobs he has pending dedicating whatever time is necessary to them.  His advantage is that there are no other shops near the place.

He is asking for a loan to buy paint and a polisher.  This will be of great help to his work; he will be able to provide better service to his customers.  For Elmer, this loan is the beginning of an expansion of his workshop in order to improve his family’s quality of life

loans.use: to buy paint and a polisher.

loans.name: Cherity

texts.en: Cherity K. 40 years old and she is currently in a business of selling fruits and vegetables. She is married to a soldier and they have six children, only one of whom is not going to school. Her future goal is to open a shop from her profits.

loans.use: to stock more fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Rusomoka

texts.en:
Rusomoka is 42 years old and is married with five children, plus eight children he takes care of.  He works selling food from 7am to 9pm every day. He has been in this business for 2 years. 

Rusomoka has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company to buy a large quantity of products such as rice, sugar, beans, etc. to sell.  With this loan, Rusomoka will be able to earn more, which will allow him to reinvest in his business, pay school fees for his children, and renovate his house.

loans.use: To purchase a large quantity of products such as rice, sugar, beans, etc. to sell.

loans.name: El Pozito De Atotonilco Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama "El Pozito de Atotonilco", ya que en ese lugar hay un pequeño parque y hay agua que brota, esta ubicado en el Estado de México, el grupo esta conformado por 11 integrantes, la señora Minerva es integrante del grupo, tiene 42 años, estudio solo hasta la secundaria, ella se dedica al comercio ya que tiene una tienda de abarrotes, actualmente solo mantiene a un hijo de 20 años. Solicito el prestamo para comprar un poco de mercancia para tener mejor surtida su tienda y ofrecer mayor cantidad de productos a sus clientes que principalmente son de la misma localidad, comenta que el servicio que brinda y la disponibilidad le han permitido captar una mayor cantidad de clientes. Al momento de solicitar el credito se siente contenta ya que ha trabajando de la manera adecuada y sin contratiempos, al invertir en su negocio ella espera obtener un mayor ingreso que le permita seguir comprando mas productos, el esfuerzo y dedicacion es la base que tiene para seguir creciendo junto con su negocio. Con las ganancias que obtenga desea ahorrar para brindarle una carrera profesional a su hijo y una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: This group is called "The Small Atotonilco Well," since it is located in a small park with a well. It is located in the state of Mexico and formed by 11 members. Mrs. Minerva is a member, is 42 years old, studied up to junior high school, and sells items in a grocery store. At the moment she is just raising a 20 year old son.  She is requesting the loan to supply her grocery store with more merchandise to offer clients from her area. She comments that the service she offers and her availability have allowed her have a large number of clients. At the moment she feels confident in requesting the loan since she has worked properly and without any setbacks. By investing in her business she hopes to make the highest amount of profits possible to continue restocking. The effort and dedication are the foundation she has to continue growing with her business. She plans to save up the profits she makes to help her son get a career and have a higher standard of living.

loans.use: buy merchandise for her grocery store.

loans.name: Santos

texts.es:
Santos, vive con hijo de 39 años, dos nietos, ella se dedica  a la venta de tortillas, tamales, comida típica, la tortillería la tiene desde hace 20 años, estos negocio son su fuente de ingreso para el sustento diario, atiende de 9:00am a 6:00pm.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de maíz, gas, pollo, condimentos, frijol, arroz y queso, esto para producir los productos a los clientes, esto le ayudara para tener todo lo necesario y poder dar abasto a la demanda.
Para Santos el objetivo es tener un negocio fuerte, libre de deudas y tener salud para poder trabajar por un buen tiempo más.
texts.en:
Santos lives with her 39 year-old son and two grandchildren.  Her business is selling tortillas, tamales, traditional food.  She has owned her tortilla bakery for 20 years.  This business is the source of income with which she supports her family.  She works from 9.00am to 6.00pm.

Santos is requesting a loan to buy corn, gas, chicken, condiments, beans, rice and cheese so that she can make her products for her customers.  This will help her to have available everything that she needs and she will be able to meet demand.

Santos' goal is to have a strong business, free of debts, and to enjoy good health so that she can keep on working for a good time yet.

loans.use: to buy corn, gas, chicken, condiments, beans, rice and cheese

loans.name: Im

texts.en:
Im, age 63, is married and resides in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She is a rice farmer, earning an income of $1 per day to help cover the family expenses. 

The family is also assisted by one of her children, who is a garment factory worker, earning an income of $5 per day. 

Im is requesting a loan of $1,200 to pay for her son’s administration fee to work in South Korea. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a partner of Kiva.

loans.use: to pay for her son's administration fee to work in South Korea.

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.en:
Jacinta has been selling ladies' clothes for the last three years. She is a 24-year-old hard-working businesswoman.  She is a single mother of a six-year-old. 

In the next five years, she hopes to open another business in the town centre.  She is grateful to Faulu Kenya for empowering her financially. She hopes that one day, she will be financially stable.  She wants a 50,000 Kenyan shilling loan to buy more clothes.

loans.use: To buy clothes.

loans.name: Nhen

texts.en: Nhen, 59 year old, is a grocery seller. Her income is $3 per day. She is a single mother with two children. Both of the children are working with $2 per day income for each of them.  Every month she has to spend $50 on food, $15 on transportation, and $20 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $1,000 to buy a motorbike with a cart attached for her son to transport coconuts to sell to make more income. Before, she sold cake but this career couldn't make a good income in all seasons so she needed to change to another career that could make an income in all seasons. She wants to sell more grocery goods and buy more coconuts for son to sell because this career can make a good profit.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike with a cart attached for her son's career

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles, 32, is a hardworking and creative business man. He is married and blessed with three school-going children aged two and a half, seven and 14. For the past four years, he has been engaged in the transport business with a taxi to make ends meet. He supplements his income with earnings he makes from childcare, a general shop and vending water. Previously, he used to sell electronics and milk. In the next five years, he wants to have a big retail shop serving the region where he is based and to enlarge his childcare capacity.

Charles is requesting a loan of 40,000 Kenyan shillings to buy sugar, maize flour, soap, heaters, coils, bulbs, potatoes, kale and tomatoes. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, he has developed a culture of saving and has become a good time manager.

loans.use: to buy sugar, maize flour, soap, heaters, coils, bulbs, potatoes, kale and tomatoes.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.en:
Maria Elena is 39 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married. 
Maria Elena has a retail shop that sells used clothing like t-shirts & blouses. She has had this business for 3 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy stocks of used clothing for sale.
Maria Elena is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Maria Elena hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of used clothing for sale

loans.name: Josphat

texts.en:
Josphat has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last eight years.  He is 37 years old, married to Lucy and they have two school-going children.  

He was introduced to KADET Ltd. by one of our field officers and this will be his second loan.  He paid his previous loan of 40,000 KES well and in good time.  He plans to use the loan amount to buy two bulls and four sheep which he will rear and sell later.

In future, Josphat hopes to become one of the leading farmers in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: to buy two bulls and four sheep

loans.name: Messan

texts.fr:
Messan est une femme  âgée de 32 ans. Elle est mariée un déclarant en douane. Elle a 1 enfant de 2 ans scolarisé. 
Messan travaille comme revendeuse depuis 2004. Elle vend des produits cosmétiques à toutes les personnes à la boutique. Elle achète les produits au grand marché de Lomé. Elle travaille  avec 01 employé. Sa difficulté principale est la concurrence rude sur le marché. 
Messan a requis son  premier crédit à WAGES afin d’acheter et vendre les produits cométiques. Elle veut étendre son activité. 
Dans les prochaines années, Messan voudrait diversifier l’activité. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, Elle prévoit  améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Messan, age 32, is married to a customs agent. She has one two-year-old child who attends school. She's been working as a reseller since 2004. She sells cosmetics to anyone in her shop. She gets her supplies at the Grand Market in Lomé and works with one employee. Her major difficulty is the stiff market competition.

Messan is seeking her first loan from Kiva's partner, WAGES, in order to buy and sell cosmetics. She wants to bolster her business and diversify it in the forthcoming years. She says that with her profits, she intends to improve the living standard of her family.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics

loans.name: Ivan

texts.en:
Ivan wants a loan to mulch his banana plantation. He is a Ugandan male aged 33, living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He is a banana grower and he started with an acre of banana plantings, and now has five acres.

The responsibility to look after the family rests on him, and his dream is to buy a pickup to transport his matooke (green bananas) and educating his children.

loans.use: to mulch his banana plantation

loans.name: Samson

texts.en:
Samson is 51 years old, married, and a father of three children ages 25, 21,and 19. He runs a butcher shop and has been in this business for 23 years with a monthly income of KES. 20,000.

He has applied for a loan of KES. 60,000 to purchase goats and sheep for slaughter. He plans to use the anticipated profit from the business to buy more stock.

This is his third loan after successfully paying back his previous loans. His dreams and hopes are to continue with his business and to educate his children.

loans.use: To buy goats and sheep for slaughter

loans.name: Roscon

texts.en:
Roscon is 29 years old and single. He has owned and managed a rice-farming business for almost five years. He usually earns a profit of P20,000 in every harvest season. He aims to increase his yield and income to satisfy his needs and save for his future. He says he needs to be well-prepared before he gets married because nowadays life is very difficult. 

Due to financial difficulty, he is asking for a loan of P10,000 to buy fertilizers and pesticides, and pay labor costs required in planting rice. He is hoping that he will increase his yield and income this coming harvest season.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides, and pay labor costs required in planting rice.

loans.name: Rios De Agua Viva Group

texts.es:
El grupo Rios de Agua Viva está conformado por cuatro personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es Socorro  de 36 años quien se dedica al comercio de ropa desde hace 2 años con unos ahorro luego empezó a prestar y el negocio fue creciendo. Ella es casada y tiene seis hijos de los cuales solo los menores están a su cargo de 11, 5 y 2 años de edad respectivamente. 
Los otros integrantes son Carla Patricia de 27 años se dedica a la venta de frijoles y maíz hace 2 años, Bertha Lourdes de 40 años comercializa huevo, pan, gaseosas y helados y María Antonia de 31 años compra y vende res.
texts.en:
The “Ríos de Agua Viva” group is composed of four hardworking, enterprising people.  One of them is Socorro, 36, who has been a clothes merchant for two years.  She started the business using some of her savings and then started taking out loans and the business grew.  She’s married and has six children but only the youngest ones who are 11, 5 and 2 years old are still in her care.

The other group members are Carla Patricia, 27, who has been selling beans and corn for the last two years, Bertha Lourdes, 40, who sells eggs, bread, soft-drinks and ice-cream and María Antonia, 31, who is a beef merchant.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Micahel

texts.en:
Micahel is 64 years old and married with seven children. He runs a cafeteria to earn a living.  He has been in the business for 10 years and has employed three people.  He also owns rental houses, which earn him extra income.  Previously, he was selling cereals for a living.
Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has improved his business because he has been trained on business management skills. Micahel has requested 80,000 Kenya shillings to start a business selling kerosene. Therefore, he wants to buy a kerosene pump.

loans.use: To buy a kerosene pump

loans.name: Juboo Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe  Juboo du Banc Villageois de a été crée depuis son inauguration .Il est composé de 15 femmes issues d'un même village et d'un meme groupement. Elles se sont organisées en groupe par affinité et par voisinage .
l'activité principal pratiquée dans cette localité reste le commerce de céréales.
Madame Sophie responsable du  groupe debout à droite de la photo est une femme mariée , mère de 6 enfants, et âgée de 42 ans.
Elle fait partie des membres fondatrices du Banc villageois, elle pratique le commerce de détails dans la vente de céréales , une activité qu elle maîtrise pour l'avoir pratiqué depuis longtemps au niveau du petit marché de son village.
Avec son nouveau crédit elle va acheter 5 sacs de mil 4 sacs d'arachides et 3 sacs de mais qu elle va revendre.
Ses bénéfices lui permettront d'appuyer son mari dans la gestion de la famille en achetant du riz de l'huile et des ordonnances pour ses enfants en cas de maladie.
texts.en:
The Juboo group was created at the inauguration of the Banc Villageois it belongs to. The group is composed of 15 women living in the same village and   in the same neighborhood. They are friends and neighbors who have formed a group together. The main business activity in this area is selling cereals.
Mrs. Sophie, the group’s leader, standing to the far right in the photo and raising her hand, is married and the mother of six children. She is 42 years old. She is one of the founding members of Banc Villageois. She retails cereals,  a business she masters well, having had a long experience in selling at the small market of her village. With her new loan, she will purchase five bags of millet, four bags of peanuts [ground nuts] and three bags of corn, which she will resell.
Her revenues allow her to help her husband support their family, paying for rice and vegetable oil as well as  medications when her children are ill.

loans.use: to buy cereals for resale in her village

loans.name: Maria Theresa

texts.en:
Maria Theresa is 41-years-old and lives in Poblacion 1, Clarin,Misamis Occidental. She is married with 3 children. 

Maria Theresa has a business that sells a variety of dried fish. She has had this business for 6 years. She requested a loan of PHP 50,000  to purchase a variety of dried fish.

Maria Theresa has been a member of PMPC for 2 years. In the future, Maria Theresa hopes to expand business to nearby localities.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of dried fish.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is a married woman with two children. She lives in the town of Trinidad, Bohol with her family. Elsa's husband works as a carpenter.

Elsa has had a sari-sari (variety) store business for three years. She sells coffee, soap, soft drinks, and other various items. Elsa works hard to improve her business. She requested a loan to buy more items to sell such as soft drinks, noodles, and canned goods. Elsa plans to venture into another kind of business in the future.

loans.use: To buy more items to sell such as soft drinks, noodles, and canned goods.

loans.name: Umed

texts.ru: Умед проживает в районе Джиликул. Возраст, 25 лет. Женат. У него двое детей. Его дети маленькие. Он занимается выращиванием зернобобовых культур. Этим видом деятельности занимается два года. Кредит берет для закупа минеральных удобрений для посева пшеницы.
texts.en: Umed lives in the Djilikul area. He is 25 years old, married and has two young children. He is engaged in the cultivation of crops. He has been involved in this type of activity for two years. He is taking a loan in order to buy mineral fertilizers for sowing wheat.

loans.use: to purchase of mineral fertilizers for sowing wheat

loans.name: Jesudjro 5 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe JESUDJRO 5 est composé de trois personnes qui sont issues de la même famille. C'est la cinquième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Lucie Adodo est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Lucie Adodo est âgée de 53 ans et vit au Bénin. Lucie Adodo n’a pas fréquenté l’école.
