Lucie Adodo est une veuve et est mère de huit enfants dont un reste à sa charge. Lucie Adodo vit seule avec son enfant à charge. Afin d'assurer ses diverses charges et ceux de son enfant, Lucie Adodo vend depuis vingt ans, divers articles (du savon, du biscuit et du lait) à son domicile.De façon secondaire, Lucie Adodo vend de la farine de manioc et du haricot. Lucie Adodo s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Lucie Adodo sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe JESUDJRO 5, un cinquième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les quatre premiers prêts ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The JESUDJRO 5 Group consists of three people who are part of the same family.  This is the fifth time that this group is seeking a loan from Alidé, so as to improve the standard of their business.  The representative of the group, named Lucie Adodo is the one with the raised hand in the photo.  Lucie Adodo is 53 years old and lives in Benin.

Lucie Adodo has not attended school.  Lucie Adodo is a widow and is the mother of eight children, one of which is still a dependent.  Lucie Adodo lives alone with the one child in her care.  In order to take care of her various responsibilities and those of her child, Lucie Adodo has for twenty years sold various products (soap, biscuits, and milk) at her home.  Secondly, Lucie Adodo sells beans and cassava flour.

Lucie Adodo stocks up at the market in Benin.  In order to better ensure customer satisfaction as well as to increase her turnover and profits, Lucie Adodo is requesting a loan along with the other members of the JESUDJRO 5 Group, their fifth loan from Alidé. The four previous loans were all repaid properly.

loans.use: to purchase cartons of soap, biscuits, and milk.

loans.name: Elizabeta

texts.en: Elizabeta is 26 years old, married, and has one child, aged two years. She does tailoring to earn a living and has been in the business for five years. Her other source of income is from her husband. Since Elizabeta joined Faulu Kenya she has been able to save her income. She hopes to own a boutique in the future. She has applied for 10,000 Kenyan Shillings to buy clothing material.

loans.use: To buy clothing material.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is 64 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Zenaida has a retail shop that sells beauty products & clothing like dresses, blouses & shirts. She has had this business for 20 years. She requested a loan for 14,000 PHP to buy stocks of clothing to sell.

Zenaida has been a member of HSPFI since 2007.  In the future, Zenaida hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of clothing to sell.

loans.name: Rashid

texts.en: This is 33-year-old Rashid.  He is married with 2 children, ages 8 and 5.  He has 3 additional dependents that live with him (his wife and two sales assistants).  In 2004, Rashid established his provisions business to assist his family.  His business is located at the center of town and he primarily serves business customers.  Working 7 days a week and 16 hours a day, he earns about Le 1,300,000 every month.  He would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000 in order to buy additional mayonnaise, biscuits, and butter.  He hopes that this loan will help him to expand his business.  In the future, Rashid plans to build a house, to educate his kids, and to perform Hajj.  He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy false hair and jewelry.

loans.name: Andressa

texts.en: In the wear 2010 Andressa, 18 years old, came, with your family, from “Miracatu”, small town, to Sorocaba São Paulo looking for better opportunities in your life and work conditions. In 2013 she married and was living in a little rented house with your mother-in-law. Nowadays, she’s study, but, she does not have work, is unemployed. For this reason she decided to create your business for help from your family and your dreams. She has one important dream: through the business buy the family home. Andressa need a loan of R$ 500,00 for acquire raw for make chocolate sweet-stuff and candies for sell to neighbors, family and friends. She appreciates the help of all.

loans.use: To buy pans, chocolate, wrapping filling for the bonbon

loans.name: Nyarukoni Farmers Association Group

texts.en:
Pauline is a forty year old married man with seven children living in kyenjojo Uganda. He is a member of a Nyarukoni Farmers Association where members have a dream of educating their children to attain a degree as minimum qualification and they guarantee one another in order to acquire a loan. For twenty years he has been working in the agricultural sector and the proceeds have enabled him to pay school fees for his children. He has challenges of price fluctuations. In the future he wants to be a specialized commercial farmer. 

Pauline needs the loan to buy maize for planting.

loans.use: to buy maize for planting.

loans.name: Lilit

texts.en:
Lilit has been engaged in farming business for already 5 years. 
She lives in Sisian town with her husband and two little daughters, 5 and 3 years old. 
With the help of her husband, Lilit keeps a livestock of cows, calves, sheep and piglets. In the family's own land, Lilit also cultivates potato, cabbage, walnut, apple and pear, which her husband sells at the local markets. Both Lilit and her husband are hard working and enthusiastic farmers with the goal to develop their farming business and provide better living condition to their children. 
The requested loan will help Lilit to purchase 4 oxen and forage for feeding the livestock and she hopes to receive lenders support.

loans.use: to pay for 4 oxen and forage for feeding the livestock

loans.name: Grace Filda

texts.en:
Grace is an active member of Life in Africa. She joined through the Acholi Quarter Satelite Center. She moved to Kampala from the Gulu in the North to escape the war but she does not live in the quarters. However, she went there each day to work in the rock quarry. This was very hard on her since she had no money for transport and this forced her to walk 3 kms each way. She earned barely enough money to survive on but she had no choice since the survival of her family depended on what she could earn. Many days they had no food and they lived under the constant threat from the landlord of being thrown out of their home.

Grace's move to Kampala also has another reason. While still in the North, Grace and her husband had divorced and she was left with her eight children to fend for themselves.

Life in Africa has given Grace and her family new hope. The association with others and the sharing of knowledge and skills has given Grace the idea and desire to start a business. School fees for eight children is almost impossible and she worries, especially about the older girls. Her plan is to open a maize flour shop near her home. She has a 25 year old daughter who will work the shop. I talked to the daughter is she is very excited. It will not only give her work to do but she is happy that she will be earning money to help her mother and perhaps help pay school fees for her siblings. For this project Grace is seeking a loan in the amount of 800,000. She will be able to repay this loan in 12 months.

Below is her budget in full:

1- Maize 10 bags @ 50,000/= --------------------- 500,000/=

2- Grinding 10 bags @ 6,000/= --------- 60,000/=

3 - Rent for 3 months @ 50,000/= --------- 150,000/=

4- Transport --------------------------------------- 90,000/=

TOTAL -------------------------------- 800,000/=

Grace plans that with all she will save, she can send all her children back to school.

Grace's loan has been reviewed and guaranteed by her community of peers at the Life in Africa WE Center in Kampala. She has designated the 25% community impact portion of the interest on her loan to support Educational opportunities for LiA member children. For more about Grace, her life and her worldview visit http://lifeinafrica.com/4/gracefA.

loans.use: Buying and grinding the maize

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys has a small store where she sells convenience products. She started her business with her husband’s help; he gave her 200 dollars to set herself up in business with the store. In the beginning she only sold vegetables and staples; now she also sells sausages and canned goods.

Gladys would use the loan to buy rice and canned goods wholesale in order to earn more profit.

She has every confidence that with these new products her business will grow. Gladys is the mother of 2 children and married her husband 20 years ago. She is 47 years old. Gladys is convinced that with this loan she will improve her family’s economic situation.

Translated by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Gladys tiene una pequeña tienda donde vende productos de primera necesidad. Gladys empezó su negocio con la ayuda de su esposo quien le dio 200 dólares para que emprendiera en la tienda. Al principio ella solo vendía víveres y legumbres, ahora vende embutidos y enlatados. Gladys usara el préstamo para comprar arroz al por mayor y enlatados para así obtener mejores ingresos. Ella tiene la plena seguridad que con estos nuevos productos su negocio va ha tener un crecimiento. Gladys es madre de dos hijos, unida con su esposo hace 20 años. Ella tiene 47 años. Gladys esta convencida que con este préstamo mejorara el nivel económico de su familia.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Buy rice and canned products

loans.name: Ab.satar

texts.en: Ab.Satar is a property dealer who has 6 years' experience within this field. His main business is finding houses to rent and sell to the people who want them. Afterwards, he completes the documentation work between the borrowers and owners. He wants a loan to renew and buy furniture for his shop.

loans.use: Buying furniture

loans.name: Nishana

texts.en:
Nishana was born in 1952 in Shakarli village, Salyan region. She is a mother of 5 children and is a widow. She has been in this business for 10 years. She provides for her children by selling milk, cheese, and cream. Nishana wishes to increase her income to support her children and offer them a better future.
This business is the only source of income for her and her family. Now she needs a loan of $950 to buy a calf and grass to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy a calf and grass

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en: Mrs. Caroline O. is a Yoruba by tribe, but she stays in Uromi town in Edo State.  She is married with 4 children, and is a fashion designer.  She learned this business for 3 years.  She has also been in this business for 7 years.  She is requesting the above loan to enable her to buy more material to sell.

loans.use: To buy more material to sell

loans.name: Betty

texts.es:
Betty is an unselfish mother who is dedicated to the upkeep of her home. For more than two years she has had a little snack shop located in the school in which her two children attend. It makes her feel good to attend to the teachers and students in a cheerful and warm manner. She maintains this cheerfulness in her daily duties so that she can forget the sadness that she's felt since her husband left to work in Junín (Peru).

This is the reality for many families who don’t have the resources necessary to enable them to live. They end up having to find work far away from their home and families in order to earn a living. In spite of living with this pain, she continues to give her best in her snack shop. She has now also opened a store in her home that sells products made by local artisans. This helps her generate additional income to sustain her family. In order to strengthen the older business (the snack shop) she is asking for a loan of $175. With this amount, she will be able to finish implementing her little school snack shop and will be able to help her husband with expenses when he comes back home. Let’s help this family so that they can be reunited very soon and enjoy once again the love and support that occurs when a family is together.

Translated from Spanish by Kim Baker, Kiva volunteer.

Betty es una madre abnegada y dedicada a las labores de su hogar y a la pequeña cafetería que aperturó en el centro educativo al que asisten sus dos hijos y donde ya trabaja más de 2 años. Se siente muy a gusto atendiendo a los docentes y alumnos con mucha alegría y cordialidad, ésta alegría que mantiene a diario en su desempeño hace que olvide la tristeza que lleva desde que su esposo se fue a trabajar a Junín.Ésta es la realidad de muchas familias que no tienen recursos para poder subsistir y tienen que buscar un trabajo en el cual desempeñarse lejos de sus familias con tal de generar ingresos económicos para que en su hogar haya un pan diario.A pesar de vivir con esta pena no deja de dar lo mejor de si en su cafetería y ahora también en su nueva tienda de productos artesanales que inauguró en las instalaciones de su pequeña vivienda con el propósito de generar un ingreso adicional para la sostenibilidad de su familia.Para la consolidación del negocio más antiguo solicita una suma de 175 dólares con esta cantidad podrá terminar de implementar su pequeña cafetería escolar y apoyará a su esposo con los gastos a fin de que retorne pronto a su morada.Colaboremos para que esta familia se reúna muy pronto y gocen del amor de sus miembros.

loans.use: Finish setting up school snack shop

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en:
Theresa C. is 23 years old. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She sells rechargeable cards to make calls. This is a business she started in 2004.

Theresa is requesting a loan of $800 so that can buy more cards to sell.

loans.use: To buy more recharge cards to sell

loans.name: Marco Antonio

texts.es:
Don Marcos started his business 9 years ago, as a street vendor, traveling to Honduras to buy merchandise such as clothes, shoes, and household items. His business is set up on a table where he places his products for their sale outside of the Cathedral of Leon.

His initial capital was C$2,000.00, a product of his termination from his previous job. His business is now established in a corner of the Cathedral of Leon.

With Ceprodel's support, he managed to increase his working capital, because he is a person invested in his family, which is currently going through the process of educating and raising two young children.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

Don Marcos inició su negocio hace 9 años de manera ambulante, viajando a Honduras para comprar mercadería tales como ropa, calzados y algunos enseres para el hogar. Su negocio lo tiene establecido en una mesa donde coloca sus productos para su respectiva venta a orillas de la Iglesia Catedral de León.

Su capital inicial fue de C$2.000.00 producto de una liquidación de su trabajo anterior, teniendo establecido actualmente su negocio en la esquina de la iglesia de la Catedral de León.

Con el apoyo de Ceprodel logró incrementar su capital de trabajo ya que es una persona comprometida con su familia que está en el proceso de educación y desarrollo por tener 2 niños menores de edad.

loans.use: Buying merchandise (Compra de mercaderia)

loans.name: Akayi

texts.fr:
Aged 35, Madame Akayi A. is married and mother of three children. She is well-known in her village because of her small business selling general food products. Unfortunately, her expenses are greater than her income and so she is unable to maintain a decent stock of goods. Her customers are very demanding and she is unable to satisfy them in time. In order to establish customer loyalty, she is requesting a loan of $250 to increase her stock of food products to meet market demand. This will allow Madame A. to increase her revenue and better provide for her family’s essential needs.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, Kiva volunteer.

Agée de 35 ans, Madame A. Akayi est mariée et mère de trois (3) enfants. Grâce à son petit commerce de produits d’alimentation générale, elle est reconnue dans son village de résidence. Mais il faut noter que ses charges financières dépassent son revenu et elle n’arrive pas à installer un étalage digne de nom. Pourtant, sa clientèle est très exigeante et elle n’arrive pas à la satisfaire à temps. Afin de pouvoir fidéliser cette clientèle, elle sollicite un financement de $250 pour augmenter sa provision en produit d’alimentaire et satisfaire la demande du marché. Ceci lui permettra d’accroître son chiffre d’affaire et mieux subvenir aux besoins vitaux de sa famille.

loans.use: To purcahse food products

loans.name: Ines' Group

texts.en:
Ines and Elsa are members of the “Virgen del Rosario” community bank . They have been members for five and two years respectively. In their community bank, they have learned to save, manage their businesses efficiently, and to be punctual and responsible.

Ines is 48 years old. She is married and has five children, three of whom live with her. Ines sells vegetables from a cart located on one of the main corners of Huanta. She has been in this line of business for several years.

Elsa is 50 years old. She is single and has two children who live with her. Elsa sells a variety of fruits grown in the region of Ayacucho. These include peaches, avocados, and tuna, which is a type of cactus fruit. She buys her fruit from local farmers and then transports it to the market.

Ines and Elsa need loans of 600 and 750 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will invest in buying rice, soap, eggs, detergent, milk, celery, carrots, and avocado.

One of the most important aspects of the community bank is the interest-earning savings account that each associate has. Ines and Elsa feel secure having savings they can use in the case of an emergency. Their dreams are to have a large business, own a home, have good health, and that their children will be professionals.

loans.use: Ines and Elsa need loans of 600 and 750 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will invest in buying rice, soap, eggs, detergent, milk, celery, carrots, and avocado.

loans.name: Mohamad Dahlan

texts.id:
Mohamad Dahlan is a gasoline reseller. Assisted by his wife, he opens a small stall (warung) for the place to sell gasoline. He can sell up to 250 liter of gasoline per day.

He gets the gasoline from the distributor by paying IDR 2,700 per liter (around USD 0.3). He then sells it for IDR 3,000 per liter (around USD 0.33) where he can earn IDR 300/ liter profit from it.

As it is difficult to get gasoline recently (because of the scarcity), he wants to add up the stock level so he can at least have some continuity in selling the gasoline. However this of course requires a lot of money. Therefore he hopes that he can get the loan money to funding this plan.

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva Volunteer.

Mohamad Dahlan memiliki usaha sebagai penjual minyak tanah untuk mencukupi kebutuhan keluarganya, dengan di bantu istrinya mereka melakukan aktifitas tersebut di sebuah warung yang mereka miliki. Setiap hari Dahlan mampu menjual minyak tanah sekitar 250 liter, minyak yang dijualnya didapatkan dari agen minyak tanah dengan harga 2.700 rupiah/liter dan dijual dengan harga 3.000 rupiah/liter, jadi Dahlan mengambil keuntungan 300 rupiah/liternya. Karena minyak tanah sekarang susah di dapat Dahlan berencana untuk menambah stock minyak tanah yang tentunya membutuhkan modal yang tidak sedikit, dan dengan modal tersebut harapan Dahlan untuk mendapatkan keuntungan lebih banyak dapat tercapai untuk mencukupi kebutuhan keluarga.

loans.use: To add up his gasoline stock level (Modal untuk menambah stock Minyak Tanah)

loans.name: Ulviya

texts.en:
Ulviya is a sharp young entrepreneur who owns her own small clothing sales business. She started her business about two years ago and currently has an excellent sales location at the large and busy Central market in Simferopol, Ukraine. Ulviya sells a variety of women’s clothing with modern styles at reasonable prices. She would like to expand her business in the future and eventually purchase her own small kiosk to work from. Ulviya is not married and lives with her parents and two brothers. One day her business may allow her to purchase her own place to live.

Ulviya has requested a loan to help purchase additional clothing inventory. This is her first loan from Nadiya Ukraine. We look forward to many more opportunities to assist her financially and help her reach her goals.

loans.use: Ulviya would like to purchase additional clothing inventory for her business.

loans.name: Meng

texts.en:
Meng Y. is 56-years-old. Since 1990, she has run a small business making and selling small Khmer cakes. These cakes are made from a mix of mashed rice and coconut, injected with varied flavors. These are extremely popular country-wide. She earns three dollars per day selling her baked goods.

Her husband, Pen Yap, helps support the family as a motor-taxi driver earning $1.50 per day. They have seven children. Five of these children are already married and have started their own households. However, two remain single and live with their parents.

Since she is still raising children, Meng Y. would like to take out a loan to add onto her house. She also uses the kitchen in the house as her bakery for her business. The balance of her loan will go towards buying good wood to burn, creating the heat for baking her cakes.

loans.use: To enlarge the house and buy wood to use for baking.

loans.name: Justino Cipriano

texts.es:
Justino P. washes cars in the city of Chinandega. This business is located right in his home. He's visited by clients on a daily basis, these client's whishes are to improve the looks of their cars or motorcycles. This is where Justino washes them and leaves them looking neat and free of dirt.

It's important to point out that this is Justino's ONLY income. He supports his wife and two children. He's currently waiting for Ceprodel to approve the loan in order to buy a pressure washer and this way clean cars in a more efficient way.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Peterson, Kiva Volunteer.

La labor a la que se dedica el señor Justino P. en el municipio de Somotillo en la ciudad de Chinandega es al lavado de vehículos el cual atiende en su establecimiento ubicado en su casa de habitación. A diario es visitado por clientes cuyo propósito es mejorar la apariencia de su vehiculo o moto, es allí donde el señor Justino lava los vehículos dejándolos nítidos y sin ninguna suciedad.

Es necesario destacar que este negocio es el único sustento para su hogar compuesto por su esposa y dos hijos. Actualmente espera en que Ceprodel le otorgará el crédito para comprar una bomba de presión y de esta manera llevar el proceso del lavado del móvil de una manera mas eficiente.

loans.use: Purchase of pressure washer

loans.name: Aquiles

texts.es:
Aquiles and his wife support themselves and their children by working in farming and animal husbandry. They grow potatoes and corn in their farm and sell milk and cheese produced by their cows.

They plan to purchase another cow so that they can sell more milk and cheese in markets in the surrounding towns. They hope to fulfil their plan with your help.

Translated from Spanish by MuseAndThinker, Kiva Volunteer

Aquiles es un hombre dedicado a la crianza de animales y a la agricultura, actividad que le ayudó a solventar los gastos en su hogar y sobre todo en la alimentación de sus hijos. Gracias a la crianza de vacas, puede dedicarse a la venta de leche y quesos junto con a su esposa, igualmente se dedica al cultivo de productos agrícolas tales como la papa y el maíz. Estas vacas le han traído muchas satisfacciones, por ello que desea adquirir una más con la cual puedan incrementar la cantidad queso y leche. Esta pareja de esposos se está preparando para vender sus productos no sólo en su ciudad, sino también en los mercados de las ciudades aledañas a la suya. Ellos esperan por su ayuda para que sus deseos de ampliar su mercado prospere.

loans.use: Purchase of an additional cow to increase sales of milk and cheese

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Né à Tsévié en 1964, madame Afi S. a très tôt abandonné ses études pour se lancer dans la vente des céréales pour mieux subvenir à ses besoins. Mariée à un sieur et mère de sept (07) enfants, c’est une femme valide, travailleuse qui maîtrise bien le stockage des céréales. Pour cela, elle sollicite un crédit pour faire le stockage des céréales pour augmenter ses activités et ainsi son revenu pour lui permettre de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Born in Tsévié in 1964, Mrs. Afi S. left her studies at a young age to begin selling cereals so as to earn her own living. Married and the mother of 7 children, she is a sensible, hard-working woman who is very knowledgeable at storing cereals. For that reason, she is requesting a loan to use to stock up on cereals and expand her business and thus her earnings so that she can support her family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: stocking and selling cereals

loans.name: Celestine Dossi

texts.fr: Mariée à monsieur ZOCLANCLOUNON Bertin commerçant à Cotonou, dame F. Celestine Dossi est née le 11 Février 1962 à Adjohoun dans le département de l'OUEME au BENIN. Vivant avec son mari à PK10 dans la commune de SEME-PODJI, elle vend du ciment qu'elle achète à la SOCIETE DES CIMENTS DU BENIN SCB). Compte tenu de la cherté actuelle du ciment, de la rareté de ce produit et de l'écoulement rapide de sa marchandise, Dame F. Celestine Dossi  aimerait avoir un soutien financier pour l'approvisionnement. Elle a fait recours à ALIDé à travers un prêt pour atteindre son objectif.
texts.en:
Married to Mr. Bertin ZOCLANCLOUNON, a merchant in Cotonou, Ms. Celestine Dossi F. was born on February 11, 1962 in Adjohoun, in the county of OUEME in BENIN. Living with her husband in PK10 in the SEME-PODJI community, she sells cement that she buys at the SOCIETE DES CIMENTS DU BENIN SCB. Due to the current high cost of cement, its rarity, and the rapid turnover of her merchandise, Ms. Celestine Dossi F. would like to have financial support for her inventory. She has turned to Alidé for a loan to achieve her goal.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy six metric tons of cement

loans.name: Isolina

texts.es:
La señora Isolina pertenece al Banco Comunal. “Las Cucardas II”, vive en la Región y provincia San Martín, distrito de La Banda de Shilcayo. Se dedica a la elaboración y venta de espejos y cuadros, así como también chicha de maíz y chupetes. El negocio está ubicado en su casa en la Urb. Las Flores Mz C–Lt 13  del A.A.H.H. Las Flores de la Molina, lugar donde espera a sus clientes y algunas veces tiene que salir a entregar los pedidos que le hacen. 

Con este crédito de S/. 800, el cual será cancelado en 6 meses, comprará materiales para la elaboración de los espejos como varillas, limas, cintas entre otros, también comprará maíz, azúcar en saco, canela y clavo de olor, bolsitas para chupetes y frutas para la preparación de la chicha y chupetes, los cuales son muy requeridos por sus clientes.

La señora Isolina  tiene 45 años de edad, vive con su esposo y uno de sus hijos que aún depende de ella. Es una mujer decidida, alegre y buena administradora. Tiene como meta arreglar su casa para poder ampliar y surtir su negocio para atender a sus clientes con mucha comodidad.
texts.en:
Señora Isolina belongs to Las Cucardas ll Communal Bank. She lives in the La Banda de Shilcayo district, in the region and province of San Martin. Her job is making and selling mirrors and picture frames, as well as chicha de maiz (a local drink made from corn) and popsicles. Her business is located in her house in Urb. Las Flores Mz CâLt 13 del A.A.H.H. Las Flores de la Molina where she serves her customers. Sometimes she has to leave her house to deliver orders. With this S/.800 loan, which she will pay back in 6 months, Isolina will buy materials to make mirrors, such as rods, files, and tape etc. She is also planning to buy maize, bags of sugar, cinnamon, cloves, small bags for the popsicles, fruit for the chicha and popsicles—all of which are much in demand by her customers. Señora Isolina is 45 years old, lives with her husband and the one child that still is dependent on her. She is a determined, lively woman and a good administrator. Her goal is improve her house so that she can expand her business and increase the amount of stock she carries. In this way she will provide a better service to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy material to make mirrors, as well as maize, sugar, cinnamon etc.

location.town: La Banda de Shilcayo - San Martín

loans.name: Duong Thi

texts.vi: Chị Thuý năm nay 32 tuổi, chị đang sống cùng chồng và hai con tại xã Yên Bình, huyện ý Yên tỉnh Nam Định. Gia đình chị có nghề buôn bán thịt lợn. Hiện nay mỗi ngày hai vợ chồng chị mổ hai con lợn cung cấp thực phẩm cho người dân địa phương cho thu nhập từ 100.000d đến 200.000đ/ ngày. Vòng vố tới chị mong muốn được vay 9.000.000 đ để đầu tư vốn cho công việc buôn bán thịt lợn của  gia đình
texts.en:
Mrs Thuý is 32 years old. She lives with her husband and two boys in the village of Yên Bình, in the Nam Định province. The family's occupation is to sell pork meat. Currently, husband and wife dissects two pigs every day to supply meat to local people, for a revenue of 100.000d to 200.000đ per day. For the next round, she would like to borrow 9.000.000đ to invest into their meat-selling business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Minh Bui, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business

loans.name: Florencia

texts.en:
Florencia is a member of the Tu Angel Lucy (“Your Angel Lucy”) Village Bank, named for FINCA founder Lucinda Lanao. Florencia is 44 years old and separated with five children. Florencia sells food at different construction sites. She and her son also sell sweets at a kiosk outsiD. of Ayacucho’s national university. Florencia needs a loan of 600 soles to buy sacks of sugar and rice. Florencia’s dreams are to send her children to school and to expand her businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Fellow.

Florencia es del Banco Comunal Tu Ángel Lucy. Florencia es separada, tiene 44 años y 5 hijos, Florencia venD. comida, sus ventas los realiza en las diferentes obras D. construcción, a donD. lleva la comida. Además Florencia venD. golosinas en un kiosco ubicado en la universidad nacional D. la ciudad, actividad que realiza con la ayuda D. su hijo. Florencia necesita un préstamo D. 600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. azucar, arroz por sacos. Florencia sueña con educar a sus hijos y ampliar sus negocios.

loans.use: To buy sacks of rice and sugar

loans.name: Vida

texts.en:
Vida M. is a divorced mother of one child, who is currently attending the final year of high school. Vida is a 37 year old trader. She trades in lace and cloth materials, which most women use to sew dresses. Lace material is also very useful in room and office decorations.

Because she lacks adequate working capital, Vida buys small amounts of lace and cloth materials and sells them in the market place of Babiani, where she lives with her family. She believes this loan will enable her to grow her business to the expected level. She wants to purchase bulk quantities of lace materials and clothing. She hopes to use part of her profit to provide her child with quality education.

Vida belongs to the community group called Ephesians Trust group. She says your support would enable her to realize her dream. Her picture was taking when she was visited at the market where she sells.

loans.use: To purchase bulk quantities of lace materials and textiles.

loans.name: Adjo

texts.fr: Cette dame habite le crédit d’awatamé à adjidogomé, elle a pour activité la vente de chaussure et elle fabrique aussi des nattes pour revendre, ce commerce marche bien pour elle c’est pour celà qu’elle voudrait l’agrandir en demandant à WAGES son premier prêt d’un montant de 150000F pour acheter des chaussures et des matériaux pour la fabrication de nattes. Elle est mariée et son mari est un photographe, ils ont ensemble 02 enfants, elle aide beaucoup son mari dans les charges du foyer.
texts.en:
This lady lives in the Awatamé district in Adjidogomé. Her business is selling shoes and she also makes woven mats to sell. This business is going well and so she would like to expand it by asking for her very first loan from WAGES in the amount of 150,000 F to buy shoes and materials for weaving mats. She is married and her husband is a photographer. They have 2 children. She helps her husband support the family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of shoes and material for weaving mats

loans.name: Nortoji

texts.en:
Nortoji B. has an established business selling children's clothing in her store. She started her business about 25 years ago. She has an entrepreneurial mind, and she has worked hard to develop her business. Buying clothing inventory from Istaravshan, where she can get better prices, is one way in which she is able to gain a competitive business advantage. Moreover, she is planning on bringing goods in from China. Nortoji is married, and she has two adult children. She is requesting a loan of $ 600 USD in order to purchase more clothing. With additional clothing, she will be able to increase her sales and will continue to provide a better life for herself and her family. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key place along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. 
But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase  new children's  clothing for sale

loans.name: Lauristela

texts.es:
La señora Lauristela E. D. P., pertenece al Banco Comunal “Nuestra Señora D. la Paz”, vive en el Jr. Ulises Reategui Nº 302, Distrito D. Tarapoto, Departamento D. San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 56 años.

Con el primer préstamo D. S/. 300.00, motivada por su esposo aperturò  un negocio D. venta D. golosinas  en su propia casa. Tiene 02 años trabajando con el Banco.

 Con el préstamo D. S/1,500.00 que cancelará a plazo D. 06 meses, comprará más productos para implementar más su negocio con galletas dulces y salada en cajas caramelos, chocolates, chicles  en bolsos, kekes, panes, gaseosas y agua minerales en paquetes D. docenas para venD. a los alumnos D. una escuela cercana a sus vecinos y moradores D. la comunidad.

Ella es quien maneja los gastos y ganancias D. su negocio. En lo personal, ambiciona implementar y surtir más su negocio. Y ahora es una Mujer independiente y responsable con el pago D. sus cuotas y toma sus propias decisiones.

Lauristela, manifiesta su agradecimiento a Manuela Ramos por permitirle crecer como empresaria y Mujer.
texts.en:
Lauristela E. D. P. is a member of the community bank "Nuestra Señora D. la Paz”. She lives in the district of Tarapoto in the department of San Martín. She is married and 56 years old. She was encouraged by her husband to borrow her first loan of S/.300 soles, with which she opened a candy store in her home. She has been working with the bank for two years. With this loan of S/1,500 soles, which she will repay in six months, she will buy more products to stock her business with: sweet cookies and savouries by the case, caramels, chocolates, bags of chewing gum, cakes, breads, soft drinks and mineral water by the dozen to retail to the students of a nearby school, to her neighbours and people from the community. She is the person managing the expenses and revenues from her business. On a personal note, she wants to establish her business and stock it more. She is now an independent and responsible woman in her repayments and makes her own decisions. Lauristela is grateful to Manuela Ramos for helping her grow as an entrepreneur and as a woman.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy goods such as cookies, sweets, chocolates, chewing gum, soft drinks, breads, mineral water

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
Abena T. is 23 years old. She is married with one child. According to Abena, her child is yet to attain school age. Abena’s husband is a carpenter by profession while she is a food vendor. She lives with her child and husband in a rented apartment in Mampong, in the Ashanti region of Ghana.

Akua cooks and sells rice with stew. She cooks the food in her house and sells by the street in the evenings. She buys bags of rice and other ingredients from wholesalers in her community. She has been in this business for three years.

Akua wants a loan to procure more bags of rice and other ingredients. She hopes to sponsor her child in school to higher levels.

loans.use: Procure bags of rice.

loans.name: Maximiliana

texts.es: Maximiliana tiene 69 años, está casada con Aparicio, quien se dedica a la carpintería. Tuvieron 5 hijos; Irma (39), Jaime (48), Iris (44), Maribel (42), Ever (40) decidieron formar sus propias familias y salir del seno familiar, quedando solos Maximiliana y su esposo, quienes hoy en día viven con una de sus sobrinas, apoyándola para que estudie y se convierta en una buena profesional. Desde hace 40 años Maximiliano se dedica a la venta de comida en el restaurante que posee, incursionó en este negocio gracias a sus grandes dotes en la cocina que siempre le gustó y que la llevo a mantenerse hasta hoy en día en este trabajoso negocio, ya que aunque no parezca, es muy sacrificado, ella debe levantarse a las 5 de la mañana para preparar los desayunos que ofrecerá a sus clientes hasta aproximadamente las 9 de la mañana, de ahí empieza a preparar los platillos que serán el deleite de sus clientes a la hora de almuerzo, esto hasta las 2 de la tarde tomando un pequeño descanso, para que a las 5pm vuelva a preparar nuevos platillos para la cena, y esto todos los días. Felizmente “Doña Maxi” como la llaman sus comensales más asiduos, cuenta con dos señoras que la ayudan en la cocina y atención de la clientela, (en la foto la acompañan en ambos costados) pues sin ellas no podría darse abasto para la atención de la concurrida clientela. El negocio es rentable y ella espera lograr expandirlo muy pronto, además quiere comprar una congeladora nueva para mantener más frescos sus alimentos. Maxi es una clienta antigua en MFP, pero por motivos de salud dejó de sacar préstamos en esta institución, volviendo después de un buen tiempo. Y ahora que está mejor de salud este crédito le permite tener una mejor estabilidad, además le gusta mucho su banco comunal, ya que todas sus compañeras son muy amables y alegres. Con el dinero que solicita comprará una considerable cantidad de víveres para la preparación de sus platillos; como fideos, arroz y papas.
texts.en:
Maximiliana is 69 years old, married to Aparicio, who is a carpenter. They have 5 children: Irma (39), Jaime (48), Iris (44), Maribel (42), and Ever (40). They have formed their own families and don't live in at home. Left alone, Maximiliana and her husband now live with one of their neices. They support her while she studies and becomes a good professional. For 40 years Maximiliana has sold food in her restaurant. She started this business thanks to her ability in the kitchen that is always loved. This has allowed her to have a good business to this day. However, it is tolling. She wakes up at 5am to prepare breakfast for her customers until about 9am. Then she starts to make the lunch plates. At 2pm she has a small break. At 5 she makes dinner plates. This happens everyday. Happily, "Lady Maxi," as she is called, has two women to help her in the kitchen and with serving customers (they are in the photo with her.) Howver, they can't cope with giving service to so many customers when the restaurant is busy. The business is profitable and she hopes to expand it soon, but she needs to buy a new freezer to keep everything fresh. Maxi is an old client of MFP, for health reasons she stopped taking out loans with this institution, but she is now returning after awhile. Now that her health is better, this loan will help her have better stability, and she likes this bank a lot because everyone is nice and happy. With the requested money she hopes she will buy a considerable amount of supplies, such as noodles, rice and potatoes, for the preparation of her dishes.

Translated from Spanish by Caitlin Brooks, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying ingredients for making food

loans.name: Heng

texts.en:
Mrs. K. is 27-years-old and the mother of one young child who is enrolled in the local school. She currently sells different kinds of vegetables in Phsa Kroam Market located in Siem Reap Province. Her husband, San, is the other provider of the family's financial income. He works as a motor taxi driver. K. is determined to use this loan in order to buy vegetables to sell. The remainder will be used to replace a motorcycle.
The two people shown in the picture are Mrs. Heng K. and her husband.

loans.use: To buy vegetables to sell

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios C. makes a living providing sea water to fish vendors in Oroquieta City market. She is 40 years old, married and has three adult children. She is from the village of Mobod. Remedios has been engaged in her business for over nine years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Remedios joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Remedios is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional gallon containers. This will be her second loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional gallon containers

loans.name: Leyfou

texts.fr: mr leyfou S. est un homme né en 1946 à khombole qui vit avec sa famille;depuis qu'il est à la retraite il fait de l'aviculture pour subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants;avec le pret qu'il sollicite il veut renforcer son fonds de roulement
texts.en:
Mr. Leyfou S. is a man who was born in 1946 in Khombole. He lives with this family. Since he retired, he has been raising poultry to provide for his children. With this loan he's requesting, he wants to augment his working capital.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Poultry farming

loans.name: Fili

texts.en:
Fili S., 56, is married with six children. She has one year of experience in her plantation business. She sells to the villagers and public four days per week and expects her weekly net cash flow to be 200 Tala (~150 USD). She has no previous loan with SPBD.

SPBD loans are Fili’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: To purchase a knapsack sprayer, knives and weed killer

loans.name: Keji

texts.en:
Keji B. is currently in the business of selling green vegetables like cabbages, okra etc and is requesting a loan to purchase smoked fish to sell. Keji is 50 years old and is married to a husband who is a peasant. She has six children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy seeds and initiate a little farm to grow green vegetables.


BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase smoked fish to sell

loans.name: Nhem

texts.en:
Mrs. M. Nhem, age 46, and her husband, Mr. Moeun Chea, age 36, have been married since 1985. They have two sons and two daughters. One of them is married, but still lives in the family house. The family lives along the Tonle Basac River, a tributary of the nearby Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penn, the capital of Cambodia.

M. has been selling flowers and bananas since 1997. She grows the flowers by herself and buys banana in her village. One day a week, she transports the flowers and bananas to the Phnom Penh market to sell, except for holyday, which is a day set aside for the observance of Buddhist precepts. She receives a gross profit of 250,000.00 riel (about $62.50) for each journey. Her husband, Mr. Moeun Chea, is a construction worker. He works in his village and in the nearby village. 

The couple wants to build a kitchen and a restroom for the family to use, but they don’t have money. Thus, M. is requesting her second loan of $1,000 for this purpose.

loans.use: To build kitchen and a restroom for her family

loans.name: Dalia Azucena

texts.es:
La señora Dalia Chavarría esta preocupada por la educación de sus dos hijas, una de ellas va a entrar a preescolar y la quiere meter a una escuela particular; donde le enseñen el Ingles ya que como vive en ciudad Fronteriza es muy esencial que los niños desde pequeños aprendan otro idioma.
Dalia quiere un préstamo para comprar los útiles de su hija, uniformes, ropa, zapatos, mochila y pagar la colegiatura. El esposo de Dalia es un señor responsable que le ayuda con los gastos el trabaja en una vidriera desde hace 7 años para que a su familia no le falte nada, también Dalia trabaja en una Agencia Aduanal para el apoyo de su esposo.
texts.en:
Mrs. Dalia C. is concerned about the education of her two daughters. One of them is going to enter preschool and she wants to put her in a particular school where she will be taught English. Because she lives in a Mexican border town it is essential that the children learn another language from a young age.

Dalia wants a loan to buy school supplies for her daughter: uniforms, clothes, shoes, and knapsack and to pay the school fees. Her husband is a responsible man who helps with the expenses. He has worked in a glass shop for 7 years so that his family lacks nothing. Dalia also works in the Customs Agency to support her husband.

Translated from Spanish by Machelle Wilson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Comprar utiles de su hija

loans.name: Sol De Verano-Piscis Group

texts.es: Cuatro son las integrantes del grupo Sol de Verano-Piscis, que a su vez pertenecen al Centro Focal Juan Pablo, Hilaria C. de 54 vende remedios naturales, Maria Luz M. de 38 años elabora dulces en su domicilio, Esperanza R. de 40 años vende repuestos electrónicos y Elisa R. que tambien produce dulces. Todas necesitan del préstamo para comprar mercaderia e incrementar sus productos, tambien comprar materia prima como el azúcar.
texts.en:
The Sol de Verano-Piscis group, a branch of the Juan Pablo headquarters, is comprised of 4 members. Hilaria C., age 54, sells natural remedies. Maria Luz M., age 38, makes homemade candy. Esperanza R., age 40, sells spare parts for electronics, while Elisa R. also makes homemade candy. They all need a loan to purchase merchandise and increase their products. They also need to purchase raw materials, such as sugar.


Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en: Melanie L. is from the village of Barangay 4, Talakag, Bukidnon. She is 20 years old, is married, and has one infant child. Melanie owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail store, selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste and other items in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Melanie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary T. is married and has one child. She has a junior high educational background. Mary sells towels and bed sheets at Elmina, near Bantuma, which she has been doing since 1998. Her husband is a security personnel. Mary uses her income to support the husband in the payment of school fees and settlement of utility bills. Mary will use the loan to purchase towels and bed sheets in bulk. With the new profits from her expanded business, Mary plans to save enough money to build her own house.

loans.use: Mary will use the loan to purchase bails of towel and bed sheets.

loans.name: Venus

texts.en:
Venus P. is from the town of Baclay, Tukuran Zambo Del Sur. She is 44 years old. Venus is married and has eight grown children. To make a living, Venus owns and operates a business selling specialty food products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately $275 a month from these activities.

In 2007, Venus joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Venus has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Venus is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her sixth loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Srey

texts.en:
Mrs. Srey O. is a farmer in Pour Ta Mouk Village in Takeo Province. She grows rice on a piece of land that she owns. Her husband, Mr. Yei Reth, raises ducks for the eggs. Since his poultry business is going well, he wants to expand it, so Mrs. Srey O. has decided to ask for a loan to buy 170 ducks for breeding. 

Mrs. Srey O. is 42 years old and the mother of six children. One of her children works in a garment factory, four are enrolled in the local school, and the youngest one is too young to work or study.

loans.use: To buy 170 ducks for breeding.

loans.name: Ikechukwu

texts.en: Ikechukwu, 32, is married and has a child. He lives in Ogbomoso, in the Oyo State of Nigeria, and makes an income selling male clothes and shoes at a retail store. Ikechukwu is a very hard-working man and has been in this business for a long time.  Currently, it is the high season for his business, and Ikechukwu hopes to be able to meet the high demand from his customers and, thus, earn additional income for his family. Ikechukwu is requesting a loan of NGN50,000 to purchase more clothes for sale. He is thankful to all Kiva lenders for support.

loans.use: Purchase of additional clothes for sale

loans.name: Rosa Augusta

texts.es:
Nuestra socia ROSA es divorciada y tiene tres hijos. Ella es natural de la ciudad de Cusco. La socia pertenece al banco comunal “RICCHARY CUSCO” de la Asociación Arariwa. 

La socia alterna sus actividades D. hogar con la venta de comestibles. La socia tiene una tienda de abarrotes y alquila dormitorios en su domicilio. Ya son varios años con el negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su trabajo. Nuestra socia es trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia. La socia requiere el préstamo para aumentar el capital D. negocio y desea comprar comestibles como arroz, fideos y verduras.             
   
La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Rosa is divorced and has three children. She is a native of the city of Cusco. She belongs to the communal bank "Ricchary Cusco," which is part of the Arariwa Association. She alternates her activities in the home with the sale of groceries. She has a small grocery store and also rents rooms in her house. She has already had this business for some years now, and it has gone very well thanks to all of the effort she puts into her work. She is very enterprising and hardworking because she wants to advance her family economically. She needs a loan to increase her working capital; she wants to buy foodstuffs such as rice, noodles and vegetables. Rosa is very grateful for the opportunity provided through these means and she is committed to making her payments on time

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs such as rice, noodles and vegetables for her grocery store

loans.name: Edith Marina

texts.es: Edith Marina Solís T. de 48 años de edad, reside en San Lorenzo en el departamento de Ahuachapán. Vive junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos menores de edad, los cuales se dedican a estudiar, y a atender el negocio cuando su madre se los solicita. Edith posee una tienda en la cual comercializa productos perecederos. A pesar que ya cuenta con varios años de tener dicho negocio, los gastos del hogar los cuales son muchos, le han impedido a Edith poder surtirlo con todo lo necesario para obtener mayor clientela. Ella solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar más productos como arroz, frijoles y azúcar, así mismo detergente, pan y bebidas. Todo esto con el fin de poder mejorar sus ganancias. Edith es una persona muy responsable, la cual  desea mejorar la situación económica de su familia, contribuyendo junto a su esposo.
texts.en:
Edith Marina S. T. is 48 years old and lives in San Lorenzo in an apartment in Ahuachapan. She lives with her husband and her two youngest children who are still in school and who tend the business when she asks. Edith has a store that sells commercial, perishable products. Even though she has had this store for several years, expenses are high, which has impeded Edith in doing what is needed to obtain better clientele. She is asking for a loan so that she can buy more products such as rice, beans and sugar, as well as detegent, bread and soft drinks. All of this will eventually improve her earnings. Edith is a very responsible person, one who wants to improve her economic situation for her family, contributing along with her husband.

Translated from Spanish by Misty McNally, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy perishable products to resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase chemicals used to kill ticks in her cattle

loans.name: Alfredo Evelio

texts.es:
Alfredo, desde que naciò conoce perfectamente el tèrmino viceras,  es decir organo de Ganado para hacer los mas exquisitos platos de la comida colombiana,panza,corazon, higado, riñones y pulmon;   èl lo aprendiò tradicionalmente de su padre de quien dice es el “mondonguero mayor” que significa vendedor de panza que montado en un asno ofrece estos productos. 
Alfredo como su padre tambien practica este oficio, pero ahora lo hace en un bicicoche donde ademas de hacer ejercicios,  gana dinero vendiendo viceras  recorriendo la zona  alrededor del barrio Galan de Barranquilla, sitio donde esta ubicada su vivienda. Trabaja como un experto  cortador  carnico,  tiene 12 años de haber iniciado su negocio y le gusta vender estos produtos porque con ellos se preparan los mas exquisitos platos de la comida colombiana: por ejemplo las sopas  de mondongo que es la sopa de panza cortada en cuadritos a la cual agregan papa, yuca maiz,veduras frescas , clavito de olor, sal al gusto y hasta pezuña o medula de Ganado.
Es usual para alfredo, vestirse con su bata blaca y gorra e ir diariamente al Mercado desde las 4:00 a.m. a comprar viceras en su bicicoche, luego recorre mas de 6 barrios con su cuchillo afilado,  2 neveras de polietireno , un balanza  y una Madera donde se afirma para cortar y vender por libras sus productos, porque Alfredo vende al detal a mas de 150 clientes diarios, algunos son atendidos por su padre que ya no va en asno, sino en un vehiculo similar al de èste  y con quien divide la zona de trabajo.  Ellos dos son muy reconocidos  porque los clients saben que venden viceras de calidad , frescas y no los engañan en el pesaje.
El dice que  conociò a la Fundaciòn  Mario Santo Domingo, o a la Mario como cariñosamente la llaman, porque todos en el barrio saben que tienen programas de credito, capacitaciòn y tambien de vivienda. Este es su Segundo credito y aspira a obtener financiamiento por $1.000.000 a èl para agregar un nuevo producto a su oferta, este es la carne por la que sus clientes le preguntan constantemente y tambien  comprarà de contado viceras en mayor cantidad.Alfredo vive en la casa paterna con su esposa y sus hijas de 3, 6 y 15 años respectivamente; el sueña con tener su casa propia para verlas crecer como personas independientes  y estudiosas, por eso se esfuerza diariamente para que su esposa, se dedique personalmente y muy de cerca su cuidado educaciòn.
Su màximo deseo es poner un punto de venta bien dotado y contratar empleados para èl poder extenderse a diversos barrios, porque a los clients les gusta que le lleven a la puerta de su casa estos productos, especialmente a los pensionados con quien tiene mucha acogida y estan sentados en la puerta de su casa esperando a Alfreso para tener con quien conversar, asi muchas veces se demora porque  es un buen escucha y muy paciente. Esto hace que su  aceptaciòn sea ràpida en la comunidad donde incursiona.
Describe al barrio Galan como un lugar donde vive gente tranquila,  los vecinos se cuidan los unos a los otros y sobre todo cuando saben que cargan  dinero producto de las ventas, asi ellos estàn pendientes de Alfredo y eso le gusta.
Alfredo V. es un buenagente como dicen sus vecinos, el  siempre està dispuesto a colaborar y a continuar recorriendo alegremente en su bicicoche las calles de Barranquilla para mantener a su familia y mejorar cada dia su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
From a very young age, Alfredo was fully aware of viscera, the internal organs of livestock used in making the most exquisite Colombian dishes. These include the stomach, heart, liver, kidneys, and lungs. He learned this tradition from his father, who is known as “El Mondonguero Mayor” (The Great Tripe Seller) and travels by donkey to sell his products.

Alfredo followed in his father’s footsteps, except he uses a bicycle cart to sell his goods. He earns his living traveling through the area near his home in the neighborhoods surrounding Galan de Barranquilla to sell internal organs. Alfredo is known as an expert meat cutter and has been in this profession for twelve years. He enjoys working with these products because they are staples in many of the dishes that make up Colombian cuisine. For example, tripe is used in a lot of soups when combined with potatoes, cassava, corn, fresh vegetables, cloves, and salt to taste. Some recipes even call for the hoof and bone marrow of the cow.

Alfredo’s usual schedule is to travel to the market every day at 4am, dressed in a white apron and cap, to buy internal organs to stock his bicycle cart. Later he travels to more than six neighborhoods with his sharp knife, two styrofoam ice chests, a scale, and a butcher block so that he can begin cutting and selling his products by the pound. Alfredo serves more than 150 customers each day, some of whom were previous patrons of his father. Since Alfredo has his own mode of transportation, he and his father decided to divide the sales territory. They both are well-recognized by their customers and known for the quality and freshness of their products. In addition, they have an honest reputation since they don’t cheat when weighing the goods.

Alfredo learned about Fundaciòn Mario Santo Domingo (or simply “Mario” as he likes to call it) from everyone in the neighborhood because of the credit programs, training seminars, and housing services that it offers. This is his second loan and he hopes to obtain financing of 1,000,000 COP to acquire more products for his business. These include the meats that his customers request on a frequent basis as well as internal organs he plans to buy in bulk. Alfredo lives in his father’s home with his wife and their three daughters (age 15, 6, and 3 respectively). His dream is to have his own house and see his children grow up to become independent and studious individuals. For this reason, he and his wife strive daily on a personal level because they care deeply about their daughters’ education.

Alfredo’s greatest wish is to open a well-stocked vending location and hire employees to travel to different neighborhoods because his customers enjoy having his products delivered to their front door. This service is especially popular among pensioners who are sitting at their front door waiting to strike up a conversation with Alfredo. There have been several occasions in which he was delayed in making deliveries because he is a good listener and very patient with his customers. His services are accepted rapidly in areas where he has not visited before.

The neighborhood of Galan is a place where the residents live peacefully. The neighbors look after one another and know what other people are being charged when making purchases. For this reason, they are loyal to Alfredo and he enjoys having their trust.

Alfredo V. is an outstanding gentleman who is well-spoken of by his neighbors. He can always be found traveling happily through the streets of Barranquilla in his bicycle cart so that he can continue supporting his family and improving their standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase meat & viscera in large quantities

loans.name: José Abrahán

texts.es:
El Sr. José Abrahán C. V. es empleado, trabaja como conserje en el centro de salud del Municipio de Condega.

Este cliente solicita dicho crédito para el pago de unos exámenes medico y la compra de medicamento para su esposa ya que ella esta un mal de salud, esto exámenes tiene que realízalos en la capital y son muy costosos igual que el medicamento.

El Sr. Abrahán C. a trabajado en este centro de salud desde hace 5 años, antes de trabajar aquí el estaba trabajando en un centro escolar de estudios secundarios realizando el mismo trabajo. El realiza sus labores de trabajado de lunes a sábado desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 4 de la tarde.

Este cliente espera que con la compra de estos medicamentos y exámenes su esposa se recupere del mal estado de salud en que se encuentra y así tener mejor tranquilidad y felicidad en su hogar. Cabe señalar que este cliente es casado pero no tiene hijos.

Este es el crédito numero seis que el Sr. Abrahan Centebno tiene en Ceprodel en un periodo de 3 años, estos financiamiento han tenido un impacto positivo en la vida de Don Abrahán ya que con ellos a logrado realizar mejoras en su casa de habitación como la instalación de la energía eléctrica mejorando así de esta manera su condiciones de vida de el y su esposa y con el futuro hacer mas.
texts.en:
Mr. José Abrahán C. V. is employed, working as a receptionist in the health center in the municipality of Condega. He is asking for this loan so that he can pay for some medical exams and buy medicine for his wife who is in poor health. These exams, which must take place in the capital, are very expensive, as is the medicine. Mr. Abrahán C. has worked in the health center for five years. Before he worked here, he was working in a center for secondary studies, where he did the same work. He works Monday through Saturday from 7 in the morning until 4 in the afternoon. He hopes that with the purchase of these medicines and exams his wife will recover from her current state poor health and will be more peaceful and happy in their home. It should be said that Mr. Abrahán C. is married but does not have children. This is the sixth loan Mr. Abrahan Centebno has had with Ceprodel in a 3 year period. These loans have had a positive impact on his life, because with them he has been able to make improvements on his house like installing electricity, which improves the quality of life for him and his wife. He hopes in the future he will be able to do more.

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cost of medical exams and purchase of medicine

loans.name: Sylivia

texts.en:
Sylivia is a 25-year-old married with three children aged between 4 and 7 years, all of whom go to school. She also takes care of additional family members. She resides in and rents a two-roomed house where she lives with four people. There is electricity but no piped water at home. The family gets three meals a day.

Sylivia resides and works in a semi-urban area which is in Mulago in the outskirts of Kampala. Sylivia works seven days a week selling secondhand clothes. She buys her secondhand clothes from Owino market and incurs extra transport costs to and from shopping. She pays monthly rent of 5000/=. She sells to all categories of people both retail and wholesale.

Sylivia has been in this business for three years and with MCDT for nine months. She is servicing her second loan, working with the same group members. She wants to use this loan to buy more secondhand clothes.

Sylivia is aspiring to seeing her business grow bigger and to start importing secondhand clothes directly.

loans.use: To buy more bales of secondhand clothes

loans.name: Mrs. Vary Khim Village Bank Group

texts.en: Mrs. Vary K. is the leader of a fourteen-person loan group in Pou Ta Pang village in Kadanl province. She is a housewife and her husband, Mr. Sau Lay, is a construction worker. They have two school-age children. The family has a problem because their step is too old to use so Mrs. Vary K. is asking for a loan to build a new step.

loans.use: To build a new step

loans.name: Elissa

texts.en: To make a living, Elissa D. operates a retail store selling daily use products such as candies, some food for snacks, shampoo, soap and toothpaste in her community. She is 50 years old and married, from the village of Salvador, Calamba, Misamis Occidental. Elissa has been in her business for over two years and earns approximately 3,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2009, Elissa joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Elissa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from GDMPC which was used to purchase products to sell. She is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. This will be her second loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to supplement her family's income. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and for working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Making and selling cassava flour

loans.name: Rathnawathi

texts.en:
Rathnawathi is a 58-year-old married woman living in Hikkaduwa, Galle with her husband and youngest daughter, age 23. Her two sons are married.

Rathnawathi's husband has a small business producing cinnamon oil, which he sells to local and foreign customers. Every morning they wake up early to make the cinnamon oil, which they have been doing for four years now. During most of the day, Rathnawathi goes to collect cinnamon leaves from the cinnamon gardens.

Her daughter helps her as well when she has the time. She has a very good location for her business, because her area is situated near to Hikkaduwa. Hikkaduwa is a tourist destination. Their business has a good market and a good demand.

Rathnawathi has requested a 40,000-rupee (LKR) loan from BRAC Sri Lanka in order to purchase some cinnamon leaves to compress and make into oil.

Thank you for taking the time to consider supporting this Sri Lankan loan!

loans.use: To buy some cinnamon leaves

loans.name: Mr. Mean Moeng Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan consists of 19 people who live in Angk Khlaeu village in Kandal province.

Mr. Mean M. is the village bank president, as selected by all the members who will each use their portion of the loan for different purposes. He and his wife, Mrs. Orang Proeung, are farmers who own three-hectares of land to cultivate rice to sell to support their family, including their 25 year old son. Their problE. is that their field is ready; however they don't have enough money to support it. So to improve production, Mr. Mean M. is asking for a loan to ensure they can farm their land this year.

loans.use: To improve productivity on their rice field

loans.name: Davaahuu

texts.en: Davaahuu M. is 55 years old and lives with his wife in a traditional Mongolian housing tent (known locally as a ger) in Zavhan province in western Mongolia. He graduated from a driving course in 1973, and has made a living providing transportation services for the last 18 years. He is very experienced in this line of work, and even transports coal in wintertime. He has applied for this loan to buy timber for resale, and eventually hopes buy a small car that he plans to operate as a taxi. Davaahuu is a modest, hard-working person and is very committed to improve the quality of his life.

loans.use: To purchase timber for resale

loans.name: Rakia

texts.en:
Rakia M. prepares 'waakye' to sell at Abura. She is married to a farmer and has five dependents. She has been educated up to junior high level. Rakia uses the income she makes from the 'waakye' she sells to assist her husband in taking care of the family. Rakia will use the loan to purchase ingredients to prepare 'waakye' for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Rakia plans to reinvest back into her business. 

To prepare 'waakye' she gets her beans, rice, and colored leaves from the market. She cooks the beans till they become a little tender, adds the colored leaves to give the beans and the boiling water a wineish colour, then she adds her rice to get a mixture of the rice and beans in the water. She cooks until the mixture becomes tender enough to eat.

'Waakye' is normally eaten with macaroni, 'wele' (cow skin),  'gari' (cassava couscous), salad with pepper sauce, tomato sauce, and fish of any kind and meat of your choice.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients to prepare 'waakye'

loans.name: Heidy Marilu

texts.es:
Heidy Marilu L. R. tiene 22 años.  Es casada y vive con su esposo y 2 niños, Antonio (3 años) y Wendy (17 meses), en el cantón de Guaranda en la provincia de Bolívar.

Heidy es una socia de la ventanilla rural Patrón San Juan, que está ubicada a media hora de Guaranda. Son 16 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a cultivos de papas y maíz. Esto es el primer préstamo que ellos sacan con la Cooperativa San José.

Heidy trabaja en la agricultura, cultivando papas, trigo, cebada y maíz. Realiza sus compras cada semana y sus ventas cada 6 meses en Guaranda.

Solicita el préstamo para comprar semillas, abonos y químicos para cultivar papas. Piensa que este crédito le ayudara para progresar más en los cultivos. Su sueño es que a su hijo le vaya bien (fue operado en Quito hace poco días). La enfermedad del niño es su mayor desafió. 

Le gusta divertirse y jugar basketball como deportes.
texts.en:
Heidy Marilu L. R., 22, is married and lives with her husband and two children, Antonio, 3, and Wendy, 17 months, in Guaranda canton, Bolívar province. Heidy is a member of the Patrón San Juan communal bank located half an hour from Guaranda. It has a total of 16 members most of whom are corn and potato farmers. This is the first loan they have requested from Cooperativa San José. Heidy farms potatoes, wheat, barley and corn. She makes her purchases weekly and her sales every six months in Guaranda. She is asking for funds to buy seed, manure and chemical fertilizers for her potato crops. She feels that the loan will be helpful in order to make more progress with her crops. Her dream is that her son does well (he was operated on in Quito a few days ago). Her son’s illness is her greatest challenge. She likes to have fun and to play basketball as a sport.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seed, manure and chemical fertilizers for her potato crops.

loans.name: Bokk Jom Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de Solidarité BOKK JOM est né le 30 décembre 2009 lors de l'inauguration du Banc Villageois qui l'abrite: DIADIORDE. Il est composé de 22 femmes toutes issues du même village. Ce sont des membres qui ont des liens de familiarité et de parenté très étroits. 

Madame KENE S., debout à l'extrême droit de la photo est la responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 40 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 05 enfants en charge. 

Elle fait un petit commerce de légumes. Elle s'approvisionne au marché hebdomadaire de Potou dans la communauté rurale de Léona distant à quelques vingtaines de kilomètres. 

Son prêt lui permettra d'acheter des légumes tels des carottes, des choux pommés, des navets etc.. Elle revend sa marchandise dans son marché local.

Son objectif est de prendre entièrement en charge sa famille par rapport à la nourriture, la santé, l'habillement Etc.
texts.en:
The solidarity group, Bokk Jom, was born December 30, 2009 at the time of the opening of the Village Bank which houses Diadiorde. It is made up of 22 women, all from the same village. These members have strong ties and are closely connected. Mrs. Kene S., the first on the far right of the photo, is the head of the group. She is 40 years old. She is married and the mother of 5 children, who are in her care. She runs a small vegetable shop. She re-stocks at the weekly market of Potou in the rural community of Léona, some twenty kilometers away. Her loan will allow her to buy vegetables such as carrots, cabbage hearts, turnips, etc. She resells her merchandise on the local market. Her goal is to meet the needs of her family entirely with regards to food, health, clothing, etc.

Translated from French by Martha Schmitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy vegetables

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie Q. is from the village of Bayabo East. She is 46 years old, married, and has four adult-aged children. To make a living, she operates a food stand, selling vegetables to the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately $150 per harvest for her activities.

In 2009, Rosemarie joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional vegetables to sell. Rosemarie is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase more vegetables to sell. This will be her 2nd loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional vegetables to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy new products and a desktop computer and to redecorate his shop

loans.name: Angel Francisco
