texts.es: Ángel Francisco tiene su actividad económica que es la venta de de mercadería en general, hace mas de 29 años que se dedica a esta actividad, pues siempre está buscando la forma de sacar a su familia, pues ha demostrado que es una hombre responsable ya que ha pagado sus cuotas a tiempo. A pesar de los costos tan altos de los productos que ofrece. Este financiamiento será para la compra de ropa y calzado.
texts.en:
Ángel Francisco sells general merchandise for a living. He has been doing this for more than 29 years and is always looking for ways to provide for his family. He has shown that he is a responsible man by making his payments on time, despite the high cost of the products he offers. With this loan he will purchase clothing and footwear.

Translated from Spanish by Ann Achilli, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase clothing and footwear for his business

loans.name: Wael

texts.en:
Wael has been married for a long time now, and he and his wife have been trying to have a baby. Wael tried embryo implantation once and wants to try again. Wael came to FATEN and took a $3000 loan for this purpose.

Wael lives and works in Hebron- Dura village. Wael is a very decent man and wants to have children badly. This is his first loan from FATEN and hopes that with the help of FATEN he would be able to have his baby.

Wael appears in the picture above in FATEN"s office- Hebron Branch.

loans.use: Embryo implantation

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en:
Paulina B. is from the town of Lopez Jaena. She is 38 years old, married and has 4 school-aged children. Paulina owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. Paulina has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2007, Paulina joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Paulina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from PMPC, which was used to to purchase new items to expand product offering. Paulina is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and to increase working capital. This will be the 5th loan taken out by Paulina from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and increase working capital

loans.name: Olesya

texts.en:
Olesya is married with a 1-year-old son. She is a farmer from predominantly agricultural Kherson region of Ukraine. Olesya lives in a small town of Privetnoye. She grows early spring vegetables to sell them wholesale in the markets of her region. Olesya has been in this business for 8 years. Presently, she has already invested 12,000 Grivnyas in this business. Her net profit amounts to 35,00 Grivnyas per season.

Olesya is planning to buy a dripping irrigation unit, fertilizers, farming chemicals, polyethylene film, seeds and wood for greenhouse heating. Therefore, she is requesting a 6,000 Grivnya loan. Olesya also breeds pigs which provides an additional source of income for herself and her family. She is hoping to continue growing her farming and cattle breeding businesses as they are the only ways to survive in small town neighborhoods like the one she is from.

Note: In the photo, Olesya is pictured with her mother.

loans.use: To purchase a dripping irrigation unit, fertilizers, farming chemicals, polyethylene film, seeds and wood for greenhouse heating.

loans.name: Ledys Esther

texts.es:
Ledys R. es una confeccionista de 52 años que vive  en Villa del Carmen, un barrio ubicado en el municipio de Soledad; allí  tiene su negocio de fabricación de ropa en general, porque ella se mueve con todas las tallas y todas las líneas: femenina masculina e infantil.
Ella desde los 16 años inició haciendo su propia ropa y la de sus hermanas, y poco a poco fue incursionando en el ramo empresarial cuando empezó a trabajar en un taller, allí fue donde perfeccionó su arte y   cuando ya hubo conseguido muchos clientes, a quienes les gustaba su forma de trabajar,  inició su  microempresa con ellos.  Este es el segundo crédito con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y con el planea comprar materias primas e insumos para confeccionar sobre medidas   y  artículos como encajes, telas e hilos para venderlos.
Su primer crédito con esta organización lo aprovecho mucho,  porque con el logró tener un capital suficiente  para hacer vestidos y venderlos. Su sueño es tener un almacén especializado en los productos que fabrica   y que  adicionalmente venda   todo lo relacionado con esta actividad, para que los clientes que mandaren a fabricar sus vestidos, pueda comprar la tela que le guste  para su fabricación. El  negocio en la vida e Ledys ha sido muy importante,  porque con él ha logrado sostener  su familia conformada por sus dos hijos de 9 y 26 años de edad,  con los que sueña ver  muy prósperos en un futuro no muy lejano.
texts.en:
Ledys R. is a dressmaker.  She is 52 years old and lives in Villa del Carmen, a neighborhood located in the town of Soledad.  There she has her workshop where she makes clothes.  She makes all sizes and lines of clothing; women's, men's, and children's.

She started out 16 years ago making clothes for herself and for her sisters.  Little by little she started to set foot in the business world when she began to work in a workshop.  That was where she perfected her art and when she had acquired a lot of customers who liked her work, she set up her small business.  This is the second loan which she has had from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and she plans to use it to buy raw materials and supplies for made-to-measure clothes and articles such as laces, fabrics and thread to sell.

She took full advantage of her first loan with this organization because with it she managed to acquire sufficient capital to make dresses and sell them.  Her dream is to have a store for the products which she makes and to sell everything related to this activity so that her customers who ask her to make dresses can choose the material they want.  This business has been very important in Ledys' life because through it she has managed to support her family of two children, aged 9 and 26.  She hopes to see them do very well in the not-so-distant future.

loans.use: To buy raw materials and supplies for making made-to-measure clothes, as well as articles such as lace, fabric and thread to sell

loans.name: Verginia

texts.en:
Verginia T., 46, is making sure that her family has enough for their daily needs. Married to Eduardo T., a construction worker, they find comfort in their children. She makes sure that she helps her husband earn enough for the two children who still live with them so that they can have a better life. She has been managing her food vending business for eight years now, while also operating a buy and sell of ready-to-wear items.

Verginia has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year now. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship* meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow quite a few times in CCT’s Cooperative. She is consistent in paying her dues, because she uses the money she borrows to expand and improve her businesses. 

To help her continue operation of her business, she would like to apply for a Php17,000 loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital to her expanding business by buying materials and other raw ingredients for her food vending business and purchasing additional stocks for her buy and sell of ready-to-wear items.

She dreams that her business will continue to grow and be able to have its own commercial space.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy materials and raw ingredients for her food vending business and additional stock for her clothing buy and sell.

loans.name: Elmurod

texts.ru: Бердиев Элмурод житель города Турсунзаде. Возраст, 29 лет. Женат. Имеет двоих детей. Образование средне - техническое, шафер. По специальности работает более 4 лет. Он в основном предоставляет услугу, такси. Кроме того Элмурод арендует небольшой земельный участок, где сеет пшеницу и выращивает овощи. В этой области уже 6 лет. Целью кредита является закуп минеральных удобрений и аренда трактора.
texts.en: Elmurod B. is a resident of Tursun-zoda.  He is 29 years old, married, and has two children. He has a vocational education as a driver.  He has been working as a driver for more than four years. He primarily drives a taxi.  Additionally, Elmurod rents a small plot of land where he sows wheat and grows vegetables.  He has been doing this for six years.  He is taking out a loan to buy mineral fertilizers and to rent a tractor.

loans.use: buying mineral fertilizers and renting a tractor

loans.name: Roland

texts.en:
Roland A. is from the village of Bonbon, Opol, Misamis Oriental. He is 40 years old. Roland is single and has one adult-aged child. To make a living, he owns and operates a food stall, making and selling snacks and other foods, like burgers and sandwiches, in the local community. Roland has been engaged in his business for over five years and earns approximately $225 a month for these activities.

Roland joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business by purchasing more products to sell, like pastries. This will be his 3rd loan from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase more products to sell, like pastries

loans.name: Ampliacion Villa El Polvorin Group

texts.es:
La Sra. Isidora de 42 años de edad, tiene un hijo menor de edad y dos ya adultos. Ella forma parte del grupo “Ampliación Villa el Polvorín”, integrado por 7 personas residentes de la zona de Ampliación ubicado en el distrito de Carbayllo. Sus compañeros la eligieron como Secretaria de la Junta Directiva del grupo.
Hace aproximadamente dos años se dedica a la confección y venta de polos para caballeros, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en el distrito de la Victoria, una de las zonas más comerciales de Lima. Gracias a su trabajo ella ha podido adquirir sus máquinas de coser industriales.
Con sus ingresos puede cubrir los gastos diarios de alimentación, apoyar en los gastos de la casa como los servicios.
Su mayor sueño es ser una gran empresaria, y con mucho trabajo está segura de no estar muy lejos de serlo.
El préstamo solicitado lo invertirá en la compra de materiales para confeccionar polos de verano para caballeros para tener un mayor stock para la temporada de calor que se nos avecina.
texts.en:
Isidora, 42, has one minor son and two adult children.  She is part of the “Ampliación Villa el Polvorín” group which has 7 members who all live in the Ampliación zone located in Carbayllo district.  Her fellow members elected her Secretary on the group’s Board of Directors.

For about the last two years she has been manufacturing and selling men’s polo shirts.  Her business is located in La Victoria district, one of Lima’s most commercial zones.  Thanks to her work she has managed to acquire industrial sewing machines.

She is able to cover daily food expenses and other household expenses, like utilities, with her income.

Her main dream is to become a great businesswoman and she is sure that through much work she’s not too far from becoming one.

She has asked for the loan to buy materials to make summer polo shirts for men in order to have increased stock available for the warm weather season that is approaching.

loans.use: To buy men's polo shirt making materials.

loans.name: Azra's Group

texts.en:
Azra lives in a small city called Jaranwala, which is located in Punjab, Pakistan, and is known for its agriculture industry.  She is a 49-year-old active lady. She spends her time at home taking care of her household responsibilities. 

She is married to S. A. who makes and sells leather purses. He has contracts with different purse sellers and he provides them with the finished products to earn income for the family. He has a great talent which is admired by many of his clients and became the reason for getting more orders on a regular basis. Azra, besides her household work, also helps him in preparing the purses and in completing the orders on time. 

She has applied for a loan from the Kiva partner, Asasah, for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy leather, zippers, etc. in larger quantities, which will help him to complete his orders on time and increase his clientele base. Azra is very hopeful that by investing money in her husband’s business, he will successfully continue to get good results from his business.
  
She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 3rd loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained good credit behavior and never missed any meeting. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Azra.

loans.use: To buy leather and zips for leather purses making business

loans.name: Isabel Karina

texts.es:
Isabel de 35 años, es una microempresaria que con esfuerzo ha podido durante años agrandar el negocio que comenzó con poco capital. 

Tiene un negocio de venta de helados al por mayor. También dando helados por litros a los vendedores de helados ambulantes. Poco a poco ha incrementado su capital de trabajo y ha comprado maquinas para una mayor producción (aparase en la foto una de sus maquinas). Trabaja desde las 08h30am hasta las 18h00pm todos los días con la ayuda de una de sus amigas.       

Tiene muchas aspiraciones para el negocio por eso quiere comprar con el préstamo una maquina industrial que bate helados. En el futuro desea agrandar el negocio y tener sucursales.
texts.en:
Isabel, 35 years of age, is a small business owner who, with a great deal of effort over the years, has been able to grow the business she started with a small amount of capital.

She has an enterprise selling ice cream at wholesale.  She also provides ice cream by the liter to the street vendors.  Little by little, she has increased her working capital and bought machinery to increase her production (as shown in the picture).  She works from 8:30 am until 6:00 pm every day, along with help from one of her friends.

She has many aspirations for her business, which is why she would like to use this loan to purchase an industrial machine that churns ice cream.  In the future, she would like to expand her business and have other locations.

loans.use: To purchase an industrial machine.

loans.name: Duo Peña De Oro Group

texts.es:
DUO. PEÑA D. ORO.
MARIA ESPERANZA S.. TIENE 34 AÑOS D. EDAD, TIENE DOS HIJOS Y ELLA SE DEDICA A LA VENTA D. TORTILLAS, SU CREDITO LO NECESITA PARA PODER COMPRAR 4 TAREAS D. LEÑA PORQUE EN ESTA EPOCA ESTA UN POCO BAJO EL PRECIO D. LA LEÑA Y COMPRA D. MAIZ ES POR ESA RAZON QUE NECESITA SU PRESTAMO.
VIVIAN ISABEL N. L..TIENE 30 AÑOS D. EDAD Y TIENE DOS HIJAS, ELLA SE DEDICA A LA VENTA D. TORTILLAS EN SU COMUNIDAD, PERO TAMBIEN ELLA SE DEDICA A CUIDAR UN BEBE CUANDO DEJA D. TORTIAR, SU CREDITO LO NECESITA PARA COMPRAR 4 TAREAS D. LEÑA Y COMPRA D. MAIZ AHORA QUE ESTA BAJO EL PRECIO D. LA LEÑA.
texts.en:
This is the group "Duo Pena D. Oro." 

Maria Esperanza S. is 34 years old.  She has 2 children and has a business selling tortillas.  She needs a loan to buy corn and 4 loads of firewood, because in this season the price of firewood is low.  

Vivian Isabel N. L. is 30 years old and has 2 daughters.  She has a business selling tortillas in her community.  But she also has a baby in her care when she is not making tortillas.  She needs a loan to buy 4 loads of firewood and to buy corn, because this is the season when the price of firewood is low.

loans.use: to buy corn and to buy firewood at wholesale

loans.name: Soeun

texts.en:
Soeun V., aged 45, is a mother blessed with nine children. She was once married, but had been divorced from her husband since her children were still young. She currently earns income by growing rice crops, while one of her sons works in construction. 

Soeun V. has inherited a piece of farmland from her grandparents. In addition, she hopes to grow various other crops on her own land.  Soeun V. decided to seek a loan to purchase farming materials such as seeds, fertilizer, and other supplies to expand her farming business.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizer, and farming supplies

loans.name: Joefrey's Group

texts.en:
Joefrey A. is from the village of Mansabay Bajo, Lopez Jaena, Mis. Occ. He is 24 years old. Joefrey is the group leader of a two-member group loan offered by GDMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. Joefrey is married and has two school-age children. To make a living, Joefrey owns and operates a fishing business. The main source of income for the business comes from harvesting and selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Joefrey has been engaged in his business for over four years and earns approximately 1,880 PHP a month for these activities. In 2011, Joefrey joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Joefrey A.'s group is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional fishing nets and fish to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Joefrey from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing net and fish to sell

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
Maribel, es una señora de 43 años de edad, dedicada a la venta de tortillas, comida y enchiladas, vive junto a sus cuatro hijos y residen en San Carlos Departamento de Morazán, Ella tiene un chalet, por el que paga alquiler a la alcaldía municipal, este lugar es su puesto de venta, atiende de lunes a sábado.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de maíz, leña y bebidas, con esta inversión busca mejorar su atención a los clientes y reforzar el negocio, abasteciéndolo de los materiales más necesarios para la producción.
El objetivo de ella es ayudar a su familia, que puedan sus hijos finalizar sus estudios, también otra de sus metas es mejorar la infraestructura de la casa donde vive con sus hijos.
texts.en:
Maribel is 43 years old, single, and she sells tortillas, food, and enchiladas.  She lives in the San Carlos Department of Morazán along with her four children.  She has a chalet which she rents from the city.  This is her point of sale and she works there from Monday to Saturday.

She is asking for a loan in order to buy dried corn, firewood, and drinks.  She hopes to improve her customer service through this investment, as well as strengthen and stock the business with the items she needs most for production.

Her goal is to help her family, and be able to pay for her children's education.  Another goal is to improve the home where she and her children live.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and supplies

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary C. is 40 years old and married to a business man. The couple has five children, three of whom are in school. Mary sell fruits and vegetables and is requesting a loan of SDG400 to purchase more produce. Her future goal is to have a big house.

loans.use: to purchase more fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Rochel

texts.en:
Rochel S. is from the city of Malaubang Ozamiz City. She is 32 years old. Rochel is married and has two school-aged children. Rochel has a tricycle transport service. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 3000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. 

In 2008, Rochel joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to do business. Rochel has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC. Rochel is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase an additional vehicle for the business. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Rochel from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC: 

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishermen and small entrepreneurs. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase an additional vehicle for the business

loans.name: Mariluz

texts.es: Mariluz, de 34 años, es una madre muy amorosa y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su querido hijo Kyo de 3 años, al que cuida y educa en la localidad de Huayounioc. El negocio al que Mariluz se dedica es la venta de productos naturales, los cuales vende en la ciudad de Lima, donde viaja constantemente. Es una vendedora muy persuasiva y siempre consigue vender todos sus productos, ya que si no lo hace siente que la venta del día no fue fructífera y que al siguiente día tendrá que trabajar el doble. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es aconsejar a sus clientas sobre los remedios que necesitan, ya que muchos de ellos no son conocedores de los beneficios que tienen ciertas plantas naturales que crecen en nuestro país. Lleva 12 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día en su puesto de ventas, ya que permanece horas y horas en el calor y frío de las calles; es por eso que anhela tener con el tiempo una tienda donde pueda vender con más tranquilidad y comodidad. Su principal dificultad es la falta de capital de trabajo. Ya que tiene que invertir en la compra de diferentes plantas que se presentan ocasionalmente, porque son muy difíciles de encontrar. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Progreso Huayounioc”, y este es el tercer crédito con MFP, donde promete ser muy puntual en el pago de sus cuotas. En su asociación es una socia muy responsable y solidaria. Mariluz, invertirá el crédito solicitado en la compra de más productos naturales, para ofrecerles a sus clientes una mayor variedad de productos naturales que les servirá para que puedan aliviar sus dolencias.
texts.en: Mariluz, age 34, is a very loving and hard-working mother. She lives in her own house together with her beloved son Kyo, age 3, whom she cares for and educates in the town of Huayounioc. Mariluz's business is selling natural products, which she sells in the city of Lima, where she regularly travels. She is a very persuasive seller, and she is always able to sell all of her products, since if she does not do so she feels that the day's sales were not fruitful, and she will have to work twice as hard the next day. What she likes most about her work is advising her customers about the remedies they need, since many of them are not knowledgeable about the benefits of certain natural plants which grow in our country. She has done this work for 12 years, and she thinks the most difficult part is remaining all day at her sales stand, since she spends hours and hours in the heat and cold of the streets; for this reason, she hopes over time to have a store where she can sell with more comfort and peace of mind. Her main difficulty is the lack of working capital, since she has to invest in buying various plants when they appear occasionally, since they are very hard to find. She belongs to the “Progreso Huayounioc” communal bank, and this is her third loan with MFP, which she promises to pay back very punctually. In her association, she is known as a very responsible member with a strong sense of solidarity. Mariluz will invest the loan she is requesting in buying more natural products, so that she can offer her customers a broader variety of natural products which will help them to remedy their ailments.

loans.use: to stock up on natural products.

loans.name: Mariposas Group

texts.es:
Las Mariposas es un grupo solidario de Credituyo compuesto por 8 mujeres que esta en su primer ciclo.  Ellas pusieron este nombre al grupo simple y sencillamente, porque les gustan las mariposas. La mayoria de las mujeres de este grupo son comerciantes y se dedican a la venta de diversos productos como ropa, zapatos,  perfumes, joyas, y snacks.
 
Aurelia es una de las integrantes del grupo. La señora Aurelia tiene 66 años y 5 hijos. Todos sus hijos son trabajadores y trabajan como albañiles, en talleres mecanicos y como secretarias. Aurelia solia tener un puesto de hamburguesas que administraba junto con su esposo. Sin embargo, su esposo falleció recientemente y mantener el negocio abierto fue muy complicado para ella sola, sobre todo a causa de su diabetes. Es por eso que Aurelia decidió habilitar un cuarto de su casa para comenzar alli un negocio de snacks. En este actualmente solo vende tostadas, duritos y bollos (freezy pops). Con su crédito quiere comprar una olla electrica para derretir queso asi como los insumos necesarios para comenzar a vender nachos con queso así como otras frituras y botanas que son preparadas comunmente con queso derretido en la región.
texts.en:
Las Mariposas (The Butterflies) is a communal bank in Credituyo composed of 8 women; it’s in its first cycle.  They chose this simple name simply because they like butterflies.  Most of the women in this group are merchants and sell a variety of products like clothes, shoes, perfume, jewelry and snacks.

Aurelia is one of the members of the group.  She is 66 years old and has 5 children.  All her children work; some as bricklayers, others work in repair shops and as secretaries.  Aurelia used to have a hamburger stand that she ran with her husband.  However, her husband passed away recently and keeping the business going by herself was very difficult for her, especially because of her diabetes.

Because of this, Aurelia decided to refurbish a room in her house to start selling snacks.  Currently she only sells tostadas, duritos (crispy fried dough) and bollos (freezy pops).  She wants to use the loan to buy an electric pot to melt cheese as well as the necessary ingredients to start selling nachos with cheese and other fried food items and regional snacks that are commonly made with melted cheese.

loans.use: to buy utensils and merchandise for her business.

loans.name: Gulkair's Group

texts.en:
Gulkair, 42, is the leader of this group. Since her last years of high school, one of Gulkair’s big passions has been baking. “I’ve always loved to bake,” she said.  "Whenever I had a chance, I’d bake something unique for my children.” 

The revenue from the bakery that she opened by her house initially seemed to be enough; however, Gulkair soon realized that she needs an additional source of income. It wasn’t hard to decide what activity it would be: like any resident of Tup village, Gulkair could become a farmer. Ten years ago, Gulkair started cultivating her small but rich piece of land. The fertilizers, fuel, and seeds required the initial capital of 16 500 soms. Gulkair is still cultivating land every spring and gathering rich crops in the fall. This time she plans to plant more vegetables; therefore, she needs more fertilizers. It is with this purpose that she addresses the Kiva lenders. She hopes her efforts will be rewarded with rich harvest.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

 This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
 MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
 If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers.

loans.name: Fredy

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco “CRISTO ASENCION DE RUMICHACA”; el Banco Comunal se encuentra ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, Provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr; Fredy, el socio tiene 28 años de edad y es conviviente el socio tiene 1 hijo de 3 años de edad, el socio es músico de profesión y es también artesano, el socio elabora diferentes trabajos y muchos de ellos los compra ya hecho y los vende en Urubamba, el socio nos comenta que le apasiona la música razón por la cual lo llevo a formar su propio grupo musical siendo el  cantante principal; El socio desea invertir el crédito en la compra de equipo de sonido para sus presentaciones y solicita el préstamo para hacer realidad su sueño y mejorar su trabajo.

El socio agradece el préstamo que se le otorgara y se compromete en cumplir con los pagos de sus cuotas de manera disciplinada.
texts.en:
Fredy belongs to the communal bank, "Cristo Asención de Rumichaca."  It is located in the district and province of Urubamba in the department of Cusco.

Fredy is 28, has a live-in girlfriend, and has 1 son who is 3.  He is a musician by profession and also an artisan.  He makes various types of art and also buys some that are already made and sells them in Urubamba.  He tells us that he is passionate about music and started his own group of which he is the lead singer.  He hopes to invest his loan in the purchase of stereo equipment for his shows, and he is requesting a loan to make his dream a reality and to improve his work.

He is thankful for the loan that is being offered him and promises to comply with his payments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to invest in buying stereo equipment.
